Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Attention to Detail, Business Relationship Management, Customer Interaction, Customer Service, Decision-Making, Korean, Management Software, Presentation Skills, Presentations, Team Leadership
Job desc:
Job Description

Training new customer service team members
Using customer relationship management software (CRM) to document customer interactions
Monitoring average call length and overall team volume
Listening to individual calls to ensure quality
Leading performance reviews for team members
Creating intervention and improvement plans for team members
Creating reports for the director of customer services
Suggesting new procedures to improve customer service
Resolving escalated customer issues
Motivating the customer service team to meet goals

Job / Skills Competencies;
Proven work experience as a team leader or supervisor
Decision-making skills.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills in reporting and documentation.
Ability to understand/identify business processes and requirements.
Good attitude and aptitude with good communication and presentation skills.

Qualification;
Bachelor's Degree in a Relevant field
English (B2 level) with a combination of Japanese.
Graduate with 2-6 years of working experience, preferably with experience in leading team.

Job desc:
About Horizontal: Established since 2003 in the US, Horizontal solves complex challenges across two distinct businesses: Horizontal Digital and Horizontal Talent. We are consistently recognized for being a top workplace and one of the fastest growing private companies. Horizontal Talent specializes in staffing for IT, Digital & Creative and Business & Strategy markets. We have global offices in US, UAE, India, and Malaysia.

Job Decription

Processing & assessing of client data in various systems to verify and confirm on the correct information as per stipulated requirements. Users may need to manually process/rectify some exceptional cases. Assist other teams (volume surge/urgent task/etc) on ad-hoc basis as and when required.
Ensure that timeline and objectives as agreed with superior for any other assignments / projects / workarounds that may be assigned are met or exceeded.
Ensure 100% on-time implementation of impact plans and participate / drive / contribute in team activities.
Attend & get certified (OJT) to be qualified to commence processing and subsequently perform quality checks for the team.
Performs other responsibilities and duties periodically assigned by supervisor in order to meet operational and/or other requirements.

The above description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Skills: Customer Retention, IT Outsourcing, Japanese, Quality Control, Research, Service Delivery, Team Building, Team Leadership, User Requirements, Writing
Job desc:
Company Overview

Industry: Business Service Outsourcing (IT)

Location: Petaling Jaya, Selangor

Job Responsibilities

Provide service for IT, application infrastructure, and technical inquiries.
Provide technical input, solutions and monitor service delivery so it is compliance to budget, quality standards and end-user requirements
Manages the technical and service relationship between end-user and vendors
Works with key client representatives to retain customers and build business
Information Technology Outsourcing (ITO) service delivery generally be done remotely in company facility but may be performed at customer’s location when required

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Proficiency in Japanese language (speak, read and writing)
Entry-level or intermediate-level certificate in IT work field is an added advantage
Fresh graduate, industry player keen to venture into IT are welcome


Benefits

Monthly allowance: language, shift and internet
Training will be provided
Hybrid working mode
Various internal opportunity and great for long-term career path


Apply online or feel free to contact me directly for more information about this opportunity. Due to the high volume of applicants, we regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Thank you for your understanding.

Skills: Analytical Skills, C#, Cascading Style Sheets (CSS), Code Design, Databases, Microservices, NUnit, Software Design, Software Development, Web Services
Job desc:
The candidate will be part of the Development team which is responsible to re-define the customer experience. The domain of work will be around the company’s ecommerce website. Expectation from the candidate is for strong technical and analytical skills. Candidate should also be ready to take up a mentor role or lead the team and drive the team’s strategy and define the success parameters for the team members and company’s business.

Key Responsibilities

Building public Web Services such as REST, SOAP.
Building micro services in .NET core, Pivotal Cloud Foundry or other cloud platforms.
Building applications in most of the following -Web API, .Net core, C#, .Net Framework, Web Services, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, SOAP, REST, Jquery
Working with SQL and NoSQL Databases such as MS-SQL, MongoDB, CassandraDB
CICD using GitLab
Writing Unit Tests and ensuring 100% coverage of Functional Tests
Applying Object Oriented Principles and Design Patterns in software development and engineering.

Essential Requirements

6+ years of total software/IT engineering/code development experience. Out of this at least 5+ in the relevant technologies
Experience building public Web Services such as REST, SOAP.
Experience in building micro services in .NET core, Pivotal Cloud Foundry or other cloud platforms.
Expertise in most of the following -Web API, .Net core, C#, .Net Framework, Web Services, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, JavaScript Frameworks, JSON, SOAP, REST, Jquery
Experience with SQL and NoSQL Databases such as MS-SQL, MongoDB, CassandraDB
Experience in CICD using GitLab, TeamCity, Jenkins or similar Tool
Unit Testing (NUnit, XUnit, MS Tests or similar Testing Framework)
Object Oriented Principles and Design Patterns
Have depth and width of decision making maturity. Be able to gain trust & respect of engineering, dependents teams and stakeholders to deliver results
Ability to manage and influence team members without direct reporting authority
Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment; work with minimal supervision while delivering on action items in a timely fashion

Desirable Requirements: Familiarity with Agile/SCRUM development methodologies and software development lifecycle principles.

The above description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Project Support

Promote Standardization

Job title: IT Internal Control Analyst - KL - Permanent
Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Microsoft Excel, Analytical Skills, Business Intelligence (BI), Critical Thinking, Internal Controls, Performance Metrics, Project Evaluation, SAP Products, Strategic Analysis, Supply Chain Management
Job desc:
Our partner, a global leading international firm is looking for an IT Internal Control Analyst to join the Global Business Services Finance department and report to the Business Controls Manager. As an Internal control analyst, you will support the development of the overall role of the Business Controls Team as a second line of defence within the organisation Perform SOx testing and report to the SOx Test Manager to agreed timelines (including in the space of IT processes).


Accountabilities:
Communicate issues noted from SOx testing to key stakeholders in a timely manner.
Support Control Owners to develop remediation plans and address issues in a timely manner.
Track and report on outstanding actions relating to SOx findings.
Ensuring all work is fully documented in line with the BCT Methodology and the SOx Testing process, reflecting current good practices in internal controls.
Certain elements of Controls Advisory and Assurance work will need to be completed in line with Audit Standards to enable reliance from External Audit.
Support and participate in the delivery of training to Control Operators and Owners to support the effectiveness of internal controls over financial reporting across the Group.
To assist in the delivery of the Three Lines of Defence model within the organisation's Internal Controls Framework.



Skills Required:
3-5 years of risk internal controls or audit experience with a significant accounting firm or corporate industry experience.
Experience in global FMCG or similar dynamic operating environments.
Good knowledge of internal controls practices, principles and procedures and corporate governance requirements for a global Group, including Internal Controls over Financial Reporting (ICoFR).
Understanding of Risk Management and Internal Controls best practices.
experience in one or more core business functions, including operations, marketing, finance, and IT.
Knowledge practices best practice, testing and reporting approaches.
Effective verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate control issues, risk, impact, and recommendations to management.
Experience in internal or external audit, or other SOx testing of IT processes, and able to identify control recommendations to address the issue.
Experience in IT Audit (internal or external), IT general Controls (ITGC) or other IT SOx testing spread across IT domains (access, program change, program development, computer operations, cyber security), and able to identify control gaps and provide a recommendation to address the issue.



If you or anyone you know might be the right fit for this role; please get in touch for further discussion.

Job desc:
Description:

level 2 support team and responsible to support CWOS(SAP Fieldglass) application, VMS and have access to workers confidential data and other companies confidential data.

Need to have SQL knowledge to run query on CWOS database.

Job tasks include perform troubleshooting on unable to login SAP Fieldglass issue, worker information not updated, worker information displayed wrongly, perform false update the worker SOW, worker WWID not generated and other SAP Fieldglass related issues.

Candidate need to work together with other support team to resolve Purchase Order amount discrepancies in downstream applications.

Requirement (must have) :

Candidate will possess SAP Fieldglass functional knowledge, basic SQL and Servicenow Cloud knowledge

Working hours: 8am-5.30pm Mon-Fri PG12, oncall during weekday public holiday support is required

Job title: Business Analyst/Sr. Business Analyst- SAP SD/FICO
Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Business Analysis, Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), SAP ERP, SAP FICO, SAP Products, SAP Sales & Distribution, SAP-SD
Job desc:
WHAT'S THE ROLE?
In your role as IT Business Analyst for SAP Sales & Distribution & also FICO, you will provide professional advice and are responsible for transferring business requirements into implementations. You will contribute to build digital solutions in our application landscape, which combines mobile applications and cloud-based solutions with a backend based on SAP S/4HANA.

WHAT YOU NEED IS:

SD Business Analyst
You bring ideally two or more years of experience as a Business Analyst in a distributed Agile Software Development setting (experience utilizing agile delivery processes and tool chain) and experience in SAP ERP modules like SD


FICO Business Analyst
At least 3-5 years of experience as SAP FICO Consultant in SAP ERP 6.0 environment / S/4HANA in the following areas: Finance (General Ledger, AR, AA) including interfaces with external systems (e.g. tax reporting, e-billing). Basic understanding of tax accounting and technical skills in ABAP is beneficial.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: CENELEC, COMOS, Microsoft Office, Oil & Gas, PAGA, PDMS, Petrochemical, Telecommunications, UHF, VSAT
Job desc:
Education/knowledge/skills:
Possess a degree or Master in Telecommunication Engineering (preferred); or
Possess a degree or Master or equivalent in Electrical / Electronics Engineering
9-14 years’ experience in the Oil and Gas/ Petrochemicals Industry, Engineering or EPCIC background preferred.
Hands- on experiences in preparing Design Philosophies
Hands-on Experience as Package Engineer in Major Telecommunication Packages i.e. VSAT system, DMR, Fiber Optic Backbone, Tropo system, PAGA system, PABX system
Extensive experience with Telecommunication software for radio path loss calculation, audio system coverage study, VHF/UHF radio coverage study, WIFI wireless coverage study, network system load calculation, marine radar coverage study, etc.
Familiar with Telecommunication engineering / database software i.e. COMOS
Extensive knowledge in Microsoft Office, Design and Drafting tools
Extensive knowledge with international Oil and Gas codes and standards, i.e. CAP, CENELEC, ICAO, IEC, IMO/SOLAS, ISO, ITU-T, ITU-R, OSHA, PFEER, UKOOA, UL
Extensive knowledge with international Oil and Gas company standards, i.e. SHELL DEP, PETRONAS PTS Guidelines, Statoil guidelines, NORSOK
Extensive experience with engineering and design deliverables, i.e. location layout, wiring diagram
Experience in leading small project team preferred
Experience in negotiating with internal customer and/or client to achieve desired results
Ability to provide explanation on concepts, approaches and impacts in a non-technical way to junior team members and clients
Registered as Professional Engineer with BEM / IEM (Malaysian) (Preferred)
Registered as Chartered Engineer (Foreigner) (Preferred)

Actions/ Tasks:
Review / Develop philosophies / datasheets / specifications for various Telecommunication equipment, i.e. PAGA system, DMR radio, UHF/VHF radio, CCTV, VSAT system, Radar system, Weather monitoring system, PABX system, LAN, NDB system, Tropo system, Fiber Optic backbone, etc.
Review Telecom Overall Block Diagram and Radio & Telecom Room Layout
Review Telecom database / Index
Review Telecom Design Deliverables Location/routing Layout, Interconnection drawings, etc.
Review vendor drawings / documents for various telecommunication equipment.
Review / work on various software for Path loss calculation, Audio and Radio coverage etc.
Review / Prepare Telecommunication inputs to Weight Data Report, and Power / Heat Dissipation Report
Review PDMS model
Inter-discipline liaison for input/ output , which includes IDC reviews, gathering information from disciplines and other tasks required to complete the work
Participate in Safety Studies, HAZID etc.
Prepare/response to Material Requisition / Technical Bid Clarification / Technical Bid Evaluation
Assist to review work responsibilities of the Telecommunication discipline personnel and the manpower requirements for the project
Assist in the preparation of commissioning, operating and maintenance manuals as required by the project
Assist in preparing MDR

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Briefing, Campaigns, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Key Performance Indicators, Negotiation, RPO, Recruiting, Sales, Talent Assessment, Talent Sourcing
Job desc:
The Opportunity

We are seeking self-motivated Staffing/Recruitment Consultants with an entrepreneurial mindset to be part of our growing business in Kuala Lumpur Malaysia. The right candidate is someone who wants to be at the forefront of growing and developing a business while leveraging our vast network of regional relationships.

This role will own the end-to-end recruitment process and partner closely with clients to develop talent sourcing and attraction strategies for mid-to-senior hires. We aim to deliver a great experience for both our clients and candidates that lends genuine insight into our culture.

Key Responsibilities:
Achieving revenue targets and meeting individual and team KPIs in a fast moving, competitive sales environment
Identifying, developing and managing client business relationships together with selling our recruitment services and negotiating the rates of business.
Develop and implement short and long-term recruitment campaigns as well as deliver service, quality and results
Selecting candidates for appropriate positions, arranging interviews and fully briefing candidates on the company and role
Taking responsibility for candidate care and keeping in regular contact with our candidates


Be Part of Our Journey

As a people-centric business, we recognize the hard work and diligence our consultants invest in clients and candidates and we understand the value of investing in our people, infrastructure and training. We offer our team a unique regional career development opportunity and a highly competitive salary and commission structure.

We are happy to discuss confidentially with fresh graduate, experienced Consultants, Team Managers or Principal Consultants who wants to take leadership over one of our core specialisms.


About Us

Kingfisher Recruitment Group is a global provider of Executive Search, Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO) and Leadership / Talent Assessment Solutions. Established since 2003, we help clients design people strategies, attract and develop talents worldwide across Healthcare / Life Sciences, Technology, Retail / Luxury / FMCG, Manufacturing, Automobile, Property & Construction and Engineering industries. With offices in China (Shanghai, Beijing & Suzhou), Singapore, Malaysia and Netherlands, our team of 100+ consultants specialize in specific industry and functional scope which enables us to provide in-depth market knowledge along with a high-touch recruitment service for our clients.

The Opportunity


We are seeking self-motivated Staffing/Recruitment Consultants with an entrepreneurial mindset to be part of our growing business in Kuala Lumpur Malaysia. The right candidate is someone who wants to be at the forefront of growing and developing a business while leveraging our vast network of regional relationships.


This role will own the end-to-end recruitment process and partner closely with clients to develop talent sourcing and attraction strategies for mid-to-senior hires. We aim to deliver a great experience for both our clients and candidates that lends genuine insight into our culture.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Achieving revenue targets and meeting individual and team KPIs in a fast moving, competitive sales environment
  • Identifying, developing and managing client business relationships together with selling our recruitment services and negotiating the rates of business.
  • Develop and implement short and long-term recruitment campaigns as well as deliver service, quality and results
  • Selecting candidates for appropriate positions, arranging interviews and fully briefing candidates on the company and role
  • Taking responsibility for candidate care and keeping in regular contact with our candidates



Be Part of Our Journey


As a people-centric business, we recognize the hard work and diligence our consultants invest in clients and candidates and we understand the value of investing in our people, infrastructure and training. We offer our team a unique regional career development opportunity and a highly competitive salary and commission structure.


We are happy to discuss confidentially with fresh graduate, experienced Consultants, Team Managers or Principal Consultants who wants to take leadership over one of our core specialisms.



About Us


Kingfisher Recruitment Group is a global provider of Executive Search, Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO) and Leadership / Talent Assessment Solutions. Established since 2003, we help clients design people strategies, attract and develop talents worldwide across Healthcare / Life Sciences, Technology, Retail / Luxury / FMCG, Manufacturing, Automobile, Property & Construction and Engineering industries. With offices in China (Shanghai, Beijing & Suzhou), Singapore, Malaysia and Netherlands, our team of 100+ consultants specialize in specific industry and functional scope which enables us to provide in-depth market knowledge along with a high-touch recruitment service for our clients.

Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Work closely with teams designing and building systems realizing this vision.
Provide exceptional customer focus and ability to work with stakeholders to build a scalable monitoring system for IoT endpoints such as temperature sensors.
Constantly deliver solid, secure, performant code, contribute to the design of backend APIs and need to be comfortable diving into IoT, networking and identity/access technologies to accurately understand and influence experiences are hoping to light up.
Work in close partnership with Hawkeye team, cross-functional teams and management.
Perform any task or duties requested by the direct reporting manager.


Job Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, or a related field.
Experience in managing a software development team.
Familiarity with modern programming languages such as Java, Python.
2+ years of experience developing object-oriented software and hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between.
Experience engineering large scale distributed systems is strongly preferred.


Apply online or feel free to contact me directly for more information about this opportunity.

Due to the high volume of applicants, we regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Thank you for your understanding.

Skills: Communication, English, Analytical Skills, Digital Marketing, Marketing, Online Marketing, Recognition Programs, Sales, Search Engine Marketing (SEM), Vietnamese
Job desc:
#BeMore!

Do you aspire for a rewarding career that lets you do more and achieve more? Unleash your full potential at work with TDCX, an award-winning and fast-growing BPO company.

Work with the world’s most loved brands and be with awesome, diverse people. Be home, belong, and start your journey to #BeMore!

Top reasons to work with TDCX:

Attractive remuneration, great perks, and performance incentives
Comprehensive medical, insurance, or social security coverage
Premium workspaces
Engaging activities and recognition programs
Strong learning and development plans for your career growth
Positive culture for you to #BeMore at work
Easy to locate area with direct access to public transport
Flexible working arrangements
Be coached and mentored by experts in your field
Join a global company with 26 years of experience and 350+ industry awards

What is your mission?

As a Digital Marketing Campaign Consultant, you will be working with our Global Internet Leader Account to deliver #happier customer experience. Devise and run marketing campaigns for products, services or events that target consumers or other businesses. Usually working under a head of marketing but managing a marketing team, campaign managers oversee campaigns in a variety of formats.

You are also required to perform these job functions:

Respond to customer support inquiries in accordance with training provided, standards and policies, including to supply diagnosis, resolution, and tracking of end user issues based on guidelines, documentation and scripts provided.
Serve as a trusted consultant with customers to onboard, develop and optimize advertiser’s campaigns.
Detect and understand the customer’s needs and objectives.
Be responsible for increasing spend, upsell and sustainability.
Handle a high volume of potential clients on a daily basis through phone calls.
Any other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned to you by the management from time to time, within your category of employment in the organization and for the effective implementation, maintenance and continual improvement of the ISO9001 and ISO18295-1 Quality Management System of TDCX.

Who are we looking for?

Possess at least Bachelor’s Degree in any field; for Diplomas' you should have at least 5 years of full-time experience
At least 2 years of full-time experience in sales and/or online marketing
Is analytical and has a logical mindset
Has strong communicative skills and a flair for selling creative market solutions
Works in an organized and structured manner
Has a creative mindset and a good understanding of customer needs
Speaks native Vietnamese language, good at English

Who is TDCX?

TDCX (NYSE: TDCX) provides transformative digital CX solutions, enabling world-leading and disruptive brands to acquire new customers, build customer loyalty, and protect their online communities.

TDCX helps clients, including many of the world’s best brands, achieve their customer experience aspirations by harnessing technology, human intelligence, and our global footprint. We serve clients in fintech, gaming, technology, home sharing and travel, digital advertising and social media, streaming, and e-commerce. Our expertise and strong footprint in Asia have made us a trusted partner for clients, particularly high-growth, new economy companies looking to tap the region’s growth potential.

We pride ourselves on discovering and employing the best professionals to join us as we transform the outsourced CX industry. Our commitment to #BeMore for our people, our clients, and our community has led to us winning more than 350 industry awards, including being one of the best companies to work for in Asia.

From our first-rate workspaces, above-industry-average compensation packages, career opportunities, to our workplace perks, find out what else is in store when you embark on a career with TDCX.

Skills: Communication, English, Business Development, Executive Search, Marketing, Negotiation, Pre-screening, Recruiting, Sales, Sales Processes
Job desc:
Job Description
As an Executive Recruitment Consultant, you will be head-hunting candidates for our prestigious client base (multinationals and large companies).
You will develop your own client base within one of the specialized divisions (Professional, Technology, Industrial, Consumer Goods or Health) through business development.
You will build strong network and connections at a managerial level, with your clients as well as candidates.
You will be involved in the complete recruitment process together with the clients.
You will assess each candidate’s suitability for a job opening through thorough pre-screening and interviewing before proposing them to clients.
You are also get involved in negotiating pay and salary rates and finalizing arrangements between clients and candidates.
You will build long-lasting business relationships with both clients and candidates whilst reaching targets.
You will develop your Industry knowledge while getting involved in social media and networking activities.

Requirements
Minimum 0-2 years of experience in the following areas: Business, consultancy, finance, marketing, business development, sales, accounting, IT, engineering, legal, health, etc.
A sales attitude is a MUST, preferably with sales experience
A positive can-do attitude with a high level of energy and ambition
Self-confident & ambitious
Good communication skills
A strong interest in people
Can work independently, or as part of an energetic, exciting team of like-minded individuals
Bachelor’s degree or higher from leading Malaysian university
Studied abroad or overseas experience preferred
Fluent English, both oral and written, is a MUST
Professionally presented

Skills: English, Microsoft Excel, Applicant Tracking Systems, Hiring, Mandarin, Manufacturing, Recruiting, Semiconductors, Team Building, Training
Job desc:
About the role
As one of our Recruiters, you will partner with hiring managers, define their hiring strategy, build candidate pipelines, and grow our client teams. This is a full life cycle, high volume, remote recruiter role.

You will:
● Partner closely with client leadership to deeply understand their teams and hiring needs building strong candidate pipelines.
● Act as a talent advisor and subject matter expert for leadership
● Take a data-driven strategy to provide insights into the health of the hiring pipeline, provide direction, and training to partners
● Contribute to growth by proactively developing and refining processes and serving as a thought partner for the rest of the team
● Source and identify passive candidates to build teams through the use of boolean, online tools, and unique sourcing techniques
● Identify new ways to build awareness of the client in new hiring markets

You are:
● A believer that there is more to sourcing than LinkedIn
● Able to segment clients to discern relevant requirements given their current growth trajectory
● Intuitive and methodical, able to determine the different skill sets that allow a candidate to excel in each specific role
● Driven to find solutions and build programs that result in attracting great talent at all levels
● Famous for being an amazing partner to your candidates and hiring teams

You have:
● Full cycle recruitment experience required; preferably with experience hiring within the APAC region
● Semiconductor recruiting experience required
● High-tech Manufacturing or Light Industrial experience preferred
● English and Mandarin written and spoken professional proficiency
● A desire to represent yourself and the client with integrity and courtesy
● An understanding of recruiting metrics and how to utilize them to influence hiring decisions
● Previous startup and/or agency experience and an unwavering ability to work in a fast-paced environment
● Experience with ATS applications
● Experience with G Suite
● Must be residing in Malaysia

Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Location: Pasir Gudang, Johor
Business Nature: Manufacturing Company for chemicals
Plan and prepare Master planning including issue Job Card after received order from Operation Department by NAV ERP system
Communicate & coordinate with Operation, Store, Purchasing and supervisor base on capacity feasible schedule
Always monitor stock levels, especially common stock in the warehouse so that planning can run smoothly.
Ensure all production related activities are done according to quality procedures and work instruction.
Ensure all production related activities are done according to safety procedures and work instruction.
Ensure all production related activities are done at optimum level by minimizing waste, reducing time taken to complete a job and any other method without compromising quality and safety.
Carry out instruction given by HOD which is according to company interest.
Prepare production report if there is a product failure in production to HOD
Authorized to screen subordinate leave application, gate pass application and overtime application before submitting to HOD
Monitor housekeeping (5S) which is sensitive to the cleanliness of the environment
Assist HOD/Production Manager on continual improvement program.


Job Requirements

Diploma/ Bachelor's Degree in related field
1-2 years related experience

Location: Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Cloud Computing
Job desc:
job responsibilities:
Develop a general overall understanding of the product vision and business needs to work on product requirements for determining functional and non-functional aspects while creating appropriate solutions in a collaborative manner.
Draft high-level product specifications and deliver code with attention to system integrity, feasibility, quality, security, maintainability and modularity.
Champion usage of appropriate technology and define succinct workflows for adhering to coding standards.
Shoulder production escalations alongside reliability team and strive for time bound resolution of customer issues.
Participate actively in peer review discussions of requirements, specifications, designs, code and other artifacts.
Learn skills and adopt practices to develop innovative and cutting-edge software products in-line with IBM’s high technical standards.
Drive improvements in development tools and adherence to technologies with inputs from internal teams and external developer communities.
Basic Qualifications:
BS/MS in Computer Science/Engineering or related discipline/experience.
8 - 10 years of software development experience.
Well versed in Computer Science fundamentals in data structures, algorithm design and problem solving
Deep understanding of Unix/Linux internals and TCP/IP socket programming.
Intermediate to advanced proficiency in the following programming languages: C++, Golang, Python and Shell Scripting.
Familiarity with using GIT, Jenkins, Makefile, gdb and gcov.
A passion towards solving complex problems with ability to demonstrate strong debugging/troubleshooting skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Job desc:
Hi,

Greetings from Nityo Infotech!
It was a pleasure speaking with you,
Please find the detailed Job description for your reference. IF Interested please share your updated Resume.
Designation: Business Development Executive/ Manager
Hiring Company : Nityo Infotech Pvt Limited
Work Location - Nityo Infotech service Sdn bhd 35-01 ( west wing), Q sentral, jalan stesen sentral 2, Kualalumpur sentral, 50470
Timing :- 9AM – 6:00 PM WFO

Total Work Experience Required- 2+year in BDE/ BDM
Salary- as per standard


About Nityo Infotech:

• We are CMML5 Company
• ISO 27001:2013 Certified
• Established in 2006, Nityo Infotech Corporation is the fastest growing IT Services Company. We have presence in 30+ countries.
• Our Headquarter is located at Plainsboro, New Jersey, United States of America. We have a strong presence in USA, Canada, UK, Germany, France, Spain, Italy, Poland, Ukraine, Turkey, India, Australia, New Zealand, Japan, Korea, Hong Kong, Taiwan, China, Srilanka, Macau, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Philippines, Indonesia and Vietnam. We have a highly skilled global workforce of 15,500+.
• Nityo provides services to several clients located across the globe, including many Fortune 500 and Global 2000 companies, in the commercial, industrial and government sectors - across key vertical markets, like Banking & Financial Services, Manufacturing & Semiconductor, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Retail, Telecommunications and Utilities etc.,
• Please visit our website to know more about our company - www.Nityo.com


Key Responsibilities:
• To identify business potential across sectors like BFSI, Retail, Banking, Telecom, ICT, Shipping and Logistics, Retail, Manufacturing, FMCG etc.
• Responsible for end-to-end process from client acquisition for permanent staffing/Contract positions to Client Servicing and Management to ensuring receipt of payments
• Responsible for generation of revenue from new business or improving existing business
• Responsible for selling IT Solutions and Products of our organization to clients based in APAC region.

• Responsible for the offshore recruitment team and relationship managers to generate quality results and achieving targets
• Build and maintain rapport with the New & Existing clients, Accountable for all client proposals, contracts, RFPs, escalations, queries and any further documentation.
• Building the Nityo Brand - marking Nityo’s presence in Singapore.
• Responsible for end-to-end process from gathering requirement from the client to driving the recruitment team to service the requirement and deployment of the candidate
• To be able to take Sales Target for Permanent placement and contracting placements and achieve them with end to end ownership.

Skills Required:
• Should be able to take and Achieve Sales Targets
• Must be smart, aggressive and a go-getter
• Excellent Communication Skills

Thanks and regards,
Ritu Choudhary
Executive Technical Resource
Nityo Infotech Service Pvt Ltd
Contact no. - 60327796432
Email id - ritu.choudhary@nityo.com

Total Work Experience Required- 2+year in BDE/ BDM

Salary- as per standard



About Nityo Infotech:


• We are CMML5 Company

• ISO 27001:2013 Certified

• Established in 2006, Nityo Infotech Corporation is the fastest growing IT Services Company. We have presence in 30+ countries.

• Our Headquarter is located at Plainsboro, New Jersey, United States of America. We have a strong presence in USA, Canada, UK, Germany, France, Spain, Italy, Poland, Ukraine, Turkey, India, Australia, New Zealand, Japan, Korea, Hong Kong, Taiwan, China, Srilanka, Macau, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Philippines, Indonesia and Vietnam. We have a highly skilled global workforce of 15,500+.

• Nityo provides services to several clients located across the globe, including many Fortune 500 and Global 2000 companies, in the commercial, industrial and government sectors - across key vertical markets, like Banking & Financial Services, Manufacturing & Semiconductor, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Retail, Telecommunications and Utilities etc.,

• Please visit our website to know more about our company - www.Nityo.com



Key Responsibilities:

• To identify business potential across sectors like BFSI, Retail, Banking, Telecom, ICT, Shipping and Logistics, Retail, Manufacturing, FMCG etc.

• Responsible for end-to-end process from client acquisition for permanent staffing/Contract positions to Client Servicing and Management to ensuring receipt of payments

• Responsible for generation of revenue from new business or improving existing business

• Responsible for selling IT Solutions and Products of our organization to clients based in APAC region.


• Responsible for the offshore recruitment team and relationship managers to generate quality results and achieving targets

• Build and maintain rapport with the New & Existing clients, Accountable for all client proposals, contracts, RFPs, escalations, queries and any further documentation.

• Building the Nityo Brand - marking Nityo’s presence in Singapore.

• Responsible for end-to-end process from gathering requirement from the client to driving the recruitment team to service the requirement and deployment of the candidate

• To be able to take Sales Target for Permanent placement and contracting placements and achieve them with end to end ownership.


Skills Required:

• Should be able to take and Achieve Sales Targets

• Must be smart, aggressive and a go-getter

• Excellent Communication Skills


Thanks and regards,

Ritu Choudhary

Executive Technical Resource

Nityo Infotech Service Pvt Ltd

Contact no. - 60327796432

Email id - ritu.choudhary@nityo.com

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, Business Development, Business-to-Business (B2B), Cold Calling, Inside Sales, Sales, Sales Consulting, Sales Growth, Telemarketing
Job desc:
Grow into a leadership role here at this Tech company by starting your sales career with us. If this excites you, then you are exactly who we are looking for!

You will directly impact the revenue of the company with your sales achievements. We celebrate your successes and we learn together from the failures. Whether you're driven by money, recognition or even the experience of dealing with different companies, sales is probably the most exciting and well rewarded role out there.

Job Responsibilities:

Hiredly’s sales team consists of two divisions. As part of the Inside Sales Team you will need to:-
Acquire an in depth understanding of the product range, markets, as well as our customer needs and requirements
Grab sales opportunities by the horns by means of cold calling and networking
Drive sales growth to achieve individual sales targets
Contact potential and existing clients to inform them about the company’s products and services
Understand your clients’ concerns and needs, and strategically propose the appropriate solutions to them to close sales
Develop and implement concepts on how to maintain client relationships by providing support and guidance to your clients
Scout for potential prospects and sales leads to increase client database and create new business opportunities

Job Requirements:
Proven experience as telesales representative or other sales/customer service role (We are open to candidates with experience in B2C and B2B sales)
Proven track record of successfully meeting sales quota, preferably over the phone
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Confidence to engage in productive conversations with your clients over the phone via cold calling to help them solve their recruitment challenges
Sales-driven, aggressive, proactive and able to work under pressure
Enjoy engaging with people and possess an inquisitive mind to understand client needs

Skills: Cybersecurity, ISO 27001, Information Security, Information Security Governance, Information Security Management System (ISMS), NIST, Network Security, Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS), Risk Management, Security Risk
Job desc:
About the client:
Our client is a leading solutions provider for the telco industry. As part of expansion of the team, they are now looking for a AM/Manager of Governance & Risk Control.


As the AM/M of Governance & Risk Control., the Job Responsibilities include:
Identify information security risks and perform the required assessments to evaluate the risks to the organisation, in line with enterprise and cyber/information security risk frameworks
Develop and recommend the control requirements to reduce identified information security risks
Assess the effectiveness of controls against risk indicators and reports any emerging or increasing risk
Develops and maintains and up-to-date risk register and tracks and reports all risk treatment plans
Develops and reports on all key risks indicators (KRI), risk profiles and emerging risks
Drive certification programs such as ISO 27001, and maturity assessments by collaborating and guiding the various stakeholders towards achieving compliance/re-certifications
Assist with the development of the cybersecurity strategy and the key activities required to achieve them

The successful applicant requires:
Information Security/Cybersecurity (5-6) years
Information Security Governance (5-6 years)
Information Security Risk & Compliance Management (5-6 years)
Good understanding of Information Security Governance Principles, Information Security Risk Management processes
Practical knowledge of Information & Telco Security standards, regulations, and best practices (these include ISO 27001, NIST, PDPA, GSMA, ITUT, 3GPP, PCI-DSS, etc.)
Degree in Information Technology, Cyber Security or equivalent

For more information or confidential consultation, please do not hesitate to contact May Suan at +603 7735 6213 or at maysuan.wong@bell-ward.com.

Skills: Graduate Recruitment, HR Management, Organizational Psychology, People Management, Project Management, Recruiting, Social Sciences, Strategic Human Resource Planning, Talent Development, Talent Management
Job desc:
Job Summary
This role requires you to plan, develop and implement various talent management strategy to accelerate the development of in-house talent programs at HABIB Group. You will be responsible in establishing a strong leadership pipeline for the young talents and emerging leaders in order to support the Group’s business strategies and objectives.

Job Responsibilities
Work closely with internal stakeholders to design and develop talent management framework and processes, specifically for the in-house talent programs
Involve in the end-to-end young talents’ recruitment process including sourcing, screening and shortlisting, interviewing, onboarding and offboarding
Maintain positive relationship with all internal and external stakeholders for the development of talents’ career growth and program sustainability.
Collaborate with Learning partners to establish and implement training modules with appropriate evaluation tools to measure program’s effectiveness.
Constantly keep up-to-date with future skills demand to align with the talent development strategies and build the talent pipeline.
Organise and facilitate on talent engagement activity to facilitate on talents’ career aspirations, developments, rotations and placements.
Identify and develop effective employee retention strategy in the job enrichment and job enlargement initiatives to maximise talents’ job satisfaction.
Position the in-house talent programs as one of the preferred programs for young talents and emerging leaders.

Job Requirements
Possess at least Bachelor's Degree in Human Resource Management, Business Studies, Psychology or its equivalent.
Preferably 2 - 3 years’ work experience related to Human Resources, Talent Management, Recruitment or relevant fields.
Good knowledge in Talent Assessments tools and ability to apply assessment results for improvement and succession planning.
Basic consultive and diagnostic skills with proven project management skills will be an added advantage
Interpersonal, influencing, presence and flexibility to work effectively with people at all levels of the Group.
People oriented, pleasant personality and able to work effectively with all levels
Excellent written and verbal communication in Malay and English languages, additional languages will be an advantage.

Interested candidate may click the "APPLY" button!

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, Problem Solving, Attention to Detail, Boolean Searching, Creative Problem Solving, Human Resources (HR), Organization Skills, Relevance, Screening, Solver
Job desc:
About Horizontal
Founded in 2003 and headquartered in Minneapolis-US, Horizontal solves complex challenges across two distinct businesses: Horizontal Digital and Horizontal Talent. We are consistently recognized for being a top workplace and one of the fastest growing private companies in the United States.

At Horizontal Talent, our mission is to provide unmatched service and support: the best talent for our clients, the best opportunities for our consultants, and a rewarding experience for our employees. Our definition of success means building lasting partnerships where we combine innovative solutions, exceptional talent and best in class companies. Learn more about what makes Horizontal Talent different.

Horizontal Talent specializes in staffing for IT, Digital Marketing & Creative and business & strategy markets. We have more than 250 employees across twelve global offices in US, UAE, India and Malaysia.

Let’s talk about you
We are seeking a self-motivated, detail oriented and sales minded individual with a competitive
edge. This individual will play an integral role in developing Horizontal Talent’s pipeline of talent
and will be responsible for delivery highly qualified candidates for multiple positions. The ideal
candidate is self-motivated, highly organized and a proactive problem solver who is passionate
about delivering a first-class recruitment experience for candidates and external clients.

What you’ll do:
Good understanding of local hiring market for the relevant technology skillsets.
Qualify and thorough comprehension of the jobs and requirements from clients.
Responsible to developing and executing strategies to identify, source, and attract high quality technology professionals. Positions will include: developers, architects, project managers, programmers and product managers, creative, UX, marketing, and more.
Responsible for managing the full recruitment cycle and meeting defined recruiting metrics for quality, cost, cycle time, diversity, and compliance/risk all while providing a world class recruitment experience for your candidates and assigned business partners throughout the hiring process.
Will be supporting several open positions at one time.
Screen, interview, perform reference checks, and prepare candidate profiles for submission
Present appropriate candidates, track/report candidate status via our ATS, coordinate interview process, update candidates on feedback, address issues, maintain database information, updated applicable candidates’ files, present offers ensuring all details are complete, conduct salary negotiations for consultants.
Create and maintain a quality candidate pipeline for selected skills and technologies with a concentration on attracting and retaining quality.
Build new relationships with candidates and apply retention program. Senior recruiter may act as specialist career coach towards candidates.
Ability to work under pressure, prioritize appropriately, meets deadlines and juggle simultaneous demands.
Achieve quarterly, monthly and weekly Recruiter targets and objectives.

What you bring:
Degree/ Diploma in the subject of relevance
2+ years of experience working in a fast-paced environment and have a background in sales support, customer service, IT/Tech or staffing.
Must be highly organized with attention to detail.
Strong written and verbal communication skills; and an effective communicator.
Previous experience with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Excel, and Adobe.
Experience with sourcing tools and techniques such as online social networking, traditional networking, Boolean searches, and LinkedIn strongly preferred.

Competencies Required
Result Oriented
Self-Driven & Determination
Organizing Skills with Attention to Details
Creative Problem Solver
Client/ Service Focus

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV

Skills: Help Desk Support, Incident Management, Information Technology, Mandarin, Networking, Service Desk, Service-Level Agreements (SLA), Shooting Video, Tech-savvy, Troubleshooting
Job desc:
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Effectively resolve Level 1 service desk technical queries as per deliverables outlined
Provide remote support to local and oversea user when connected by calls, email or chat when users are facing issue with their computer system.
Asking relevant questions to resolve typically known problems within required timescales
Ensure appropriate documentation of the interaction with the customer in the prescribed format
Ability to communicate clearly and able to provide guidance by giving instruction when performing troubleshooting to identify or resolve the technical issues remotely.
Explain to Clients through a series of actions either face to face or over the telephone to help set up systems or resolve issues.
Ensure that performance parameters are met to meet SLA targets
Ability to clearly transfer technical knowledge to knowledge base, colleagues, and the Customers.
Any ad hoc duties assign by the Company from time to time.


JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Must be able to speak and write fluent Mandarin language as role requires candidate to deal with the clients in China.
Technical knowledge/expertise to support technical related queries and trouble shooting.
Minimum 1+ years’ experience in a Level 1 service desk or technical support process providing remote support for Laptops / Desktops / LAN Issues / Application etc.
Minimum degree / diploma is required
Proven experience in commercial in bound telephony systems typically used in Contact Center.
Willingness to work in rotational shifts (earlier is 6am and latest is 11pm, Monday to Sunday including public holiday)
5 days per week with shift changes monthly between teams.
Good support knowledge of Windows Operating systems, general standard knowledge on off the shelves software like Microsoft Office and etc.
Knowledge on basic concepts of networking.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: SAP XI
Job desc:
Job Summary:
OSIsoft’s PI application is used throughout the Upstream business to support data acquisition and surveillance workflows. PI captures data from a multitude of sources (L3 DCS, manual input, flat file, XML, other applications, etc) and historizes the data, as well as performing calculation. PI is critical to providing data to a multitude of other systems & interfaces (client tools, other servers including Energy Components, XHQ, etc.) The PI Analyst position includes providing implementation work and ongoing support for the application. Prior experience implementing and supporting OSIsoft PI is a requirement for this position.
Primary Job Functions:
• Manage PI tags, implement Asset Framework (AF) templates, PI Datalink manual entry templates and develop/troubleshoot calculations (include ACE code, Performance Equations, and AF Analytics).
• Address break/fix issues – troubleshoot and remediate issues where interfaces or other components of the PI system have failed
• Business Consulting – Answer/research questions from the business users. Collaborate with business users in defining/refining scope for work requests. Coordinate reviews, conduct monthly stewardship meeting with business stakeholders
• Work with other reporting and analytics applications e.g., Energy Components, XHQ, SEEQ to resolve data integrity issues
• New Operations & Expansion Projects - PI is a standard tool deployed to most EM operated production sites. This role participates in the implementation or expansion of PI at EM-operated sites.
• Digitalization work – as PI contains process data, it is fundamental to many digital activities in business, including data science activities.
• Redundancy/High-Availability work – significant work planned to implement high availability models for PI at our production locations
• Develop and maintain PI integration tool such as PI Integrator, PI Web API and PI Vision (for visualization)
• Develop and maintain technical training plans
• Develop recommended standards and technical designs
Job Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline (Information Systems, Computer Science, etc.)
• A minimum of 5 years of demonstrated, relevant work experience (preferably in OSIsoft’s PI suite of products)
• Able/willing to work on flex hours: 9am – 5pm (Morning shift) / 4pm – 12am (Evening shift)
• Demonstrated analytical and communications skills. Demonstrated ability and flexibility to work in a team environment, with a preference for experience working in global teams
Preferred Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:
• Prior work experience in the Oil & Gas industry
• Experience with end user application support
• Experience working with Global IT service lines (e.g. Infrastructure, Network) to resolve complex issues
• Experience consulting with business lines to deliver IT solutions
• Experience in regional and global projects
• Experience in Development/Automation area and Microsoft Azure Cloud would be an added advantage
• Familiarity with the Agile working methodology
• Process engineering background

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Advertising, High degree of initiative, Interviewing, Leadership, Market Mapping, Negotiation, Recruiting, Referrals, Sales, Team Leadership
Job desc:
Love talking to people? Finds satisfaction in successfully matching the right candidate for organization ?

Then join us as a Recruitment Consultant or Senior Recruitment Consultant!!
As a Recruitment Consultant, you will wear many hats within the organization. You will need to approach your job with drive, an entrepreneurial mind-set, and tenacity.
You will take on the role of an outsourced recruitment partner to assist your clients in securing fine talents for their organization. This can be done via direct job application from job advertisements, headhunting through market mapping, referrals, networking etc.
Constant effort in maintaining of talent database and client relationship is required in order to do well in this role.
On a daily basis, this role will see you interviewing candidates, scheduling and arranging of interviews, negotiating of job offers and follow up efforts with candidates and clients.
Mentoring or leading a team to train up newer consultants and achieve team objectives (Senior)

Requirements:
Have 1-2 years of relevant working experiences in recruitment (Seniors with mentor/leadership experience will be considered for leadership role)
Strong passion for sales and recruitment.
Responsible, takes initiative in work and able to commit to work

Interested candidates, who wish to apply for the advertised position, please email us an updated copy of your resume.
Email Address: austin.hoo@persolkelly.com
(R1980802 – Austin Hoo Kai Jie)
EA Licence No: . 01C4394
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Job desc(HTML):
Love talking to people? Finds satisfaction in successfully matching the right candidate for organization ?


Then join us as a Recruitment Consultant or Senior Recruitment Consultant!!

  • As a Recruitment Consultant, you will wear many hats within the organization. You will need to approach your job with drive, an entrepreneurial mind-set, and tenacity.
  • You will take on the role of an outsourced recruitment partner to assist your clients in securing fine talents for their organization. This can be done via direct job application from job advertisements, headhunting through market mapping, referrals, networking etc.
  • Constant effort in maintaining of talent database and client relationship is required in order to do well in this role.
  • On a daily basis, this role will see you interviewing candidates, scheduling and arranging of interviews, negotiating of job offers and follow up efforts with candidates and clients.
  • Mentoring or leading a team to train up newer consultants and achieve team objectives (Senior)


Requirements:

  • Have 1-2 years of relevant working experiences in recruitment (Seniors with mentor/leadership experience will be considered for leadership role)
  • Strong passion for sales and recruitment.
  • Responsible, takes initiative in work and able to commit to work


Interested candidates, who wish to apply for the advertised position, please email us an updated copy of your resume.

Email Address: austin.hoo@persolkelly.com

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, English, Attention to Detail, Contractual, Customer Satisfaction, English writing, Private Branch Exchange (PBX), Quotations, Quote, Sales Processes
Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Prepare configurations of all new and expansion systems for direct customer and distributor accounts, globally
Manage internal quote queues
Liaise with CRM (Customer Relationship Manager) for pricing and costing of all MAC (Moves, Add and Changes) work
Communicate via email with end customers regarding MAC requests
Work with Project Management, Pre-Sales Engineering, and Operations to ensure accurate configurations on quotes
Liaise with the management for alterations in pricing schedules
Be aware of new releases of pricing schedules and new products when issued
Process contract packages through the booking process; confirm all pricing, costs, margins, customer account information are accurate
Create 3rd party vendor quotation – work with Manufacturing and Purchasing teams for ordering of 3rd party licenses
Work with Pre-Sales Engineering support to ensure quotes have accurate, technical configuration
Provide general support to sales team on internal system and quote queries
Individual Sales Tracking and Reporting
Assist Sales with quoting, contract preparation and bookings
Provide general support to sales on system and process queries
Assist CRM (Customer Relationship Manager) to create and enable user ID in Xchange Portal.


Job Requirements

Proven aptitude with Information Technology
Experience working with technology in a support or engineering function
Ability to work under pressure to meet the demands of a business and sales environment
Excellent Commercial / Contractual awareness and acumen required Ability to work with third party organizations
Ability to work with third party organizations
Intermediate to Advanced skills with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point, SharePoint) as well as other computer based tools.
Oracle experience a plus
Excellent interpersonal and time management skills
Good understanding of the pricing concepts and attention to detail is essential
Advanced English writing skill


Desirable:

Communication technology principles and operation
Experience with PBX or IT Technology
Understanding of LAN, MAN, and WAN technology (with an emphasis on CISCO)
Experience in preparing quotations
Experience with providing technical support (direct to customer or to internal sales team)


Perks & Benefits

Hybrid Working Mode
Medical, Dental, Optical & Insurance
Free flow of F&B at office Pantry
holistic well-being Working Culture


Apply online or feel free to contact me directly for more information about this opportunity.

Due to the high volume of applicants, we regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Thank you for your understanding.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, Problem Solving, Analytical Skills, Computer Science, IT Infrastructure Management, IT Operations, Information Technology, Local Area Network (LAN), Technical Support, Troubleshooting
Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Responsible for the company’s overall IT operations in terms of hardware, software, network infrastructure and server related matters.
Setup, configure, support and maintain various hardware (PC/Laptop/Server), operating systems (Microsoft Windows XP, Window 10, Windows OS and Windows Server OS. ), networks (LAN/WAN)
Support existing IT infrastructure including server administration, network operations and configurations, backup/recovery, system access security and database administration.
Provide technical support and troubleshooting of hardware and software problems to the end-users.
Performing diagnostic tests and debugging procedures to optimize computer systems.
Provide expertise and support during systems upgrades, installations, conversions, file maintenance and administration of all server
Ensure anti-virus software is installed, kept up to date.
Oversee systems development and enhancement and the integration of new systems with existing systems
Liaise with difference vendors and matters related to software or application systems covering the areas of hardware, software and maintenance services.
Software license – Control, update, maintain and record the log.
IT Policy implementation and maintain Policy compliance.


Job Requirements

Minimum Diploma in Computer Science / Information Systems / Information Technology, or any related field.
At least 4 years of working experience in related field.
Required skill(s): Communication (both written and verbal), Time management, Problem solving
Strong analytical, troubleshooting & leadership skills.
Knowledge of LAN hardware and software management
Proven experience in managing IT infrastructure and services.
Related experience and knowledge of networking and troubleshooting internet is preferred


Perk & Benefits

Medical covers spouse and children
Training
15 days annual leave first 2 years


Apply online or feel free to contact me directly for more information about this opportunity.

Due to the high volume of applicants, we regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Thank you for your understanding.

Skills: Communication, Business, Business Development, Business Management, Business Strategy, Consultation, Management, Recruiting, Sales, Strategy
Job desc:
Job Description:
Identify opportunities and understand clients' business strategy, culture and effectively interpret their unique requirements.
Lead and develop both short and long-term recruitment strategies as well as providing quality services and results.
Assess candidate’s skills and experience, their career/personal goals and suitability for the position.
Manage candidates' expectation and aspirations ensuring they are aligned with their own career goals and cultural fit.
Construct long-term and trusted relationships with both potential and existing clients.
Identify and provide consultation to a large network of talents with on both account of immediate and long-term career aspirations.
Manage the end-to-end recruitment process and client’s expectations to bridge the gaps between the talents and their organizations.

Job Requirement:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Management or in any related field.
Ability to communicate effectively with peers, clients and management and to work effectively in a team environment.
Successful sales and/or business development background with a passion for start-to-end recruitment processes are welcomed to apply.
Strong communication skills and a positive behavior.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Job desc:
Job Descriptions:
Responsible for end-to-end recruitment process; source, screen, assess, negotiate and close.
Work closely with Hiring Managers and HR Business Partners on talent acquisition assignments and strategies.
Execute talent attraction strategies to provide qualified and diverse candidate pool for all positions.
Manage talent attraction via job advertisement, referral program, online job posting or other recruitment avenues.
Ensure recruitment processes run smoothly and talent requisitions are successfully closed in the stipulated time-frame.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements :
Bachelor degree in human resource, business administration or equivalent background
Minimum 2 years of solid recruitment experience
Effective communication skills, including proficiency in English and the ability to interact with staff of all job levels.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications.
Highly committed and result-oriented.
Able to work in a fast paced environment
Candidates from In-House Recruitment Team or Recruitment Agency are welcome to apply.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, English, Business, Business Unit Management, Change Requests, Customer Service, Interpersonal Skills, Project Management, Vendor Management, Vendor Relations
Job desc:
Job Details:

Position: Business Relationship Manager
Location: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Nationality : Malaysian (preferred)
Work model: Hybrid

Job Summary (Overview of the job)
Acts as a one-stop service point to represent Global Technology Operations on service level and support
Understand business system requirements and develop optimal implementation approach to effectively deliver the necessary underlying infrastructure
Produce monthly service level report and host related governance meeting as required by local management
Manage and Resolve IT related issues and change requests
Direct Infrastructure Leads and assign resources in delivering end to end services
Key Responsibilities (List the duties or task performed critical to success)
Manage complex relationships and the clashes of priorities and cultures that occur among diverse groups.
Interact with business unit management teams, officers, and representatives to assist them in resources outsourced to GTO.
Addresses issues with impact beyond own team based on knowledge of related disciplines
Manage and oversight delivery by third party vendors
Manages the specification, construction, and integration of deliverables from internal technical teams and external vendors to local business units
Manages the implementation of the infrastructure scope to ensure that GTO Infrastructure meets delivery obligations (e.g. preparation of system aligning to regional security & infrastructure policy)
Tracks the project to the agreed schedule and reports on progress and status Acts as the focal point and liaises between the business technology stakeholders and technical tower leads.

Minimum job requirement (minimum knowledge, skills and abilities that are required to perform the job)
A degree in IT, Engineering or related area.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, fluent in both speaking and writing English.
8 - 12 years of solid IT working experience.
At least 2 years of experience in managing a size of 5-10 IT managers / technical resources
Supporting Insurance systems would be an added advantage.
Ability to work under pressure and remain calm and cooperative.
Strong customer service orientation with the ability to work with and influence customers in a proactive and constructive manner.
4 or more years of project management experience.
Experience in management of vendor relationships with a focus on deliverables management
Understands the scope of the business components of projects and liaises with business staff responsible for those components.

Interested people kindly share us your updated cv to prabu.murugesan@manpower.com.my

Skills: Communication, Attention to Detail, Documentation, Interpersonal Skills, Raw Materials, Regulatory Affairs
Job desc:
As Regulatory Affair Specialist, he/ she responsible to conduct regulatory compliance check and approval for raw material spec, product formula, product spec, and product label including creation of PLR (product label report) sold through Asia Pacific Exports, South Asia Exports and other markets within the region they operate in collaboration with distributors, when necessary. This includes support to WTR business to review compliance for markets within the region, as needed.

Responsibilities:
Provide support to coordinate product information specification to distributor via Distributor model.
Provide support to coordinate the feedback on compliance across a number of means including using external distributor networks, internal contractors, on-line food compliance systems and own knowledge (regulatory capability).
Such feedback must be recorded and reported accordingly to direct manager.
Provide support to monitor, obtain and distribute updated information regarding domestic and international food regulations, laws, guidelines, or standards.
Support direct manager in assessing impacts on the business for any regulatory amendments.
Support direct manager for the Distributor auditing process within the region they operate, as needed.
Maintenance of regulatory data base recording of all work, reviews and feedback for all the businesses he/she supports, capturing information relevant to the business and updating with internal stakeholders.
Ensure accuracy of reports and timely reporting to direct manager.
Provide support for the issuance of regulatory technical documentations such as export certification, flavor letters, etc.
Attend cross functional meetings and coordinate with direct manager in a timely manner.
Ability to advise on risks and compliance issues for SEA markets and build the ability to advise for the various AP markets.
Provide support in liaising with all External Translation Houses within the region they operate, when necessary.

Requirements:
Strong interpersonal effectiveness and communication skills
Excellent analytical abilities
Action oriented, and results driven
Effective attention to detail and well-organized
Regulatory knowledge on Food Laws and Regulation for either Malaysia, Brunei, Singapore and/or Myanmar.
Preferably with knowledge on CODEX.
Regulatory knowledge in other markets within Asia Pacific if a plus.
Able to work across multiple time zones.
Systems savvy, and proficient in MS Office.

Apply directly or send your CV to AlifAmirul.Ahmad@adecco.com for a confidential discussion. Please be informed that only shortlisted applicants will be notified

Skills: Customer Requirements, DFT, Inspection, Internal Audits, Quality Assurance, Quality Control, Quality Management, Quality System, Specifications, Surface Preparation
Job desc:
A key producer of Marine / Container Paint is looking to hire a QA Executive with chemical background to join their team in Pasir Gudang, Johor.

Job Description

To make sure customer is using the right paint for application and to ensure paints are in good condition before application
To ensure all inspection equipment and application equipment are with good condition.
To make ensure surface preparation and paint application is according to painting system.
To check and make sure the DFT is within specification as per customer requirement.
To monitor and control daily paint consumption and check list if require.
Able to coordinate day-to-day works and work inspections between the inspection team.
Participant or help in yearly stock take activities, control and record daily paint stock balance, in ERP record
Responsible to take care all kind of paint and equipment at customer store.
House keeping and ensure work place is tightly and organize.
Prepare daily painting report, daily consumption report and daily painting progress report, by EPR software when found any abnormal case happen, example painting defect, problem in handling/ application/ inspection.
Notify the sale manager/ head of inspector any anomalies or irregularities in the specifications/ painting activities and in painting material .


JOB REQUIREMENT

1-2 years of experience in painting inspection with Chemical background. Fresh graduate from Chemical engineering or science stream can also be considered.
Able to work in chemical environment
Proactive, positive and hardworking
ISO 9001 or ISO 14001 knowledge


Interested candidates are welcomed to apply online or send your latest resume to elvin.lian@jac-recruitment.com

Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Develop, maintain and scale/optimize existing / new web applications, towards better efficiency, performance and user experience
Develop/Integration of server-side APIs from/for other web/mobile application
Understanding client requirements and how they translate to new application features.
Diagnosing, fixing and reporting operations issues relating to server hosting environment
Write high quality source code to program complete applications within deadlines.
Develop and provide idea on system improvement.
Independent, multi-task and thrive in a fast-paced, results driven organisation

Job Requirements

Candidate must possess at least Diploma/Advanced/Higher/Graduate in Computer Science/Software Engineering / Information Technology or equivalent.
A minimum of 2 years’ experience in MVC, PHP, .NET programming (C#) and JavaScript.
A good knowledge and skills in database query i.e., MS SQL Server, mySQL
Knowledge on Javascript framework Angular (added-advantage)
Proficient and strong hands-on experience in end-to-end software development lifecycle (design, development and deployment)
Self-motivated nature and the ability to work autonomously with minimal supervision
Good in problem solving and suggestion for system improvement.
Understanding of layout aesthetics
Logical thinking

About Horizontal: Established since 2003 in the US, Horizontal solves complex challenges across two distinct businesses: Horizontal Digital and Horizontal Talent. We are consistently recognized for being a top workplace and one of the fastest growing private companies. Horizontal Talent specializes in staffing for IT, Digital & Creative and Business & Strategy markets. We have global offices in US, UAE, India, and Malaysia.

Job desc(HTML):
Job Responsibilities


  • Develop, maintain and scale/optimize existing / new web applications, towards better efficiency, performance and user experience
  • Develop/Integration of server-side APIs from/for other web/mobile application
  • Understanding client requirements and how they translate to new application features.
  • Diagnosing, fixing and reporting operations issues relating to server hosting environment
  • Write high quality source code to program complete applications within deadlines.
  • Develop and provide idea on system improvement.

  • Self-motivated nature and the ability to work autonomously with minimal supervision
  • Good in problem solving and suggestion for system improvement.

  • Logical thinking

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, Attention to Detail, Critical Thinking, Human Resources (HR), Payroll Administration, Recruiting, Social Security, Strategic Initiatives, Timelines, Training
Job desc:
The ideal candidate will support the full scope of Human Resources responsibilities and partner with the organization on strategic initiatives. They will maintain and enhance the organization's human resources by planning, implementing, and evaluating human resources policies, programs, and practices.
You do
Review and refine existing local HR processes and structure, initiating improvements/simplifications accordingly.
Support and implement the agreed competence development and learning initiatives.
Support managers on recruitment
Ensure HR processes are implemented and followed locally
Manage the payroll vendor and ensure timeliness on the monthly pay cycles
Be the local advisory on HR Operational issues, ensuring compliance with local labor rules and regulations (e.g. giving professional advice in payroll, employee handbook update, tax, and social security-related subjects)
As part of the Malaysia management team, contribute to any HR initiatives to ensure success in the country.
Provide high-quality service to employees and managers

You have
Bachelor's degree or relevant experience
5+ years' experience in Human Resources
Strong recruiting and demonstrated ability to improve talent acquisition strategies
Demonstrated expertise training managers and employees
Strong organizational, critical thinking and communications skills
Attention to detail and good judgement
