About The Role

They are currently looking for an Assistant C&B Manager to join them. You will oversee the development, alignment, implementation, and maintenance of the compensation programs, including organizational design, market benchmarking, salary structures and developing salary budgets, to analyze and improve the internal equity and competitive market position. Your responsibilities will include but not limited to:-
  • Ensure all the C&B policies are updated timely in the company’s portal
  • Manage annual employee benefits and insurance plans, perform annual salary benchmarking
  • Design benefit programs (insurance, wellness etc.)
  • Manage monthly payroll processing with a high degree of accuracy in accordance with company policies
  • Responsible for all statutory contributions; ensure compliance with the latest statutory legislation and ensure all statutory deadlines are met on a monthly/yearly basis
About The Team/manager

You will be reporting directly to the Senior HR Manager, and will be leading a team of 2 to 3 members.

Skills & Experience Required

To be the ideal candidate for this role, you will come with at least 5 years of relevant working experience. You demonstrated professional competence and success in C&B or Rewards management, as well as the ability to operate effectively in a fast-changing environment. Is that you?

In return, you will get a monthly salary up to RM 9,000 plus bonuses. More importantly, it will offer you the opportunity to work in a fast moving and growing organisation.

how to apply

If this role interests you, kindly write in now to Celine celine.che@randstad.com.my or click apply here for a smooth easy process to register your interest and CV for the role. Due to a high demand for this role, we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Effectively resolve Level 1 service desk technical queries as per deliverables outlined
Provide remote support to local and oversea user when connected by calls, email or chat when users are facing issue with their computer system
Asking relevant questions to resolve typically known problems within required timescales
Ensure appropriate documentation of the interaction with the customer in the prescribed format
Ability to communicate clearly and able to provide guidance by giving instruction when performing troubleshooting to identify or resolve the technical issues remotely
Explain to Clients through a series of actions either face to face or over the telephone to help set up systems or resolve issues
Ensure that performance parameters are met to meet SLA targets
Ability to clearly transfer technical knowledge to knowledge base, colleagues, and the Customers
Any ad hoc duties assign by the Company from time to time


Requirements

Must be able to speak and write fluent Mandarin language as role requires candidate to deal with clients in China
Technical knowledge/expertise to support technical related queries and troubleshooting
Minimum 1+ years’ experience in a Level 1 service desk or technical support process providing remote support for Laptops / Desktops / LAN Issues / Application etc
Degree / Diploma is required (SPM graduates with experience open to apply as well)
Proven experience in commercial inbound telephony systems typically used in Contact Center
Willingness to work in rotational shifts (shift changes monthly between teams)
Good support knowledge of Windows Operating systems, general standard knowledge on off the shelves software like Microsoft Office and etc

Skills: Accounts Receivable (AR), Debit Cards, Direct Debit, Escalation, Intercompany Transactions, Korean, Remittances, Shared Services, Treatment Planning, Writing
Job desc:
Company Overview

Industry: Shared Service Industry

Location: Petaling Jaya, Selangor

Job Responsibilities

Processing bank receipts, checks and cash transfer for South Korean counterparts
Process allocation of payments, credit notes and adjustments to customer invoices
To manage and process customer remittances advices
To execute direct debit, refund, intercompany transactions as required by collection treatment plans
To post invoice and bank interfaces to the system
To execute timely end-of-month closing activities
To manage customer escalation up to closure of the issue
To control credit exposure and ageing balances for cash accounts


Job Requirements

Proficiency in Korean language (speak, read and writing)
Experience in handling Asia Pacific region or South Korean market under Shared Service Centre
Bachelor Degree in Business Administration or equivalent Accounting qualification
2-3 years of experience in accounting, specifically accounts receivable, preferably in a Shared Services Centre environment
Deep and broad understanding of accounts receivable

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Computer Science, Configure Price Quote (CPQ) Software, Design Analysis, Force.com, Lightning Web Components, Salesforce CPQ, Salesforce Lightning, Salesforce Sales Cloud, Salesforce.com, Visualforce
Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Design and develop secure, scalable technical solutions on the Salesforce and Salesforce CPQ platform
Create and collaborate on the solution and technical design artifacts, and present and participate in cross-functional review sessions
Communicate technical solutions and design tradeoffs to Business Applications team members as well as business stakeholders
Display expertise in Salesforce and Salesforce CPQ functionality and features, through all interactions on Business Applications projects
Provide technical support for new projects, enhancements, and bug fixes related to solutions being delivered on the Salesforce & Salesforce CPQ platform.
Work with Business system analysts to design & implement end to end automation
Partner with Sales Ops, Finance, Sales, Operations and implementation partners to build and deploy Salesforce CPQ configuration automation.
Analyze business processes to identify inefficiencies and critical metrics
Lead engagement with business contacts on requirements and design analysis
Maintain and optimize full lifecycle software development using standard configuration, Apex, VisualForce, LWC, API’s, CPQ and Force.com applications
Coordinate and collaborate with other developers and team members to obtain requirements, develop solution design, manage UATs and post-go-live activities
Establish best practices and standards for well designed, testable, efficient code with high quality
Participate in peer reviewing and debugging existing source code and resolve support requests for existing environments


Job Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent
5+ years in Salesforce development/administration experience with extensive knowledge of Sales Cloud, Apex, VisualForce, LWC, and Force.com tools and applications
3+ years of designing, configuring and developing on Salesforce CPQ platform
Web services experience preferred (REST, SOAP)
Working knowledge of Web and Javascript frameworks is a plus
Self-starter, self-motivated, able to work independently, prioritize effectively, and perform multiple tasks under minimal supervision
Experience working in sales cloud platform
Experience with Lightning Experience
Excellent communication skills and proven success in a dynamic and collaborative environment
Experience designing test plans, performing unit testing, and writing test classes to ensure proper code coverage
Strong problem-solving skills


Perks & Benefits

Hybrid Working Mode
Medical, Dental, Optical & Insurance
Free flow of F&B at office Pantry
holistic well-being Working Culture


Apply online or feel free to contact me directly for more information about this opportunity.

Due to the high volume of applicants, we regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Thank you for your understanding.

Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Manage assigned Accounts.
Customer qualification and platforming.
Research contact and identify/plan key initiatives .
Be the Single Point of Contact for the assigned accounts .
Develop and maintain relationship with customer .
Answer customer questions and educate on all the services report on sale and margin of accounts .

Transfer new product sales opportunities to Account Managers from the BUs or Inside Sales from the country .
Quote and close the deal for standard services offer .

Keep up to date the data of Installed Base of the customers .
Document all records of customer history in BFO.
Respond on-time and on-quality to On-demand requests from the customers

Education: Bachelor's/College Degree in Electrical / Electronics / Computer / Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.
Experience: 2 years IS/ Field Service Representative/ Customer Care
Soft skills: sales oriented/ results oriented/ daring/ passionate/ team player/ organized/ resilient/ voice is clear & understandable/ engaging & enthusiastic.
Language skills: Proficient in Japanese Language skills. Require interacting with Japanese customers on regular basis
Learning agility.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Good interpersonal skill; approaching, active listening, problem solving and pro-active.
WFH until further notice.

Job title: Product Costing Senior Analyst - 6 Month contract
Skills: Component Engineering, Control Systems, Cost Reduction, EPLAN, Failure Analysis, Product Costing, Programmable Logic Controller (PLC), Schematic
Job desc:
The role will perform processing of information within the R2R function with a focus on rule-based back office activities to ensure quality and accurate completion of services and key performance indicators (KPIs) as defined in the Service Level Agreement (SLA).

• To execute a range of activities, such as NPI costing, financial analysis and reporting, using the appropriate systems (SAP-ECC) and agreed standard processes.
• Perform period-end activities including Material Ledger to ensure all transactions are posted to materials and Cost centres accurately and period is closed as per timetable agreed.
• Response to queries in a timely and efficient manner to promote a business partnering culture in GBS Finance.
• Perform reconciliations for Product costings related GLs and follow-up on reconciling items to ensure all items are captured into the correct GLs.
• Perform analysis and clearing of balance sheet accounts to ensure accounts are clean and suspicious transactions investigated.
• Update task level descriptions or process manuals as and when there are changes to manage knowledge retention and to assist back-ups performing tasks on behalf.
• Provide support to audit process so that entity is able to manage the balance of risk and control effectively.
• Support migration project to ensure smooth transition of tasks from end markets to GBS (wherever applicable).
• Perform testing of new systems/technology and processes as and when required to minimise potential problems to operations.
• Provide backup support to Team Lead / AM when needed to assist in overseeing the operation.
• Train new team members and share knowledge and job experience to get team members up to speed or assist them in problem solving.
• Ensure KPI figures are met as per agreed SLA with end markets.
• Assist AM / Team Lead to manage workload in the team to achieve team’s deliverables as per agreed standards.
• Identify and perform trouble-shooting on issues faced by team to resolve issues effectively and to highlight potential risks.

At least a degree in Accounting/Finance/Business Administration or equivalent.
At least 1-2 year(s) working experience in Product Costing / Supply Chain Finance.
Experience in using SAP system would be an added advantage.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: CCNP Security, IP Networking, Network Administration, Network Configuration, Network Engineering, Network Infrastructure, Network Performance, Networking, Routers, Telco
Job desc:
As a member of the Optical Network (Fixed/wired) team, you will be a key part of the team for designing,
planning, implementing and maintaining the optical, switching and routing network. Focusing on DWDM;
deployments, testing, troubleshooting and maintenance.

Responsibilities:
- Managing fiber network capacity in co-operation with Engineering and internal customers.
- Handle escalated trouble calls and work closely with the NOC, engineering, field technicians, and
telecommunications carriers to resolve service issues.
- Externally facing point of contact to facilitate handling of problem reports and maintain relations
with customers, network peers and vendors.
- Internally facing point of contact to escalate technical issues and communicate network status.
- Oversee and execute planned network maintenance work, minimizing impact to services.
- Manage and implement optical DWDM network components using NMS and devices specific
interfaces (CLI/GUI.)
- Establishes networking environment by designing, implementation, documenting, and enforcing
system standards.
- Provide Level-2/3 support and troubleshooting to resolve issues.
- Provided expert advice on technical proof-of-concepts evaluation.
- Participate in system integration and user acceptance tests, and compile customer configuration
profile documentations.
- To assist the network/security deployment project.
- To obtain job related Industry Certification for principal partnership requirement.
- Ensure works are carried out in accordance with client’s define scopes.
- Handle incident & problem management, and knowledge transfer.
- Troubleshoot, diagnose, and resolve technical hardware and/or software issues.

Requirements:

Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree,
Computer Science/Information Technology, Engineering (Computer/Telecommunication), Science
& Technology, Engineering (Electrical/Electronic) or equivalent.
- Required skill(s): LAN, WAN, Enterprise Network & Wireless, Firewall, IPS
- At least 3 years and above working experience with an Internet service provider or enterprise-level
network engineering.
- DWDM & optical transport and transceiver knowledge.
- System engineering, test and link analysis skills with vendor-specific tools (OSA, OTDR, Bert-
10/100g, Power meter.)
- Knowledge of industry standards, fiber/fiber management, electronics, AC-DC Wiring.
- Good knowledge in Network troubleshooting and root cause analysis.
- Solid understanding of the OSI or TCP/IP model, Network Security.
- Hands-on experience with Design, Deployment, Monitoring, Network diagnostic and Network
analytics tools.
- Basic knowledge in IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS) or Core & access network.
- Basic knowledge in mobile communication.
- Understand the basic knowledge and operations of the Cloud Computing.
- Experience with as-built documentation.
- Meticulous and detail oriented, works well with minimal supervision, ability to troubleshoot
problems under pressure and provide analysis to senior management. Ability to train and mentor
lower tier technicians.
- Possess certification in Network Routing & Switching/Voice & Unified Communication is plus
advantage.
- Possess strong leadership and interpersonal skills with a customer service mindset. - Good working and learning attitude, analytical and problem-solving skill. - CCNP, CCIE or HCIE certification is advantageous.
- Required language(s): English & Bahasa Malaysia. - Applicants must be willing to work in The Boulevard Office Mid Valley City, KL.
- Candidate willing to travel outstation on project basis, and on-call standby 24x7 with allowance
(rotation base). - Work at night-time when necessary.

Skills: Attention to Detail, Employee Benefits, Employee Benefits Design, HR Policies, Human Resources (HR), Management, Payroll Administration, Performance Management, Recruiting, Strategic Initiatives
Job desc:
Job Summary
· Manage the overall operations of the department that covers the area of recruitment, learning and development, payroll, policies and procedures, performance management, industrial relations, and liaise with government agencies such as KWSP, SOCSO, HRDF and more.
· Identify and create organisational development projects that improve both organisational experience and employee engagement.

Main Responsibilities:
· Collaborates with business partners to review manpower requirements and review hiring needs and methodology in ensuring all vacancies are filled within the agreed timeframe.
· Proactively look into the learning and development initiatives and improve, to ensure it meets the business needs.
· Manage payroll and all its statutory requirements.
· Consistently look into policies and procedures to ensure it is relevant to the business needs as well as fulfil the corporate strategy and statutory requirements.
· To work closely with business partners to review and consistently come out with forward thinking methodology in performance management.
· Formulate HR strategies and priorities to sustain business success through critical competencies for the organisation, according to the changing business needs.
· Proactively look into organisation development initiatives such as employee climate survey, performance improvement, culture change, succession planning and more.

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or relevant experience
7+ years' experience in Human Resources
Strong HR operations and demonstrated ability to improve processes
Strong organizational, critical thinking and communications skills
Attention to detail and good judgement
Job desc(HTML):
Job Summary

· Manage the overall operations of the department that covers the area of recruitment, learning and development, payroll, policies and procedures, performance management, industrial relations, and liaise with government agencies such as KWSP, SOCSO, HRDF and more.

· Identify and create organisational development projects that improve both organisational experience and employee engagement.


Main Responsibilities:

· Collaborates with business partners to review manpower requirements and review hiring needs and methodology in ensuring all vacancies are filled within the agreed timeframe.

· Proactively look into the learning and development initiatives and improve, to ensure it meets the business needs.

· Manage payroll and all its statutory requirements.

· Consistently look into policies and procedures to ensure it is relevant to the business needs as well as fulfil the corporate strategy and statutory requirements.

· To work closely with business partners to review and consistently come out with forward thinking methodology in performance management.

· Formulate HR strategies and priorities to sustain business success through critical competencies for the organisation, according to the changing business needs.

· Proactively look into organisation development initiatives such as employee climate survey, performance improvement, culture change, succession planning and more.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or relevant experience
  • 7+ years' experience in Human Resources
  • Strong HR operations and demonstrated ability to improve processes
  • Strong organizational, critical thinking and communications skills
  • Attention to detail and good judgement

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Job desc:
Job Description

On behalf of an Oil and Gas Operator in Malaysia, I am searching for a Project Engineer to based in their KL office

This will be a 2 year renewable contract.

The role

As the Project Engineer, the prime areas of responsibility will be to provide support to the Project Management Team with the Petronas interface, scheduling, cost controls, contract and subcontract administration and general management matters
Monitor and report status and overview on project development progress and issues at hand, through scheduling, project controls, and interface with EPC and EPCIC managers / teams.
Provide project monitoring activities within the project controls, procurement and cost control governance policies in Petronas (particularly in respect to PPGUA requirements).

Please apply via link below

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Job desc:
Designation: Business development manager / Sales Manager
Location:KL Malaysia
Hiring Company :Nityo Infotech (nityo.com)
Mode of Hiring:Permanent
Year of experience :1 year
Notice period:ASAP OR 1 MONTH

About the Organization:
Nityo Infotech is an IT Consulting, outsourcing, offshoring, CMMI-5 company, specialized in talent secondment and Staff augmentation services. Headquartered in the US, we have marked our presence in 40+ countries worldwide, since our inception in Pittsburgh, U.S.A, in 2005. As of today, we are a team of 21000+ IT experts, delivering value to our clients worldwide.

Role objective: The primary objective is to be the client SPOC for all resourcing requirements received.

Key Responsibilities:
To identify business potential across sectors like IT, Recruitment / Staffing
Responsible for end-to-end process from client acquisition for permanent staffing/Contract positions to Client Servicing and Management to ensuring receipt of payments
Responsible for generation of revenue from new business or improving existing business
Responsible for the offshore recruitment team and relationship managers to generate quality results and achieving targets
Build and maintain rapport with the New & Existing clients, Accountable for all client proposals, contracts, RFPs, escalations, queries and any further documentation.
Building the Nityo Brand - marking Nityo’s presence in APAC MARKET.
Responsible for end-to-end process from gathering requirement from the client to driving the recruitment team to service the requirement and deployment of the candidate
To be able to take Sales Target for Permanent placement and contracting placements and achieve them with end to end ownership.

Skills Required:
Understanding/prior experience of IT outsourcing/Consulting and Recruitment Industry or IT Sales
Understanding and experience of Markets like Malaysia or countries in APAC is preferred
Hands- on experience on networking, building client relationships
IT Staffing and Recruitment Sales
Should be able to take and Achieve Sales Targets
Must be smart, aggressive and a go-getter

Note: Candidate must be based in Malaysia or willing to relocate to Malaysia.

Skills: Analytical Skills, Business Planning, Negotiation, Presentations, Research, Security Automation, Social Influence, Team Leadership, Team Management, Teamwork
Job desc:
My client is looking for a Head of Cyber Defence to lead an advance security operations centre in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
You will be experienced with:
- Leading a team of 10+ incident responders
- Implementing innovative plans to upgrade detection and response processes/practices
- Developing advance remediation plans to mitigate current & future threats & vulnerabilities
- Steer security automation initiatives
- Strong decision-making skills, influencing internal & external stakeholders by presenting development plans, current cyber trends, advocating state-of-the art SIEM technologies
If you are a technical leader that is ready to take on this challenging role, please apply. Open to relocating candidates to Kuala Lumpur.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Budget Forecasting, Budgeting, Cash Flow, Cash Flow Management, Finance, Financial Accounting, Financial Controlling, Financial Reporting, Internal Audits, Strategic Financial Management
Job desc:
- Leading international company, rapid strong growth
- Based in Kuala Lumpur or Singapore
- Integration of new acquisitions in multiple countries

Our client is an international services company, a global expert in optimising the industrial performance of companies operating in various sectors: aeronautics, automotive, electronics, energy, life science, pharmaceuticals, F&B. The company is characterised by a strong growth achieved through acquisitions in many countries and by a dynamic and entrepreneurial corporate culture.
In this challenging regional position covering Asia Pacific, you report to the APAC Regional Director with a strong dotted line to the Chief Financial Officer of the Group. As a regional Financial Controller, you represent the company, you strengthen Asia Pacific Finance organization and you structure the multiple countries finance teams to integrate new acquisitions and support business rapid growth.

Your main responsibilities:

• Responsible for all financial aspects of APAC operations;
• Provide leadership and coordination in the business planning and monitoring, cash management and accounting; As the referent Business Partner for the zone, analyse and interpret financial and operational data trends and provides insight and recommendations to APAC Management and the Group to improve the performance and achieve its targets
• Evaluate, determine and implement measures to structure the financial departments in each country to keep up with growth of the Group, local legal requirements and Group internal procedures; Promote and implement Shared Services Centres wherever it makes sense, operationally and economically
• Insure rapid integration of all new acquisitions, especially within Finance Group processes;
• Ensure all local statutory compliance are executed locally in due time (accounting, tax, legal, and social);

Your experience & skills:

• Master Degree in Finance, ideally along with a Certified Public Accountant degree;
• Minimum 10 years of experience, at least 5 in Asia Pacific Zone.
• Experience as Financial Controller either in the division of a large international Group or a large independent company > 100 m$ working under international regulations
• Expertise in financial controlling
• Experience in managing several Asia / Pacific countries
• A first experience in “big 4 type” Audit Firm a plus,
• Strong international culture
• Autonomous, proactive, you are at ease in project management and you enjoy working on the ground
• Analytical aptitude. Advanced analytics fuel decision-making
• Leadership skills: Ability to motivate teams to produce quality materials within tight timeframes and simultaneously manage several projects;
• Strong level of written and oral communication skills with ability to participate in and facilitate transverse projects;
• Strong intercultural skills as this is a multicultural role;
• Business Intelligence
• You are looking for an international, entrepreneurial and dynamic environment
The position is a permanent position based in Singapore or Kuala Lumpur.
A unique opportunity to develop and make your mark within a leading international growth company. If you are interested in this position, please send your CV and cover letter to the following address: cvfinance@runtalents.com.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Problem Solving, SQL, Debugging, Functionality, Git, PostgreSQL, Software Projects, Sprints, Technical Reviews, Testing Practices
Job desc:
About Horizontal: Established since 2003 in the US, Horizontal solves complex challenges across two distinct businesses: Horizontal Digital and Horizontal Talent. We are consistently recognized for being a top workplace and one of the fastest growing private companies. Horizontal Talent specializes in staffing for IT, Digital & Creative and Business & Strategy markets. We have global offices in US, UAE, India, and Malaysia.

About the Client: The company is an IT & Digital Agency with 2 offices in over 35 result-driven team players.

Position in Organisation

This person will report directly to the Head of Technology and work alongside Project Managers, Developers, Creatives and the Founders to deliver a range of solutions. It’s an extremely collaborative environment and will see you taking on a key role within this small but growing team. You will provide technical production and development skills across numerous national and global projects.

Skills And Abilities

Experience with MERN stack and appropriate development languages (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js etc.)
Experience with PostgreSQL (or equivalent)
Experience with Git process flows
Experience with CI/CD using Docker
Strong communication skills
Excellent problem-solving skills
Eye for detail and identifying problems and solutions
Experience in working agile/scrum
At least 3 years professional experience
Self-motivated, able and open to learning and professional development
Responsibilities

Participate in bespoke software design & development, including:
Developing new and on-going web software projects.
Investigating and debugging error reports assigned to you.
Maintaining up-to-date time tracking and task status information in accordance with our time tracking and project processes.
Liaising with customers where required to ensure we deliver excellent customer service.
Providing technical reviews of requirements, organizing requirements into sprints and estimating the time required for development.
Deliver all software to a high quality by:
Identifying and recording, via development management tools, areas of the codebase that may require refactoring and, where necessary, performing that refactoring with minimal impact on existing functionality.
Maintaining language-appropriate coding styles.
Making full use of defined testing practices.
Raising with your project lead or manager actual or potential problems and risks you encounter during development.
Identifying to your manager any processes, tools or training you think would improve the software we deliver or help you further your skills as a developer.
Performing ad-hoc releases and/or hotfixes.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Bid Processes, Building Materials, Construction, Contract Management, Procurement, Quantity Surveying, Quotations, Site Visits, Surveying, Tenders
Job desc:
URGENT HIRING!
We are currently looking for experienced Quantity Surveyor Executive based in Bukit Jalil, Kuala Lumpur.
Salary: RM2200- RM3500

Job Requirements:
Degree/Diploma/Certificate in Quantity Surveying or Building Technology.
Minimum 2 years’ experience in related field (interior design, renovation , construction)
Understand Contractual terms and processes
Hands on experience handling project costing & drafting BQ
Familiar with project costing and pre and post contract administration with good knowledge of laws
Good Communication skill and able to liaise with consultants and sub-contractors
Well spoken & writing in English
Have own transport

Job Responsibilities:
Liase with Sub-Contractors, Suppliers to ensure information, costs, profitability and value meet the requirements of each project.
Conduct site visit to create assessment and project for future jobs
Taking off quantity, drafting BQ, preparing and analysing cost for tendering works for future jobs
Negotiate cost and claims between proposals and contracts
Price/forecast the cost of the different materials needed for the project
Track changes to the design and/or construction work and adjusting budget projections accordingly
Attend Tender Interviews/ clarifications
Select and/or source construction materials
Measure and value the work done on site
Undertake the preparation and processing of quotations, bids and proposals within Client deadlines
Any other relevant supporting duties as may be assigned by the Management from time to time.

Working Hours:
Monday- Friday, 9am-6pm

Skills: Problem Solving, Contact Centers, Customer Experience, Customer Satisfaction, Customer Service, Customer Service Operations, Customer Support, Enquiries, Key Performance Indicators, Service-Level Agreements (SLA)
Job desc:
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
-Handling all inbound calls pertaining to customer general enquiries, complaints, comments, feedbacks and other raising issue related to the company's products
-Exceeding customer expectation in terms of customer service & accurate information.
-Working in a team to achieve the required KPI elements and SLA.
Job desc(HTML):
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

-Handling all inbound calls pertaining to customer general enquiries, complaints, comments, feedbacks and other raising issue related to the company's products

-Exceeding customer expectation in terms of customer service & accurate information.

Skills: Client Services, Compensation, Computer Literacy, Customer Experience, Customer Service, Customer Support, Customer-focused Service, Key Performance Indicators, Learning, Time Management
Job desc:
Job Description

Serves customers by providing product and service information and resolving product and service problems.
Attracts potential customers by answering product and service questions and suggesting information about other products and services.
Opens customer accounts by recording account information.
Maintains customer records by updating account information.
Resolves product or service problems by clarifying the customer’s complaint, determining the cause of the problem, selecting and explaining the best solution to solve the problem, expediting correction or adjustment, and following up to ensure resolution.
Maintains financial accounts by processing customer adjustments.
Recommends potential products or services to management by collecting customer information and analyzing customer needs.
Prepares product or service reports by collecting and analyzing customer information.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

Job Requirement

University/college certificate is an asset.
Atleast 1 year experience in customer support, client services, sales, or a related field.
Excellent at communicating over the phone and handling phone systems.
Basic computer skills and experience with tracking and recording call information, filing documents or updating customer profiles/accounts.
Being able to start IMMEDIATELY is an added advantage.
Excellent time management and prioritization skills.
Ability to answer the phone, listen actively, relay information, and type basic information simultaneously.
Customer-focused for positive customer experience and resolution.

Employee Benefit

Salary range is from RM1,900 – RM2,500.
Structured Career Progression.
On Job Learning Opportunity.
Great Company Culture.
Work-Life Balance.
Contribution to Society.
Compensation Benefit up to RM3000.
Employee Perks such as corporate deals (Foodpanda, Gym & etc).
Office near to public transport (Subang Jaya LRT Station).
KPI allowances available !

Job desc:
Job Purpose:

Writing and debugging code
Troubleshooting software issues
Working closely with developers to improve product’s functionality
Developing innovative solutions
Developing new features and user interfaces from wireframe models
Ensuring the best performance and user experience of the application
Fixing bugs and performance problems

Qualification & Requirements

Must have knowledge about mobile app development. This includes the whole process, from the first line of code to app marketplace deployment, both Google Play Store and Apple App Store.
Proficiency in Flutter
Familiarity with APIs integrations
Experience with profiling and debugging mobile applications.
Familiarity with Git versioning control.
Understanding mobile app design guidelines on each platform and being aware of their differences. -
Experience in any native mobile app android (java/kotlin) or native IOS (Swift) is a plus.
Minimum Diploma or Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or relevant field.
Minimum of 2 years’ experience in related field.

Job Purpose:


  • Writing and debugging code
  • Troubleshooting software issues
  • Working closely with developers to improve product’s functionality
  • Developing innovative solutions
  • Developing new features and user interfaces from wireframe models
  • Ensuring the best performance and user experience of the application
  • Fixing bugs and performance problems


Qualification & Requirements


  • Must have knowledge about mobile app development. This includes the whole process, from the first line of code to app marketplace deployment, both Google Play Store and Apple App Store.
  • Proficiency in Flutter
  • Familiarity with APIs integrations

Skills: Communication, Attention to Detail, Contract Management, Legal Advice, Legal Document Preparation, Legal Issues, Legal Matters, Legal Opinions, Legal Writing, Written Communication
Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Ensure the Company and related companies’ interests in all legal matters are protected and ensure company business activities adherence to statutory, regulatory and company’s internal policies and procedures.
Providing professional legal services on conveyancing matters and commercial agreements/contracts/RFP and administer post-contract implementation and other legal related matters.
To lead in managing contract/legal issue negotiations/discussion with clients/vendor/ regulatory.
Responsible for legal advice and review, interpretation of all legal documents, and regulations for the management of the companies; not limited to drafting and vetting of legal documents.
Responsible in monitoring company policies to align with group governance and compliance policies and advising management on possible compliance risks, risk management and mitigation measures
To monitor litigation files and liaise with external solicitors.
Participating in initiatives, exercises, projects and schemes undertaken by the Companies and provide legal advisory based on best practices
To provide legal advice and supports to various departments within the company, affiliates and/or on matters affecting their business administration and operations, corporate and commercial activities.
Monitor all legal matters affecting the Companies.
Monitor litigation matters for the Companies and report to management on progress of files and cases.
To responsible in contract management, to ensure legal documentation from initial to completion stage properly recorded and kept.
Any ad hoc tasks assign by the management from time to time.


Job Requirements

Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor’s Degree of Laws or equivalent.
Minimum 5 years' relevant working experience in Data Centers or IT industry.
Possess strong sense of responsibility, initiative, ownership, interpersonal, communication and drafting skills.
Proactive and good team player.
Self-driven and able to work effectively and independently with minimum supervision.
Excellent oral and written communication skills; highly analytical with strong attention to detail.

Job desc:
Job Descriptions

Manage existing business by identifying potential sales opportunities and arrange sample requests for approval.
Develop and execute sales strategy to increase the company’s product sales performance and profit.
Negotiate the best achievable commercial agreements to achieve sales targets and in line with HQ business, marketing, and pricing policies.
Conduct research on competition’s demand and supply regarding industry-specific trends.
Visits suppliers/customers for the purchase/sales promotion of chemical and its related items.
Mapping and generating potential and new leads/opportunities.
Coordinate with HQ to discuss with suppliers technical & commercial team to meet required targets.
Coordinate, prepare and liaise with HQ regarding their supplier and customer visits by providing business background and activity by highlighting important issues for business discussions and follow-up actions.
Coordinate logistic and shipping arrangements to ensure smooth execution of ordering and delivery process for timely shipment expectations.


Job Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Sales & Marketing or any related field
At least 5 years of relevant working experience, preferable in oleochemicals related products
Good business sense/acumen and negotiating skills and good interpersonal skills
High sense of responsibility, aptitude for teamwork and problem solving
Malaysian only

Skills: Collaborative Work, Design, Figma (Software), Research, Teamwork, Usability, Usability Testing, User Experience (UX), User Experience Design (UED), User Research
Job desc:
If you ever wonder how is it like to be working in a people-first company, you should check this out.


One of our FinTech client is looking for a highly motivated Lead Product Designer to be part of their dream team. You’ll be working in a team of sharing the mission to empower people to build and protect long-term wealth.


This would be the perfect opportunity for someone who is:
+ Not a stranger to the UX design process – human-centric research, user research & persona, usability testing etc
+ Having a strong portfolio to demonstrate your proud projects across platforms (Web/App/ Androids & IOS)
+ Comfortable to handling conversation with stakeholders and articulating & presenting your design rationale
+ Dedicated individual who is able to work both independently and as a team player, and experienced in managing & mentoring juniors
+ Well equipped with your daily companion tools such as Figma, Dovetail, Maze is a huge plus.


What’s in it for you?
+ You’ll get to work with some of the most brilliant leaders and gain the international exposure
+ You’ll get to experience collaborative working spirit at its best
+ You’ll get to gain a holistic landscape in the creative & digital projects
+ You’ll be part of a pioneering team that shapes the future of this brand
+ You’ll be getting a comprehensive insurance coverage & L&D budget


Find this amazing?
Shoot your CV and portfolio to me at jchong@welovesalt.com

Skills: Additions, Agile Project Management, Interpersonal Skills, Maximo, Milestones, Oil & Gas, Project Control, Project Management, Project Plans, User Requirements
Job desc:
Job Responsibilities:
Prepare and maintain the Maximo Upgrade Project Plan which will list the activities, tasks, assignments, milestones, and estimates.
Monitor & control project schedules, budgets, risks and issues while ensuring project deliverables are of the highest quality and meet Company business user requirements.
Day to day Project Management along with vendor Project Manager and review project tasks, schedules, and resources and make changes or additions, as appropriate.
Lead the development and implementation of a broad, coordinated set of plans and programs to meet the goals and priorities of the Company IT department’s internal & external customers.
Establish documentation and standards for all deliverable materials.
Conduct regular scheduled project Status meetings and governance meetings.
To provide regular progress reports to the Company IT Manager.

Expected Skillset:
Resource should be having deep knowledge of principles, practices and theories in project management discipline. PMI’s PMP certification is a must. Knowledge of agile project management is a plus.
Experience with all aspects of Documentation, Planning, Design, Build, Test, and Deploy Phases within Maximo Asset Maintenance Software is expected.
Strong interpersonal skill and the ability to collaborate effectively on diverse teams.
Resource must have more than 10 years of Project Management experiences.
Oil & Gas experience is strongly preferred.

Job desc:
Our direct client who is a Fortune Global 500 company specializing in IT services and consulting is looking to hire (3) Senior React Native Developers.
This is a 12 months contract and open for onsite or remote strong candidates.

What are they looking for? Ideal candidates must have below skills and experiences:

Preferred minimum 5 years of experience in mobile development (Can be iOS and/or Android)
At least 3 years in React Native project(s) – Client is open to accommodate candidates with lower than 3 years as long as candidate can proof proficiency via live coding exercise
Have a published app to any application store (app store, play store, Huawei appgallery)
High level of proficiency in JavaScript skills
Basic level of proficiency in native code (Java and Objective-C)
Good understanding about the framework and design pattern
Experienced in unit testing (ex. Jest and Enzyme)

I would be happy connect and discuss this possibility.

Interested and qualified candidates may send their CVs to aab@rpint.com

Job desc:
We are looking for a proven Senior Secretarial & Governance Manager to join an established Energy Operator here in Kuala Lumpur.

Core duties & responsibilities:

Facilitates the refinement of the Governance framework for the company & it's subsidiaries including in relation to Environmental, Social and Governance (“ESG”) efforts.
To be involved in risk identification and mitigation activities.
Provides support for the execution of corporate finance proposals/transactions.
Assists in investor relations management.
Performs such other duties as may be assigned from time to time by the Vice President, Corporate Governance and/or the Group General Counsel.

Ideal to have the following:

A bachelors degree in accounting, business, finance, or economics. An MBA is preferred.
At least 10 years of relevant job experience, ideally in corporate finance, compliance, or governance.
Knowledge of the Main Market Listing Requirements of Bursa Malaysia Securities Berhad, rules, regulations, and guidelines of the Malaysian Securities Commission, the Malaysian Code on Corporate Governance, and the Companies Act 2016.
Be able to think critically, be meticulous, and approach work in an organized manner. High integrity, self-motivation, adaptability, and teamwork are required. In addition, you should be an independent multitasker with strong project management and communication abilities.
Job desc(HTML):
We are looking for a proven Senior Secretarial & Governance Manager to join an established Energy Operator here in Kuala Lumpur.


Core duties & responsibilities:


  • Facilitates the refinement of the Governance framework for the company & it's subsidiaries including in relation to Environmental, Social and Governance (“ESG”) efforts.
  • To be involved in risk identification and mitigation activities.
  • Provides support for the execution of corporate finance proposals/transactions.
  • Assists in investor relations management.
  • Performs such other duties as may be assigned from time to time by the Vice President, Corporate Governance and/or the Group General Counsel.


Ideal to have the following:


  • A bachelors degree in accounting, business, finance, or economics. An MBA is preferred.
  • At least 10 years of relevant job experience, ideally in corporate finance, compliance, or governance.
  • Knowledge of the Main Market Listing Requirements of Bursa Malaysia Securities Berhad, rules, regulations, and guidelines of the Malaysian Securities Commission, the Malaysian Code on Corporate Governance, and the Companies Act 2016.
  • Be able to think critically, be meticulous, and approach work in an organized manner. High integrity, self-motivation, adaptability, and teamwork are required. In addition, you should be an independent multitasker with strong project management and communication abilities.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Facilities Development, Network Design, Oil & Gas, Onshore Operations, Pre-commissioning, Project Direction, Project Implementation, Start-up Projects, Technical Requirements, Telecommunications
Job desc:
Job Description

WRS are looking for a Telecommunication Engineer, Instrumentation for a project in KL, Malaysia.

This is an office-based contract position looking to last between 2 and 4 years, and we are looking for someone with the experience from Pre-Feed through to Start-Up

KEY OBJECTIVES

Supervise technical matters relating to Telecommunication engineering works during FEED and EPCC of Onshore facilities of Lang Lebah development project and its related facilities, and ensure that the works are completed in compliance with the contract requirements and the reference specifications, design codes, and standards. provides technology solutions for Telecommunications (Fibre optic, Satellite, WiMax, Trunked Radio, Microwave, VSAT, SSB, CCTV, PAGA, RACON, WAN, LAN, WLAN, Firewall, etc.) of offshore and onshore facilities. The job includes technology selection, design, and technical resolutions of telecommunication system for next chapter of PTTEP i.e. IoT, 5G, fully remote unmanned operation and maintenance. His/her accountabilities include supervision the EPCC Contractor to carry out the detailed engineering, procurement packages as well as supervise the equipment factory acceptance test (FAT), site acceptance test (SAT), onshore installations and commissioning.

To engineer and ensure all telecommunication systems for the projects assigned will be fully functional as intended, meet project requirements, cost effective and meet planned schedules.

Principal Accountabilities

Responsible for the Project Execution covering all Engineering Phases from CFT development, Tendering execution, Basic engineering, Detailed engineering, Construction, Installation, Pre-Commissioning, Commissioning and Start-up.

Shall be responsible for, but not limited to, the followings

Telecommunication system designs, implementation, modification, integration, operation, support and maintenance including, but not limited to data analysis, troubleshooting and documentation
Perform telecommunication technology selection for next chapter of PTTEP
Perform network and security devices configuration to meet company “cyber security” standard requirement
Effectively and professionally interface with multi discipline engineer, Operations, Automation, teammates and other groups in supporting, maintaining and enhancing the telecommunication systems
Participate and fulfill the technical requirements of the telecommunication system along with the tendering process from the project strategy.
Oversee/supervise the engineering contractor team to complete telecommunication tasks during the conceptual designed basis and RFQ for EPCC package
Oversee/supervise the EPCC Contractor to carry out the detailed engineering, equipment/ material specifications, procurement strategies, procurement packages, fabrication, functional test, load-out, sea fastening, transportation, installation, hook-up, commissioning and system tests
Monitor and appraise the performance of the contractors. Initiate and implement the corrective actions when the performance of the contractor deviates from the project direction/requirements
Ensure effective implementation of SSHE rules and engineering best practices

Professional Knowledge & Experience

Education Qualification
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Electrical Engineering, Instrument and Control Engineering, Telecommunication Engineering
At least 15 years of experience in offshore/onshore telecommunication and network design, construction and material handling for facilities in Onshore gas plant
Has strongly knowledge in the engineering/design, including to QA/QC, construction and related codes & standards
Professional certificate by accredited Bodies/ Associations is an advantage

Desired Competency (Skills And Abilities)
Must have a good understanding of process and facilities design and production operations including a broad range of expertise on FEED, detail design development, construction/installation, commission/startup and production operations of oil and gas projects
Experiences in CFT development and Tendering execution of Offshore/Onshore gas plant/petrochemical/refinery industry are advantage
Familiar with PTTEP and/or PETRONAS operating and control practices is a plus benefit

Work Experiences
Minimum of 15 years of experience in Offshore/Onshore facility as discipline engineer with proven track record in FEED, Detailed Engineering, Site construction and Projects management & execution.
Experiences in FEED and/or EPCC of Onshore facility in the similar scale with Lang Lebah field is advantage.

Additional Desirable Qualifications (please Specify, If Any)

Knowledge in features/applications of Digital Oil & Gas field operation is advantage.
Conversant with related international codes and standards applicable for Telecom System design is advantage.
Proficient in design and selection of Telecom network/devices, Microwave/Radio System, Satellite System, Fibre optic communication, and Wire &Wireless communication, etc.
Experience in CFT development, Tendering execution, Basic engineering, Detailed engineering, Construction, Installation, Pre-Commissioning, Commissioning and Start-up projects of Offshore and Onshore facilities is advantage.

Please note this position is only open to local Malaysian candidates

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Job desc:
Airswift is looking to invite a Cargo Superintendent for our client offshore FPSO operation. This is a permanent position based in Malaysia.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
To actively contribute to Asset Integrity Management (AIM) efforts throughout the Floating Production Storage Offloading (FPSO) asset life cycle (design, fabrication, installation, commissioning, operations, late life operations and de-commissioning/abandonment).
The Cargo Superintendent has authority for marine activities such as cargo loading and offloading.
Manage or contribute to the management of the operation of the Cargo and Marine systems through departmental supervisors.
Liaise effectively with all relevant onshore and offshore departments
Delegate authority having due regard for competence and verify effective close out of tasks.
Promote safety awareness and broad application of the Management system, codes of practice and prime policies.
Ensure timely and effective close-out of survey and audit action items.
Monitor Management System feedback issues ensuring effective close-out.
Ensure timely and effective contributions to reporting and investigation of all incidents where required.
Start up Marine and Cargo Operations
Monitor and Maintain Marine and Cargo Operations
Prepare and shutdown Marine and Cargo Operations
Manage emergency response with due regard for safety of personnel, FPSO and environment
Controlled process discharges from area of responsibility to the environment are within prescribed limit

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
STCW II/2 Master of ships of 3000gt or more plus DCE for Petroleum /Gas as appropriate
Professional engineering certification, and / or intimate working knowledge with international codes, standards, recommended practices such as ASME, API, ANSI and ISO is an added advantage.
5 years sea service on Crude Oil Tankers, (VLCC preferred) with at least 3 years as Ch/Officer. Additional experience at Master rank preferable
Good knowledge of offshore FPSO operations, including Production, Process, Utilities, Marine Maintenance, and Safety Management, preferred.
Knowledge of tanker terminal activities.
Medically fit to offshore international standards such as ENG1 or equivalent.

Please forward your resume and certification to us. We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
By submitting your personal data and/or resume, you consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal data by Airswift for the purpose for which it is collected. EA License Number: 09C5031

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Account Reconciliation, Accounting, Accounting Software, Accounting Standards, Accounts Payable, Auditing, Finance, Financial Reporting, Korean, Treasury Management
Job desc:
About our client:
Our client is one of the well-known company within the FMCG/Retail industry. Currently, they are looking for Senior Accountant to join their growing team, reporting to the Finance Manager.

Key Responsibilities:
Handle monthly, quarterly, annual reporting and consolidate financial reports.
Provide financial reports and interpret financial information to top management while recommending further courses of action.
Assist in preparing and monitoring budgets.
Maintain and reconcile balance sheet and general ledger accounts.
Involved in financial analysis, variances and operational performance.
Develop trends and projections for the business’ finances
Work closely with Group Accountant in presentation slides for Board meetings & group reporting.
Assist to maintain internal controls over the Group’s accounting and financial procedures.
Liaise with auditors to ensure appropriate monitoring of company finances is maintained.

Key Requirements:
Degree in Finance & Accounting.
CPA/ACCA/MIA is required.
Min 5 years of working experience in financial & management reporting.
Audit background will be an added advantage
Extensive understanding of financial trends both within the industry and general market patterns.
Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills with good business acumen.

To apply for this position, please click on the relevant link. For more information, do not hesitate to drop an e-mail to chloe.chan@bell-ward.com

Kindly take note that ONLY shortlisted candidate will be notified for the role.

Company Overview

Industry: Banking / Financial Industry

Location: Kuala Lumpur

Job Responsibilities

Provide administrative and operational support to Relationship Managers.
Coordinate and manage business operation activities inclusive but not limited to call back-confirmation, balance short, TT cancellation amendments, balance check, loans & opening account related documentation inclusive of KYC, FATCA/CRS.
Provide Japanese/English translation related to business, Credit Application, Report Required and Instruction from Domestic Office, email and correspondences.
Attend to general client enquiries as and when necessary
Provide administrative support i.e logistic arrangements, stationery request, Seminar preparation.
Support the coordination and preparation of presentation materials, worksheet, database management for HOD/Advisors.
Maintain department expenses control within limit allocated, including company search, business travel, SSM & entertainment fees
Monitor due date controls and help streamline any operational process deemed redundant
Support termination of inactive and dormant account


Job Requirements

Proficiency in Japanese language (speak, read and write)
Applicant must have a recognized Degree in Finance/Banking or equivalent
Preferably with minimum 1 – 2 years of relevant working experience (administration in banking and Japanese-English translation)
Applicants must be able to work independently with minimum supervision
Strong knowledge of banking regulatory environment and regulations and deep understanding of industry trends, products, relevant laws and regulations

Job desc:
Job Details

Position : Recruiter (Talent Sourcing)

Working Hours : Monday – Friday (09.00 A.M. to 06.00 P.M.)

Working Location : Menara AIA Sentral, No. 30 Jalan Sultan Ismail, 50250 Kuala Lumpur

Start Date : ASAP

WHO CAN APPLY?

Diploma/Degree holder
Minimum 1 year of working experience as a recruiter for inhouse or external hiring.
Good English and Mandarin communication skills
Able to work in tight dateline
Able to work in KPI based environment
Fast leaner
Have interested to work in recruitment agency

Job Responsibilities

Source candidates using a variety of search methods to build a robust candidate pipeline
Screen candidates by reviewing resumes and job applications, and performing phone screenings
Take ownership of candidate experience by job descriptions, and position requirements
Perform reference checks as need
Facilitate the offer process by extending the offer and negotiating employment terms
Manage onboarding and new hire process
Manage the overall interview, selection, and closing process
Ensure all screening, hiring, and selection is done in accordance with employment laws and regulations

Serious applicants can send your updated resume to Fadzliah_Fabli@persolkelly.com

Subject: Job application for Recruiter (Talent Sourcing)
Please also provide your expected salary and notice period

Due to high number of applicants, only qualified candidates will be contacted for interview.

We thank you for your application 😊.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, Analytical Skills, Application Security, Computer Science, Network Security, OWASP, Presentation Skills, Presentations, Security, Security Testing
Job desc:
About The Role

Are you passionate about cyber security challenges? do you want to learn about design and application security? As Application Security Engineer, your core responsibility will be to support Agile DevSecOps development and operational teams securing their services.

We are looking for a self-driven Application Security Engineer. As the world's leading provider of secure financial messaging services, we recognize that security is a key value driver for our customers and us

What you can expect
As part of the team, you will develop your knowledge collaborating to key activities such:
Implementation of security capabilities, processes or tools.
Promotion of usage of security tools in development pipeline and operations.
Be the trusted partner of Agile and DevSecOps teams to support and collaborate securing their products from application and/or architecture perspective. Provide support in their security related activities during SDLC
Provide security requirements aligned with policies and standards.
Maintain security standards and guidelines to respond to changes in threats, technology or best practices.
Assess new threats, vulnerabilities and security alerts and recommend remedial actions.
Identify opportunities for improvements in work process and innovative approaches to completing scope of work in an efficient way.
Promote a strong security culture at SWIFT. We expect you to treat security culture as a brand, take it seriously and recognized that it is hard-fought and easily lost.

What will make you successful?
University degree in Computer Science or a related field; Master's degree an asset.
Typically has 1 to 2 years of relevant work experience.
Foundation knowledge in Secure coding techniques, CWE Top 25, OWASP
Foundation knowledge Static Application Security testing, Dynamic Application Security testing, Software Composition Analysis, API Security testing
Foundation knowledge Security features in Docker, Kubernetes or OpenShift or related container platform ecosystems
Customer and solution oriented.
Autonomous, driven with strong ability to quickly learn and adapt to change.
Proactive, open-minded and a true team player - gaining energy through active collaboration with others.
Ability to self-learn in fast paced technical environment.
Strong analytical skills.
Strong written, verbal and presentation skills. Adaptive communication to diverse audiences.

You may like to know the team better by knowing the people in the team. Review

LinkedIn profile of the people on the list below :

Ana Hernandez Head of Application Security at SWIFT

Natasya Rosli Talent Acquisition Specialist APAC (Recruitment Partner to this role)

What we offer

We put you in control of career

We give you a competitive package

We help you perform at your best

We help you make a difference

We give you the freedom to be yourself

We give you the freedom to be yourself. We are creating an environment of unique individuals - like you - with different perspectives on the financial industry and the world. An environment in which everyone's voice counts and where you can reach your full potential regardless of age, background, culture, colour, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion , or veteran/military status.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Accounts Receivable (AR), Billing Process, Billing Systems, Payroll Administration, Payroll Processing, Process Implementation, Soft Skills, Statutory, Team Management, Training
Job desc:
Job Description

Manage the payroll and billing for candidates and clients
Complete the pay runs by the set deadlines
Ensure timely and accurate pay and bill hours reconciliation
Address queries from candidates and clients with regard to payroll and billing
Generating all weekly and monthly payroll reports
Ensure that permanent placements are billed on a daily basis
Ensure sales margin below 5% and above 30% are accounted for after each pay run.
Submission of claims to the government such as NS Claims, Government paid leave as well as CPF refund for over-contribution
Filing of Form IR21 (Tax clearance) for foreigners and generating IR8A for candidates
Delegate the assigned work to the team
Review the work of team members to ensure accuracy and completeness
Provide support for ad-hoc projects and act as back up for the team when required
Assist the process implementation for new system rollouts

Qualification

Minimum Diploma holder
At least 5 years of payroll processing experience

Key competencies and personal attributes (knowledge and soft skill requirements):

Experience managing multiple pay runs per week or month
Knowledge of Singapore Employment Act and statutory requirements
Able to work in a high volume, fast-paced environment
Deadline driven with good time management skills
Possess a positive service attitude
Strong in MS Office

Interested candidates who wish to apply for the advertised position, please click on “Apply Now”.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Implement the new tool (Vision) and sales forecast process. Once the tool is operational, coordinate sales forecast process for KL zone
Collect necessary data and analyse sales history considering LTOs, shortages, Covid situation, etc.
Update forecast regularly
Take into account new products, switches, stops
Consolidate forecast per product family
Extract data monthly for S&OP and punctually
Share regularly with Sales, CS and Marketing
Relaunch frequently Sales to ensure they anticipate all LTO, new listings and stops


Job Requirements

Possess a Degree or Diploma in Business Administration, Supply Chain Planning or any related
At least 5 years of experience in data analysis role
Good leadership skill and able to work as a team member
Strong data analysis skill
Knowledge in Forecast system and ERP is an added advantage


Apply online or feel free to contact me directly for more information about this opportunity. Due to the high volume of applicants, we regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Thank you for your understanding.

Skills: Business Continuity, Business Continuity Planning, CISA, Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), IT Audit, Network Security
Job desc:
Our direct client – who is one of the leading global insurance and finance corporation is looking to hire motivated and talented Senior IT Audit Manager for Application Controls to be based in their Cyberjaya, MY office.


This is a full-time permanent role. Client offers a competitive yearly salary with awesome benefits!


As the Sr. IT Audit Manager, you will be:

Working closely with location's audit manager and CTO to maintain the IT audit - application controls universe, develop and deliver the IT audit plan for assigned locations (whenever needed).
Managing, executing and completing the assigned IT audit – application control engagements in accordance with the GIA Standards.
Partnering with financial auditors to assess application IT application controls related to key business processes.
Contributing to build a Group IT audit – application controls team with relevant skillset and business knowledge.
Assisting to manage the resource availability and adjust the IT audit plans based on the changing IT application controls, risk posture, and/or business priority.
Building audit relationship with key IT Management via regular interaction so as to be informed of emerging risk issues and other key changes for assigned locations and BUs.
Assisting in the development of annual audit plan Prepare audit reports (with fieldwork auditors) in accordance with QAR requirements.
Lead/facilitate discussion of issues and remedial action plans with the appropriate levels of management.


What are they looking for? An ideal candidate must have below skills and experiences:

8 - 10 years of IT audit or other relevant experience (e.g., IT application controls,
IT risk/ security management, information security tools implementation), preferably with strong understanding and track record in IT application risks and controls review.
Certificate holder of Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) and/or Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) and/or Certified Information Security Manager (CISM).
Prior experiences in IT infrastructure, Cybersecurity, system development process, business continuity management, life insurance industry and regional exposure is advantageous.
Solid analytical, time management, interpersonal and influencing skills.
Good problem-solving skills, ability to analyze complex data, identify core issues, investigate, evaluate and reach appropriate conclusions.
Knowledge in audit tools and other software such as data analytic tools (e.g., ACL, Tableau or Power BI) and Teammate are advantageous


It is worth exploring the market and see what the current market can offer. Let us connect and discuss this awesome possibility!

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Mechanical Engineering, Oil & Gas, Oil Analysis, Predictive Maintenance, RCFA, Reliability, Reliability Engineering, Rotating Equipment, Statistical Tools, Upstream
Job desc:
Job Description

WRS are searching for a Rotating Reliability Senior Engineer based in Malaysia

KEY OBJECTIVES

To actively contribute to COMPANY Maintenance Engineering and Reliability (ME&R) efforts throughout the asset life cycle (design, fabrication, installation, commissioning, operations, late life operations and de-commissioning / abandonment).
To assist Head of Maintenance Engineering & Reliability and Mechanical Lead to carry out analysis and produce reliability and availability data for all Mechanical Equipment (Rotating and Static) as reference for maintenance strategy planning. To provide weekly reporting of Mechanical Equipment reliability status.
Keep track and ensures all Rotating Equipment running hours are correct and switchover programs are adhered.
Focuses on redundant equipment availability and not limited to perform Corrective Maintenance to maintain redundancy.
Conducts RCFA when required and keeping a database of Bad Actors. Executes solutions from RCFAs as required.
Contract holder for Condition Based Monitoring contracts.
Analyzes CBM reports and follows up unacceptable vibration readings closeout, off specification Lube Oil analysis. Maintain line of communication to site personnel of which equipment not to be operated upon the CBM analysis.
Ensures all CBM PMs are executed as per schedule.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum Bachelor’s in Mechanical Engineering with Honors or equivalent.
Minimum 8 years of working experience on rotating equipment in upstream oil & gas project management.
Experience in Oil & Gas production operations an advantage.
Knowledge with international codes, standards, recommended practices such as ASME, API, ANSI and ISO is an added advantage.
Significant knowledge and experience of maintenance and risk management tools and processes, such as; root cause failure analysis, lubrication analysis, FMEA, RCM, RAM, HAZOP, HAZID, etc.
Experience in performing reliability initiatives, improvement, analysis, monitoring of Rotating Equipments.
Well experienced on rotating equipment preventive, corrective, and predictive maintenance including vibration analysis, oil analysis, and other predictive maintenance technologies. Trained and certified with at least level 1 or 2 Vibration Analysis.
Experienced in management of contractors, track record of project accomplishment including high level of safety performance, and leadership of action-focused teams.
Self-motivated, with positive and flexible work ethic. Willing to train and develop multi-national work force and assist in mentoring and developing underperforming staff and contractors.

Skills: Communication, Problem Solving, 7 QC Tools, Interpersonal Skills, Leadership, QC Tools, Quality Assurance, Quality Auditing, Quality Control, Quality Management
Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Responsible for all QA/QC activities.
Ensure that all products shipped to the customers are within the specification.
Trouble shooting and problem solving in cooperation with production as they arise.
Handle customer queries/ complaints and concessional release of product if required.
Improve business performance, staff training, and thorough involvement in other business improvement projects.
Responsible for ensuring that all procedures are conducted in accordance with the Quality/ ISO systems and enforcing QC/QA standards and ISO procedures to be applied.


Job Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in Chemistry/ Chemical Engineering/ Material Science/ Science & Technology or equivalent.
At least 5 year(s) of working experience in QA/QC functions, preferable in plastic films/ flexible packaging or printing processes.
Good in ISO 9000 Quality Management System and 7 QC Tools.
Must be resourceful, self-motivated, customer focused, and able to work as a team.
Possesses strong leadership skill, good communication and interpersonal skills.
Malaysian only.
Full-Time position(s) available.


Apply online or feel free to contact me directly for more information about this opportunity. Due to the high volume of applicants, we regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Thank you for your understanding.

Bachelor Degree

Job desc:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
You will be responsible for making sure that Pinkcollar delivers its services to its clients on time and support the day-to-day operations of the business.

Responsibilities Include
Manage timelines and prepare documents and contracts for candidate visa application at the Malaysian Immigration Department
Manage on-arrival logistics for candidates when they arrive in Malaysia
Develop thorough case strategies and approaches for the delivery of services.
Maintain communications and provide progress updates to both clients and internal team members.
Manage stakeholders and practice cross-cultural empathy with people from varying backgrounds.
Review daily and weekly progress of deliverables so that the team stays on track in terms of output and service delivery.
Contribute to organise efficient workflows and explore new ways to make the operations role more adaptable, robust and agile.
See here for more information on the role and the company.

[Apply now at https://my.hiredly.com/jobs/jobs-malaysia-pinkcollar-employment-agency-job-operations-officer]

Positive attitude toward day-to-day problem-solving
Ability to manage deadlines and prioritise work tasks
Passionate or willing to learn about social impact, ethical recruitment, foreign labour, issues faced by migrant workers, forced labour and modern slavery
Process-oriented or process-driven person
Ability to work well under pressure and good at making decisions quickly

Forward-thinking and an action-taker (anticipate potential problems and prevent them before they occur)
Interest in planning systematically and organising workflows to optimise efficiency.

Able to work collaboratively in a lean operations team under a dynamic environment

Work with company CEO and/or Director to strategically plan HR initiatives that will benefit the company and encourage more efficient and beneficial work from employees
Continually educate employees on company policies (including sexual harassment, appropriate dress, and social media permissions, etc.) and keep employee handbook current
Administer or change benefits, medical insurance, retirement plans, etc.
Monitor employee progress and stay abreast on company climate and culture, ensuring it stays positive and productive
Coordinate and direct work activities for managers and employees
Foster cross-functional relationships and ensure managers and employees are properly connected
Regularly meet with employees for progress reviews and assessments, discussing any problems or grievances they may have
Promote a positive and open work environment where employees feel comfortable speaking up about issues
Manage and supervise other HR staff, ensuring they are assigned and carry out proper tasks
Understand and adhere to all pertinent labor laws
Maintaining HR records, such as those related to compensation, health and medical insurance
Handling insurance-related issues
Managing workplace safety issues
Communicating and explaining the organization's HR policies to the employees
Follow up of confirmation records statutory obligations
Handling the full and final settlement of the employees
Conducting various welfare activities
Community initiatives programs - organizing and participation
Regular updating of communication channels
Preparing and submitting all relevant HR letters/documents/certificates as per the requirement of employees in consultation with the management
Liaising with all government agencies to ensure adherence to compliance
Preparing and processing timely distribution of salary, bonus, increment salary slip, leave encashment and full and final settlements
Recording, maintaining and monitoring attendance to ensure employee punctuality
Conducting employee orientation and facilitating newcomers joining formalities or via call as a handshake calls
Maintaining and regularly updating master database (personal file on Sharepoint, personal database, etc.) of each employee
Resolving grievances or queries that any of the employees have
Escalating to the right level depending on the nature of the grievance or issue
Preparing letters such as offers, confirmation and verification letters
Implementing and administering performance management processes as per the PMS policy and timelines
Conducting exit interviews for employees and recording them accordingly
Engaging with employees on a regular basis to understand the motivation levels of people in the organization
Keeping records of staff insurance and ensuring timely renewal
Coordinating with consultants and candidates for scheduling appointments with the management team for sourcing
Collect passport and return passport to vendor for immigration purposes
Arrange movement of employees on Myden
Preparing Denave access for the new joiners
Preparing Background Check Verification for Microsoft employees

Honest, ethical, and dependable

Positive, go-getter attitude and creative
Expert stress management skills and ability to make important decisions under pressure
