Bachelor’s Degree in human resources, business administration, finance, or related field
5+ years of management experience in HR
Highly computer literate in Microsoft Suite (especially Excel) and various HR software programs including HRIS
A proven leader with strong interpersonal skills, keen to motivate and effectively educate and connect department managers and employees regarding all HR matter
Job desc(HTML):
This job is sourced from a job board.
  • Work with company CEO and/or Director to strategically plan HR initiatives that will benefit the company and encourage more efficient and beneficial work from employees
  • Continually educate employees on company policies (including sexual harassment, appropriate dress, and social media permissions, etc.) and keep employee handbook current
  • Administer or change benefits, medical insurance, retirement plans, etc.
  • Monitor employee progress and stay abreast on company climate and culture, ensuring it stays positive and productive
  • Coordinate and direct work activities for managers and employees
  • Foster cross-functional relationships and ensure managers and employees are properly connected
  • Regularly meet with employees for progress reviews and assessments, discussing any problems or grievances they may have
  • Promote a positive and open work environment where employees feel comfortable speaking up about issues
  • Manage and supervise other HR staff, ensuring they are assigned and carry out proper tasks
  • Understand and adhere to all pertinent labor laws
  • Maintaining HR records, such as those related to compensation, health and medical insurance
  • Handling insurance-related issues
  • Managing workplace safety issues
  • Communicating and explaining the organization's HR policies to the employees
  • Follow up of confirmation records statutory obligations
  • Handling the full and final settlement of the employees
  • Conducting various welfare activities
  • Community initiatives programs - organizing and participation
  • Regular updating of communication channels
  • Preparing and submitting all relevant HR letters/documents/certificates as per the requirement of employees in consultation with the management
  • Liaising with all government agencies to ensure adherence to compliance
  • Preparing and processing timely distribution of salary, bonus, increment salary slip, leave encashment and full and final settlements
  • Recording, maintaining and monitoring attendance to ensure employee punctuality
  • Conducting employee orientation and facilitating newcomers joining formalities or via call as a handshake calls
  • Maintaining and regularly updating master database (personal file on Sharepoint, personal database, etc.) of each employee
  • Resolving grievances or queries that any of the employees have
  • Escalating to the right level depending on the nature of the grievance or issue
  • Preparing letters such as offers, confirmation and verification letters
  • Implementing and administering performance management processes as per the PMS policy and timelines
  • Conducting exit interviews for employees and recording them accordingly
  • Engaging with employees on a regular basis to understand the motivation levels of people in the organization
  • Keeping records of staff insurance and ensuring timely renewal
  • Coordinating with consultants and candidates for scheduling appointments with the management team for sourcing
  • Collect passport and return passport to vendor for immigration purposes
  • Arrange movement of employees on Myden
  • Preparing Denave access for the new joiners
  • Preparing Background Check Verification for Microsoft employees

  • Comfortable working in a highly visible role
  • Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Honest, ethical, and dependable
  • Experienced in mediation and conflict resolution processes
  • Positive, go-getter attitude and creative
  • Expert stress management skills and ability to make important decisions under pressure
  • Attentive listener; understanding, empathetic, and personable

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Data Warehousing, Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), Data Architecture, Data Modeling, Data Profiling, Logical Data Modeling, Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), Stored Procedures, Teradata, WSE
Job desc:
Job Overview

Role based out of KL-Malaysia will have 8-10 years of experience in Data Management and Data Strategy general understanding of data management activities hands on experience with managing Data Science Enablement led use case based aisgile implementation of data strategy across functions in MNCs advance knowledge of visualisation tools and techniques expertise in descriptive, predictive, and inquisitive analytics working knowledge of cognitive analytics and robotics automation understanding of data science workflow and productivity issues related to data ability to code in R and/or Python data distribution capabilities through API worked on semantically curated Data APIs to enable complex data API Mashups.

Key Responsibilities

Subject matter expertise in technologies (TD, HD, BDA, R, Phyton) and Data virtualisation, Data federation and Data ingestion
Understand and deliver data modeling requirements physical and logical data modeling - Data architecture and design
Drive data quality enhancements at scale to solve business problems in a prioritized manner, experience in specific tools like Data Mgmt, Data process, police, Operations data vs business data
Build and support data flow integration between different products increasing the capabilities of our products and expanding its use across the firm, build once, and use multiple times.
Ability to understand and deliver client requirements end to end for reference data and data lake aligned use cases. Ensure proper risk management process is adhered too, to mitigate risk exposure for the firm
Conduct and manage complex, strategic analyses of data environments, data architectures, operating models, information management processes, data related applications, infrastructure, and data disciplines to develop structured data modelling solutions.
Designing, creating, building, and maintaining data pipelines
Storing, extracting, organizing and managing huge data volumes in SQL-based databases (such as Teradata, Oracle) as well as NoSQL-based databases
Expert skills in writing intermediate to complex SQL queries, Stored Procedures, Functions, Views etc.
Design, develop, and implement ETL solutions using Informatica or ODI application

Requirements for this role

Should be able to quickly learn about different data systems used in the organization.
Must Have:
R, Python, Stata, WEKA, Orange(open Source)
Java, Perl, C++
Teradata
Hadoop Cloudera
DQ/DM Tools Trillium,informatica (Any data Modelling or data profiling tools)
Data Visualization Tools (Oracle DV,Denodo,Clairvoyant, OEDQ,Paxata)
ETL/ELT Tools Informatica,ODI,Talend
Good to Have:
SME Banking (Financial Market)
Data Warehousing
Big Data Exp
Master Data Management, Reference Data Management
Worked as SI/SA in Financial domain

Job Overview


Role based out of KL-Malaysia will have 8-10 years of experience in Data Management and Data Strategy general understanding of data management activities hands on experience with managing Data Science Enablement led use case based aisgile implementation of data strategy across functions in MNCs advance knowledge of visualisation tools and techniques expertise in descriptive, predictive, and inquisitive analytics working knowledge of cognitive analytics and robotics automation understanding of data science workflow and productivity issues related to data ability to code in R and/or Python data distribution capabilities through API worked on semantically curated Data APIs to enable complex data API Mashups.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: IT Recruitment, Recruiting, Screening, Sourcing, Technical Recruiting
Job desc:
Our client is a Singapore headquartered software services group focused on niche technologies helping customers create best-in-class technology and business solutions. They engage with customers to innovate faster, collaborate better and deliver more value using flexible engagement models.
Roles and Responsibilities
• Bachelor's degree in IT or Similar
• 4-6 Years of Experience in IT Recruitment is Mandatory
• Coordinate with Lead and Business Development Team to identify staffing needs
• Determine selection criteria
• Source potential candidates through online channels (e.g. Social Media platforms and professional networks)
• Plan interview and selection procedures, including screening calls, assessments and in-person interviews
• Assess candidate information, including resumes and contact details, using our Applicant Tracking System
• Design job descriptions and interview questions that reflect each position’s requirements
• Lead employer branding initiatives
• Organize and attend job fairs and recruitment events
• Forecast quarterly and annual hiring needs by department
• Foster long-term relationships with past applicants and potential candidate
• Experience in hiring IT Technologies like Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Java, iOS, Android, JavaScript

Skills: Budgeting, Employee Engagement, Employee Relations, Growth Initiatives, HR Policies, Human Resources (HR), Leadership, New Development, Retention Strategies, Talent Management
Job desc:
An exciting Head of HR job opportunity has just become available at one of the market leaders in high-precision metal components manufacturing and production to be based in Sungai Petani, Kedah.

About The Head Of HR Role

Reporting to CEO, the Head of HR is responsible for overseeing all aspects of human resources, its practices and operations in order to meet the needs of the business. You will work collaboratively with the senior management team to create an employee-centric work environment that is responsive to the needs of the company’s clients, allowing people to realise their full potential and support company’s strategic growth initiatives.

Key Responsibilities

Lead long-term strategic planning that is aligned with the organisation’s mission, vision, and strategic plan with anticipation of industry and business trends in order to promote people productivity, organisational efficiency and cost effectiveness
Be accountable for all activities of the HR department, provide overall leadership and guidance to HR functions
Develop strategic partnerships across the organisation and serve as a strategic adviser to executive and senior leaders to influence and champion people-focused decisions, strategic organisational design and build collaborative HR partnerships in support of business objectives
Lead the development of methods to collect and deliver metrics and analysis of performance, identification of gaps, attrition, hiring, employee engagement and creation of strategies from those analysis to build talent and improve people performance at all levels of the business. The Head of HR also forwards the findings of analysis to business leaders to influence decisions
Identify trends within designated business units and monitor execution of action plans to address issues through proactive training, turnover and retention strategies, career development and other methods
Maintain current knowledge and understanding of regulations, industry trends, current practices, new developments, and applicable laws regarding human resources across the country
Oversee departmental budget planning and management, ensuring alignment with approved operating plan

To succeed in this Head of HR role, you must have a proven track record of leadership and executive level experience.

Key Requirements

Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Advanced degree and relevant professional certifications is preferred
At least 15 years of experience, with a proven track record of leadership and executive level experience

This company has a strong history and is dominating the market they are in today. They have been maintaining as a top competitor in their industry over the years. The culture is open, ambitious and it is not limited to developing and training their people to the highest standards.

If you are driven, determined and want to take the next step in your career, this Head of HR role is right for you. You will be part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation and a progressive mindset.

Apply today or email me at jack.moh@robertwalters.com.my to discuss this new opportunity.

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Job desc:
An exciting Sales Manager (Johor) job has become available at a multinational automobile manufacturer.

About The Automotive Sales Manager (Johor) Role

This is a role for an aspiring leader who is looking forward to building and developing the business to a different level. Reporting to the Senior Manager, this role manages the mainly on sales and marketing programmes to achieve desired sales objectives and goals.

Key Responsibilities

Propose and implement branch/sales activities or programmes to attract customers to the showroom
Oversee and guide sales executive/supervisor in implementing sales and marketing programmes set by the management to achieve desired objective and goals
Adhere strictly to and implement the company’s accounting polices accordingly pertaining to discount structure, claims, cash transactions, etc., and liaise with the Manager – Finance on all finance-related issues
Ensure other trading incomes especially finance commission and insurance commission is obtained from vehicles sales so as to maximise vehicle profit
Recruit sub-dealers and supporters for incremental unit sales
Maintain good aftersales service towards customers
Maintain good rapport with fleet owners, government department personnel and head office staff
Ensure proper delegation of duties and responsibilities to the subordinates

To succeed in this Automotive Sales Manager (Johor) role, you must have prior experience in prior experience in sales management in the automotive industry.

Key Requirements

At least a degree in business studies or related
Minimum of five to eight years of work experience in a management role in sales
Good command of English and Bahasa Malaysia, additional language skills is an advantage due to the nature of the role
Strong interpersonal relationship and communication skills
Good knowledge of automotive terms and industries norms

This multinational automobile manufacturer needs no introduction and is expanding rapidly with significant growth over the past few years. The culture is demanding, but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude, the potential rewards are significant. The firm is also very focused on developing and training their people to the highest standards.

If you are driven, determined and want to take the next step in your career, this is the role for you. Great career progression opportunities await the right person in this exciting Automotive Sales Manager (Johor) job.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Problem Solving, Anti-Money Laundering, Compliance Training, Financial Services, Interpersonal Communication, KYC Verification, Occupational Health, Regulatory Compliance, Risk Assessment, Transaction Monitoring
Job desc:
A reputable entity based in Kuala Lumpur is seeking a highly qualified Manager, Compliance (AML). This is a job for a driven professional who is looking to make lasting impact to the organisation.

About The Manager, Compliance (AML) Role

In this business critical role, you will be responsible for leading regulatory compliance risk and reviews of the organisation and is expected to work in collaboration with the Regulatory Compliance (RC) team to participate in development of compliance standards and practice across the organisation/business units.

Key Responsibilities

Manage and implement the organisation's overall regulatory compliance governance and framework, including AML/CFT and sanction compliance programme
Conduct compliance risk assessment of the organisation, including reports on ML/TF inherent risks and AML/CFT mitigating controls, ongoing compliance status and on any findings of infringements and its recommended actions. This includes institutional ML/TF (IRA), products and business risk assessment and review of all business units’ policies, procedures, and process to ensure compliance towards the regulatory requirements
Effectively implement AML/CFT policy and procedure requirements by all business units across the organisation, including robust CDD/ECDD process and periodic review process, proper risk profiling of customers/KYC with appropriate ML/TF risk, screening requirements, enhancement of AML/CFT controls and monitoring. This includes to analyse and conduct internal due diligence compliance reviews/KYC on higher AML risk cases escalated by business units to compliance
Continuously review the compliance and regulatory risk by conducting thematic/periodic compliance monitoring reviews, produce review reports findings of corrective measures up to closure of actions, in compliance with AML/CFT laws regulations and policies
Be responsible for AML/CFT transaction monitoring (TM) activities, review TM alerts and conduct STR-related investigations and investigations of potentially suspicious transactions and/or high risk customers, including fraud investigations and law enforcement agency related investigations. The role includes establish relevant internal criteria and red flags to detect suspicious transactions, maintenance of negative listing, ensuring effective day-to-day AML operations handling and maintenance of AML systems and monitoring tools
Act as the Money Laundering Reporting Officer to submit Suspicious Transaction Report (STR) to Bank Negara Malaysia (BNM). Advise the management on confirmed unusual and/suspicious transactions with escalation of AML concerns. Liaise with BNM, relevant regulatory and agency to ensure compliance with laws and regulations and handling of audit reviews (internal & external) engagements
Continuously review, update and implement the group compliance policies, manuals, procedures, systems and control mechanisms in complying with applicable laws and regulations, including AML/CFT regulations, and best practices
Keep proper records and periodically report to the Board and Risk Management Committee (BRC) of non-compliance incidents/issues, including AML/CFT reporting, through submission of Compliance Reports to BRC
Provide regulatory advisory to all compliance related enquiries from business units, including AML/CFT and sanction matters. Supervise the Designated Compliance Officer of the various departments on AML/CFT and sanction matters
Conduct regulatory compliance training, including AML/CFT awareness training and programmes

To succeed in this Manager, Compliance (AML) role, you will need to manage and lead the end-to-end process of all compliance initiatives and projects, with its primary functions relating to AML activities and provide direction to the Anti-Money Laundering (AML) team towards its implementation.

Key Requirements

Bachelor’s/university degree from a recognised university or equivalent experience on compliance related disciplines, preferably with AML/CFT professional certifications
Eight or more years of relevant post-qualification experience within the financial services industry, with at least five years of managerial experience
Experience in a compliance function is a must, preferably gained from the banking or financial credit services industry
Good understanding, knowledge and applications of compliance risk management, best practices and methodologies
Extensive regulatory knowledge (AML/CFT, KYC, suspicious transaction, etc.)
Experience with background checks such as AML/CFT screening, KYC/CDD/ECDD
Experience with performing AML/CFT transaction monitoring and review of transaction alerts, report generation, solution case management through AML system and tools
Experience with performing regulatory compliance risk assessments
Ability to multitask, identify problems and issues and apply problem-solving skills to provide solutions
Ability to work independently, lead and coach subordinates, and a good team player
Ability to prioritise work and meet deadlines. Ordered, organised and able to determine priorities for self and subordinates
Positive attitude and good interpersonal skills

This organisation is an exciting addition to the financial services industry. The firm is very focused on developing and training their people to the highest standards.

If you are driven, determined and want to take the next step in your career, this is the role for you. Great career progression opportunities await the right person in this Manager, Compliance (AML) job.

Apply today or contact me to discuss this new opportunity.

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Licence Number : JTKSM 423C

Job title: PGP DISTRIBUTION OPTIMISATION MANAGER - GAS INDUSTRY [ZL1324-11]
Skills: Capital Expenditures, Contractor Management, Cost Management, Fleet Management, Key Performance Indicators, Planning & Scheduling, Quality Auditing, SHEQ, Safety Culture, Statutory
Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Safety, Health, Environment & Quality (SHEQ)

Accountable for overall transport safety & quality performance and statutory compliance
Effective utilization of resources in upbringing of safety culture in contractors, drivers, loaders.
Ensure the audit compliance of SHEQ/Statutory standards


Field Distribution Operation

Work closely with Field Distribution team and Planning/Scheduling team.
Optimum utilization of resources; Manpower (including drivers) – right allocation as per business volume & other constraints; Machines (trucks/trailers/equipment) – using up to the maximum level; Money – Using allotted capex / budgeted amount in the right projects


Cost Management, KPI & Productivity

Accountable to improve Key Performing Indicators (KPI) of country in comparison to last benchmark
Vehicle performance monitoring & optimization to control Variable Distribution Cost (VCD)


Fleet Management

Ensure whole fleet (owned or contracted) is maintained as per set guidelines or SOPs


Contractor Management

Direct involvement required in new transport contractor evaluation, qualification, and induction.


Driver Management

Review and set the Driver Ratio required per vehicle (including bench) to ensure smooth supplies.


Reports & Reporting

All incidents (including near misses) involving vehicle, equipment or driver/loaders must be reported immediately to the senior management and concerned persons.


Job Requirements

Minimum of 8 years’ experience in large multi discipline and diverse logistics & supply chain operations, preferably from cryogenic industry or gas & chemical industry will be an added advantage.
Graduate degree holder, preferably in Engineering or Science or Logistics / Supply Chain Management.
Expert in Transportation Management, Road Safety, Contractor Management & Project Execution, good knowledge on Maintenance Workshop Management will be an added advantage.
Based in Sunway office.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Construction, H2S, Pipefitting, Piping, Piping Design, Piping and Instrumentation Drawing (P&ID), Process Piping Design, Project Strategy, RTA, Technical Requirements
Job desc:
Job Description

Senior Piping Engineer

On behalf of an Oil & Gas operator, WRS are looking for a Senior Piping Engineer to work in Kuala Lumpur on a contract basis. This will be a 12 month renewable contract, paying a monthly salary in Malaysian Ringgit.

Job Duties Include

Responsible for all process/ non-process piping and pipe supports on Lang Lebah onshore facilities.
Participate and fulfill the technical requirements of the piping part along with the tendering process from the project strategy, and shortlist until RTA.
Lead the engineering contractor team to complete the piping tasks during the conceptual, designed basis, and Request for Quotation (RFQ) of the long lead items for the EPCI package.
Oversee/Supervise the EPCI contractor to carry out the detailed engineering, equipment/ material specifications, procurement strategies, procurement packages, fabrication, test-run, installation, hook-up, and pre-commissioning/commissioning.
Ideal candidate will have

Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent, in Mechanical Engineering
At least 12 years of experience in piping design and piping construction
Has strong knowledge in engineering/design, especially the piping, piping components, pipe support, stress analysis, corrosion/erosion, welding, QA/QC, construction, PDMS, and piping codes & standards both onshore and offshore.
Experienced in high H2S and high CO2 gas contents

If you are interested, please apply. PLEASE NOTE ONLY RELEVANT CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED!

Skills: Communication, Coaching, Consultation, Human Resources (HR), Interviewing, Negotiation, New Business Development, Procurement, Recruiting, Sourcing
Job desc:
Calling out industry professionals in the Supply Chain, Procurement, Engineering and Manufacturing sectors who are keen on a career switch into recruitment and still being able to leverage your industry knowledge and expertise. A Recruitment Consultant (Northern Region) job to be based in Penang has become available at Robert Walters Malaysia.

About The Recruitment Consultant (Northern Region) Role

Robert Walters specialises in placing mid to senior-level candidates on a permanent basis, providing professional recruitment services for our multinational client base. As we continue to build our expertise in the Supply Chain, Procurement, Engineering and Manufacturing sectors, we are now hiring Recruitment Consultants into this space. If you are a highly motivated individual with one to two years’ successful industry experience within the Supply Chain, Procurement, Engineering or Manufacturing sectors, have an entrepreneurial spirit with a strong appreciation of market dynamic, as well as maturity to work with senior clients and candidates - we will be very keen to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities

Gain a thorough understanding of your clients' business, culture and successfully interpret their unique resourcing requirements
Build long-term and trusted relationships with new and existing clients
Develop and implement short and long-term recruitment campaigns as well as deliver service, quality and results
Develop and provide consultation to a large network of candidates with both immediate and long-term career needs
Manage candidates' aspirations to ensure that they secure the career they want in an environment suitable for them
Assess their skills and experience, their career goals and their suitability for different roles
Manage the interview process and negotiate with clients on remuneration package

To succeed in this role, you need to be resilient, have strong commercial mindset, a proactive and positive approach, team spirit, excellent communication skills and an ability to meet targets in a fast moving and very competitive sales environment

Key Requirements

One to two years’ successful industry experience within the Supply Chain, Procurement, Engineering or Manufacturing industry
Open to experienced recruiters
Exceptional people - individuals with a keen flair for sales
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills
Ability to work in a dynamic environment and a desire to succeed and add value to clients' employee base
Self-starter, proactive and able to view things from a commercial perspective

This is an exciting sales-driven role. A career in recruitment offers an exciting step into a fascinating and richly rewarding professional environment. The successful candidate would be offered an unparalleled industry career development and an exceptional remuneration package based on team and individual performance targets in a fast-moving work environment, as well as the chance to work with some of the world’s leading global organisations. Working in a team environment, the financial rewards are highly promising; made up of a strong base and quarterly bonuses.

If you are looking to work for an international organisation that provides a long-term career path, ongoing skills training and exceptional earning potential, this Recruitment Consultant (Northern Region) role is right for you.

If you would like to apply for this role or find out more, please contact LIM Lee Ling on +604-240 2132 or email to leeling.lim@robertwalters.com.my.

Only shortlisted applicants will be notified

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

If you are looking to work for an international organisation that provides a long-term career path, ongoing skills training and exceptional earning potential, this Recruitment Consultant (Northern Region) role is right for you.

Job desc:
An exciting Digital Marketing Communications Specialist job has become available at a multinational manufacturing company.

About The Digital Marketing Communications Specialist Role

This is a role for an aspiring leader who is looking forward to building and developing the business to a different level. Reporting to the APAC Marketing Communications Leader, this role manages the mainly on branding strategies, lead generation, digital marketing, and online/offline communications platforms.

Key Responsibilities

Devise and execute the integrated digital marketing campaigns and lead generation programmes
Create marketing content and materials, and coordinate and execute creative projects from concept to delivery
Develop and improve the content and digital channels to drive new leads to the business
Manage the development of day-to-day digital marketing operations
Collaborate and manage both internal and external stakeholders with diverse personalities and professional backgrounds

To succeed in this Digital Marketing Communications Specialist role, you must have experience in building, shaping and enhancing an online and offline presence across appropriate mediums and platforms.

Key Requirements

Minimum of six years of hands-on experience in digital marketing and/or lead generation (ideally in the B2B industry)
In-depth understanding of lead journey management
Demonstrated experience in digital marketing, content and campaign creation
Experience in marketing automation/technology - email management, lead creation and CRM – Marketo, Salesforce, Power BI and other digital solutions
Good written and verbal communication skills – English, Mandarin (Optional) due to the nature of the role
Ability to conduct effective data analysis to identify issues and recommend better processes to optimise efficiency
Demonstrated experience in articulating ROI of marketing programmes

This multinational manufacturing company needs no introduction and is expanding rapidly and have experienced significant growth over the past few years. The culture is demanding, but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude, the potential rewards are significant. The firm is also very focused on developing and training their people to the highest standards.

If you are driven, determined and want to take the next step in your career, this is the role for you. Great career progression opportunities await the right person in this exciting Digital Marketing Communications Specialist job.

Apply today or email me at kyle.lai@robertwalters.com.my to discuss further. Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Skills: Communication, Accounting Standards, Employee Orientations, Finance, Financial Statements, Interpersonal Communication, Journal Entries (Accounting), Leadership, Withholding Tax, Year-End Close Process
Job desc:
An exciting Finance SSC Manager (Hybrid) job has just become available at one of the retail MNCs based in Kuala Lumpur. Reporting to the Regional FC, you will be a part of the dynamic team.

About The Finance SSC Manager (Hybrid) Role

In this position, you will play a key role in the design, launch and steady state operations of the finance SSC in Malaysia supporting the SEA and pacific region.

Key Responsibilities

Lead the launch and operations of a finance shared services centre serving the South East Asia region
Monitor and control good finance quality and compliance with regulatory requirements
Manage and oversee the daily operations of the accounting department including preparing journal entries and review accounting classifications for month-end and year-end closing
Review accounting transactions and ensure that all transactions are processed properly and accurately according to US GAAP and local statutory reporting requirements and ensure compliance with local business tax/permit and internal policy requirements
Prepare monthly financial statements and reports
Control submission of withholding tax and CIT to the revenue department on time
Supervise the team for month-end closing, assist in development and implementation of new procedures and processes to enhance the accounting workflows
Liaise with internal and external auditor, revenue department and other related authorities

To succeed in the Finance SSC Manager (Hybrid) role, you will need to have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

Key Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in accounting
Minimum of three to five years of experience in a leadership position
Good knowledge of taxation and accounting standards
Proficient in Microsoft Office, experience with SAP is preferred
Demonstrated ability to effectively balance financial and operational factors and analyse complex business problems to develop appropriate solutions in a timely and responsive manner
Good business acumen and internal function team orientation, highly developed interpersonal and communication skills
Detail-oriented, a proactive mindset, able to perform with minimal supervision, and demonstrated ability to work under pressure and deliver within deadlines

This retail MNC needs no introduction and is one of leaders in their field of expertise and they have a strong presence in the market. The firm is also very focused on developing and training their people to the highest standards.

If you are driven, determined and want to take the next step in your career, this is the role for you. Great career progression opportunities await the right person in this exciting Finance SSC Manager (Hybrid) role.

Apply today or email me at melissa.ang@robertwalters.com.my to discuss the opportunity.

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Problem solving skills.

Job title: FP&A and Supply Chain Finance Lead
Skills: Budgeting, Business Planning, Finance, Financial Modeling, Financial Planning, Financial Reporting, Forecasting, Management Accounting, Stakeholder Management, Variance Analysis
Job desc:
Job Description

About Our Client

This is an American MNC in the Manufacturing industry with a strong presence globally. They are established and have been successful as a business for decades. They are looking for a Finance Lead to handle FP&A and some Supply Chain Finance. This role would be based in Selangor.

Key Responsibilities

This role is responsible for financial planning & analysis (FP&A), management accounting, budgeting, forecasting and Supply Chain Finance. You will report to a Regional Finance Lead and manage 1 junior analyst. Business partnering is a core focus of this role and you will need to have good stakeholder management skill. Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to handle continuous improvement projects.

Skills And Experience Required

To be shortlisted for this role, you will need 5-8 years experience in a similar role with at least a Degree in Finance & Accounting or professional qualification. You will also need to have at least 3 years experience in the Manufacturing or FMCG industry ideally in a MNC. Candidates should be strong in analysis and business partnering and have the ability to work across matrix structures.

To apply, please click "APPLY NOW" or email Amanda Yap at . Data provided is for recruitment purposes only.

Due to the volume of applications received, we regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

If this job isn't quite right for you, but you know someone who would be great at this role, why not take advantage of our referral scheme? We offer MYR500 in shopping vouchers for every referred candidate who we place in a role. Terms & Conditions Apply.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Banking Operations, Communication Training, Enterprise Risk, Finance, Financial Services, Mandarin, Market Knowledge, Operations, Risk Management, Team Management
Job desc:
Featured

Senior Executive, Global Operations (Mandarin Proficient)

Job Description

Market leading financial institution in the Asia Pacific Region
Highly competitive remuneration package
Hybrid working arrangements

Role Responsibilities

Running and coordinating global operations functions such as compliance, risk management, governance and other related functions among all global operations hubs to ensure that the established service standards are met.

Awareness and understanding of the Group's business strategy and model appropriate to the role
Support strategy to streamline processes, enhance productivity, reduce risk, improve controls, and leveraging technologies
Managing a team of highly efficient people by effective supervision
Maintain effective cost budget planning & forecasting and deliver competitive cost income ratio.
Identify migration opportunities and ensure overall governance on smooth migration.
Proactive in seeking regular assurance that the teams are performing to an acceptable risk and control standard within the global hubs.
Ensure the provision of ongoing training and development; ensure that direct reports are suitably skilled and qualified for their roles and that they have effective supervision in place to mitigate any risks
Ensure root causes reports relating to operational incidents are completed in line with the Banks policies including meeting of all reporting time lines. This includes the implementation of any appropriate process and control changes to minimise the probability of a re-occurrence
Identify and escalate Risk Issues as per Enterprise Risk Management Framework Policy.

Requirements

MUST be able to speak and read Mandarin
At least 3 to 5 years of similar working experience in Banking Operations/ Finance/ Risk Management/ Compliance with team management exposure.
At least 4 years of experience within the Financial Services sector with fair market knowledge
Knowledge in lending products and processes is an added advantage
Team player, strong interpersonal and communication skills
Conversant in English, demonstrate effective written and verbal communication skills
Strong knowledge in Microsoft Office applications i.e., Excel, Words, Power Point

How To Apply

Contact Vighnesh Gunasegaran on +(60)3 9212 7975 or APPLY NOW by clicking the button below. Please send your updated CV to vighnesh.gunasegaran@ambition.com.my quoting ref no. # 261913. For similar opportunities, please visit www.ambition.com.my.

Skills: Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Brand Awareness, Brand Marketing, Digital Marketing, Food Marketing, Funnel Optimization, Graphic Design, Mandarin, Marketing, Marketing Analytics, Marketing Strategy, Product Marketing, Social Media Marketing
Job desc:
Qualifications:
Bachelor Degree in Marketing/Advertising or equivalent
Min 3 years experience in marketing field, in both digital and analog marketing
Fluent in English, Malay, Mandarin
Proficient in Microsoft Office and graphic design programs such as Adobe Photoshop or Adobe Illustrator

Responsibilities:

Summary: In this business-critical role, you will serve as an advisor, a strategic partner, an analyst and a planner for fast-paced teams from the Retail business (B2C) and Food Service Business (B2B).
The role requires the ability to not just build awareness and brand presence, but to also translate data points into insights pertaining to marketing goals. This position plays a critical role in enabling the teams to meet KPIs and support of both the sales function and marketing campaigns at scale.

Specific duties & responsibilities:
Execute marketing campaigns and brand plans to establish and increase brand presence in the market such as media activities, branding events including road shows and product launches in line with company and HQ objectives.
Responsible in developing promotional materials, including company brochure, flyer, menu booklet, product packaging, and other sales aids.
Handling all customer service concerns on a daily operation basis via in-bound calls or social media pertaining to general enquiries, complaints, comments, feedback and other raising issue related to companies information and products and to share with related PIC.
Managing company's official Facebook page, Instagram account and homepage; learn to analyze digital campaigns with overall marketing strategies, communications, plans and objective.
To oversee projects and events from conceptualization till execution and preparing post-event reports.
Monitor market requirements for current and future products by conducting market research/competitive analysis and work closely with R&D in new product development.

Skills: Import/Export Operations, Logistics Management, Negotiation, Procurement, Production Planning, Stock Control, Supply Chain Management, Teamwork, Third-Party Logistics (3PL), Working Experience
Job desc:
About The Company

Randstad is partnering with an Australian based company that specialize in biodegradable plastics manufacturing. The company is expanding their plant and looking for Logistics Executive as part of their growth plan.

Duties And Responsibility
To co-ordinate and liaise with related departments in order to keep track the “In Full- On time” deliveries.
To handle and co-ordinate matters related to shipping and stock control. To coordinate with the production planning team on the relevant material incoming requirement.
To investigate and resolve any inventory discrepancies. To supervise activities performed by purchasing and stock control.
To ensure accuracy product inventory through counts and reports.
Skill/experience
At least Diploma/Degree in Supply Chain/Logistics/Business Administration or equivalent.
Prior experience working in manufacturing will be added advantage
Must possess at least 2-4 years working experience
Good knowledge in MS Office, ERP would be an advantage.
Good negotiations skills, dynamic and highly motivated individual.
How To Apply

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link. Alternatively, please send your resume to kavilnd.a@randstad.com.my (with subject title: Logistic Executive - Manufacturing) or call Kavil at 014-3205572 if you are interested in the job.

Skills: Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Infor Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Logistics Management, Procurement, Production Operations, Production Planning, Production Schedules, Supervisory Skills, Supply Chain Management, Working Experience
Job desc:
About The Company

Randstad is partnering with an Australian based company that specialize in biodegradable plastics manufacturing. The company is expanding their plant and looking for a Production Planning Executive as part of their growth plan.

Duties And Responsibility
To be responsible for planning, organising, directing and controlling all aspects of production operations to meet the delivery and quality expectation and attaining optimum utilization of manpower machinery and materials.
To perform and make production planning functions such as raw materials, work-in- progress, and production scheduling in order to render punctual delivery.
To coordinate with procurement team on the relevant material incoming availability and delivery.
To co-ordinate and liaise with related departments in order to keep track the production schedule to meet “In Full-On time” delivery.
Coordinate day to day activities with production teams to ensure that manufacturing operations run according to the established production schedules; volume, cost, and wastage targets; and quality standards.
Prepare production schedules and reports so that performance problems can be identified and resolved.
skill/experience
At least Diploma/Degree in Supply Chain/Logistics/Business Administration or equivalent.
Prior experience working in manufacturing will be added advantage
Must possess at least 2-4 years working experience as production planner or production executive
Good knowledge in MS Office, ERP would be an advantage.
Must possess strong leadership and supervisory skills
How To Apply

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link. Alternatively, please send your resume to kavilnd.a@randstad.com.my (with subject title: Production Planning Executive) or call Kavil at 014-3205572 if you are interested in the job.

Skills: Key Performance Indicators, Mandarin, Negotiation, Output, Personnel Management, Production Management, Production Planning, Safety Regulations, Scopes, Teamwork
Job desc:
About The Company

Randstad is partnering with a key equipment manufacturing company with strong engagement with market leading brands for both the industrial and consumer product lines. This client provides one-stop solution to key clients in design, manufacturing, sales, installation and after-sales services. They have a sales office located at Selangor, and a plant operating in Negeri Sembilan where this role will be based at.

About The Job

As the Production Manager, you will be responsible to oversee overall operations activities to ensure output meets business demands. Some key scopes include:
Production planning & manpower scheduling, KPI settings
Ensure production work environment adheres to environmental, health & safety regulations.
Identify areas to boost team skills, motivation and development
Work with cross functional teams to ensure smooth operations
About The Manager/team

You will be reporting to the General Manager of Operations, and managing a medium-sized team of production workers. If you are new to taking up a management role, you will gain the opportunity to manage a sizeable team of 30 headcount in the production team.

About The Requirement
Degree in Engineering field with several years of work experience in production - such as assembly manufacturing
Track record of hands-on production management & manpower management
Mandarin language is mandatory

Company name: IdealSeed Resources Sdn Bhd (Subsidiary of TechnoDex Berhad)
Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Back-End Web Development, Data Architecture, Data Modeling, Database Design, Jakarta EE, Java, JavaServer Faces (JSF), Stored Procedures, Systems Analysis, Technical Design
Job desc:
This is a technical role as part of an application development team working on deployment online systems. Candidate has to be dynamic and adaptive in working with people of different culture and able to learn fast on the technology and application aspects.

The Application Developer would work closely with our customers to understand their business model, requirements and translate them into software technical requirements and design document.

Responsibilities
To design, develop and maintain enterprise-scale application.
Perform system analysis, database design, process design and develop solutions to fulfill business requirements.
To participate in analysis and translate requirements into technical design.
To develop web interface using JSF technology.
To develop various Java and J2EE software solutions.
To develop and execute unit test cases.
To perform code review.
To perform deep level analysis and comprehend to current product engineering activities.
To assist in resolving/troubleshooting product and revolving technical issues in multiple application.
Other assignment that might be assigned from time to time.
Min 3 years of working experience in Java and backend knowledge

SQL Skillset
- SELECT, INSERT, DELTE, UPDATE are the most basic developer should know.

- User Defined Function, Stored Procedure & Create Table/Index are required to know.

- SQL Packages will be advantage.

*Open to expat from all nationality..
** Visa will be provided
***Accommodation will be provided (one night)
****Good salary package

Job title: Customer Service Support - BM + Eng Speaker
Skills: English, Customer Satisfaction, Customer Service, Customer Support, Escalation, Key Performance Indicators, Product Knowledge, SPM, Service-Level Agreements (SLA), Technical Support
Job desc:
Immediate joiner ONLY! - Permanent Job
SPM and above atleast 6 Months in CALL CENTER eligible to apply
Basic Salary Range:- RM 2025 + Additional KPI Allowance up to RM 300
Working Hours:- Rotational Shift 24 by 7
Working Days:- Monday - Sunday (5 Days 2 Days Off Rotational)

POSITION SUMMARY:
To provide premium customer support to the client’s customers. This support is provided by either phone or email, which includes direct contact with the client, its customers and their support partners.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide primarily customer service-based phone support to the client’s customers.
Activate and engage with client/customer whilst providing accurate information of customer’s issue at hand.
Accurately record and update customers’ cases into the client’s CRM and trackers following appropriate processes.
Provide accurate and understandable information to all customers and support partners.
Ensure customer issues and/or complaints are either addressed or escalated to the appropriate level, whilst ensuring follow through in all cases.
Ensure all follow ups are done in a timely manner.
Ensure all SLA’s are met appropriately.
Maintain high level of customer satisfaction whilst maintain a professional manner.
Be familiar with all policy, processes, and product knowledge and escalation paths.
Remain polite, patient and courteous with customer throughout the experience.
Ensure the end-to-end experience for all customers is at a high level of customer satisfaction

Requirements:
Minimum of 6 Months experience in Customer Service and related role
Open to all Local Malaysian
Able to Speak fluently in Bahasa Melayu & Basic English
Able to start on 6th February 2023 Intake

Job title: Snr Engineer, Project CCS (Carbon Capture Storage)
Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Carbon Capture, EPC, Engineering Change Control, Front-End Development, Oil & Gas, Onshore Operations, Project Control, Renewable Energy, Scopes Of Work, Technical Presentations
Job desc:
Airswift is an international workforce solutions provider within the energy, process and infrastructure industries. Airswift serves as a strategic partner to our clients, offering a turnkey workforce solution to capture and deliver the top talent needed to complete successful projects by aligning with the unique needs of our clients. With over 800 employees and 6,000 contractors operating in over 50 countries, our geographical reach and pool of talent available is unmatched in the industry and the level of experience, exposure and expertise that the organization has is unparalleled.

Our client is seeking a Senior Project Engineer to work within their CCS facilities located in Malaysia.

Job Requirement

Ensuring Engineering is executed accordance with the Project Execution Model / Plan (PEM/PEP) and in accordance with the schedule, budget and contractual requirements, keeping a focus on Quality and HSE aspects
Coordinating the preparation of FEED and EPC tenders for onshore projects, including preparing and reviewing sections of the tender such as scopes of work
Coordinate and support project engineering activities as directed by the Engineering Manager, including Area / System Engineering and internal / external interface management
Task Force coordination, including project start-up support
Monitoring the project schedule and manhour budget
Integrity and Compliance coordination
Engineering change control coordination, including identification of changes and preparation of engineering input to change orders
Contribute, as necessary, to any technical and commercial evaluations/decisions being made related to the project
Preparing and delivering technical presentations
Risk management, to identify project threats and opportunities
Keeping the Engineering Manager and Client representative informed of project/task progress.
Job Qualification

University degree or relevant education with more than 10 years post graduate experience in front end, FEED and/or EPC projects
Track record in Project Engineering role(s) from a minimum of one FEED, E&P or EPC project
Previous experience of preparing and coordinating EPC tenders, including preparation of EPC scopes of work
Minimum 5 years’ experience within the onshore oil & gas, renewables and carbon capture sector
Knowledge of interdependence relationship between departments and disciplines
Demonstrated knowledge of procurement and vital project control aspects
Able to effectively negotiate critical issues with Engineers / Designers and Clients.

  • Previous experience of preparing and coordinating EPC tenders, including preparation of EPC scopes of work
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience within the onshore oil & gas, renewables and carbon capture sector
  • Knowledge of interdependence relationship between departments and disciplines
  • Demonstrated knowledge of procurement and vital project control aspects
  • Able to effectively negotiate critical issues with Engineers / Designers and Clients.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Problem Solving, Cost Control, Document Management, Integration Engineering, Pre-commissioning, Project Engineering, Site Inspections, Technical Requirements, Technical Specs, Troubleshooting
Job desc:
Airswift is an international workforce solutions provider within the energy, process and infrastructure industries. Airswift serves as a strategic partner to our clients, offering a turnkey workforce solution to capture and deliver the top talent needed to complete successful projects by aligning with the unique needs of our clients. With over 800 employees and 6,000 contractors operating in over 50 countries, our geographical reach and pool of talent available is unmatched in the industry and the level of experience, exposure and expertise that the organization has is unparalleled.

Our client is seeking a Senior Project Engineer to work within their facilities located in Malaysia.

Job Requirement
Plan, define, award and manage LQ Engineering Contractor’s technical deliverables for both basic engineering and detailed design, as well as their timely issuance to support construction and integration activities. In some cases, work may be performed in-house using Yinson’s own engineering resources, in most other cases it will be performed by a 3rd party.
Plan, define and award and manage LQ contractor’s technical deliverables and equipment delivery to achieve overall project schedule targets. Manage interfaces, interact / deconflict with other contractors.
Plan and define refurbishment & life extension scope of work related to existing LQ. This activity involves site inspection of the candidate vessel and existing documentation gathering and cataloguing.
Prepare project-specific discipline-related technical specifications and drawings with regards to all Client, Company and Classification Society requirements.
Ensure compliance with Client specification and corporate specifications.
Prepare, interface with client and maintain a deviation request list with regards to all specifications.
Ensure that all contractors and vendors meet the contractual, Classification Society and technical requirements related to LQ engineering, including Working Environment.
Responsible for ensuring development and consolidation of LQ engineering registers/lists, using input from the other disciplines.
Assist with review of interface engineering registers, P&IDs, D&IDs, calculations and drawings.
Ensure compliance with Safety Studies recommendations and best practices.
Assist trouble-shooting during construction, mechanical completion, pre-commissioning and commissioning, through to start-up, and including during operating regime. (Construction management and supervision will be by others).
Travel as required, including but not limited to shipyards in SE Asia region, China, Middle East region, other Yinson Offices (Oslo, Malaysia), candidate vessels (onshore/offshore), operational production units (offshore) and onshore support bases.
Key Duties & Responsibilities:

Perform as technical leader for LQ Engineering.
Ensure that project budgets are kept, and life cycle costs to Yinson are minimized and that project schedule is maintained.
Manage the Engineering Contractors and Equipment Vendors. Follow-up and monitor Contractor schedule and progress and ensure any deviation is mitigated by corrective action coordinated with YP team.
Interact with Client as required.
Identify and ensure execution of the LQ engineering scope of work in accordance with the legal obligations, contract terms, scope of work, technical requirements and company policy.
Interact with and support the engineering contractors as required (including Hull Engineering, Integration Engineering, Marine Engineering, EITC Engineering, HVAC Engineering, etc).
Achieving resolution of multi-discipline equipment problems by coordinating with other discipline engineers and project engineering management team.
Update job knowledge by tracking and understanding emerging methodology improvements; and absorbing new practices from clients and partners.
Engineering problem solving and troubleshooting, even when not directly in own discipline (taking a holistic approach to the project).
Coordinate discipline issues between client, contractors, vendors and other relevant parties.
Provide input to weekly/monthly progress reporting and other relevant status information as needed.
Participate in audits and review processes as necessary.
Interact with non-technical disciplines as required (document control, cost control, planning).
Other tasks as requested by the Engineering Manager.

Job title: Snr Engineer, Structural CCS (Carbon Capture Storage)
Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Civil Engineering, Detailed Design, ISO 14001, ISO 9001, Legislative Relations, OHSAS 18001, Presentations, Scorecard, Tech-savvy, Tender Submissions
Job desc:
Airswift is an international workforce solutions provider within the energy, process and infrastructure industries. Airswift serves as a strategic partner to our clients, offering a turnkey workforce solution to capture and deliver the top talent needed to complete successful projects by aligning with the unique needs of our clients. With over 800 employees and 6,000 contractors operating in over 50 countries, our geographical reach and pool of talent available is unmatched in the industry and the level of experience, exposure and expertise that the organization has is unparalleled.

Our client is seeking a Senior Structural Engineer to work within their CCS facilities located in Malaysia.

Job Requirement
Relationship management, and related business development activities with new and existing clients
Project Management
Review, supervision, and development of technical skills within the team
Technical input on a broad range of projects
Provide detailed design work across a broad range of projects within building structures engineering and related areas
Lead the technical / design input on such projects, ensuring work quality is maintained at the expected standard
Provide input into the on-going skill development within the Structures team through such activities as the mentoring of less-experienced staff members; researching/developing novel technical/design applications and/or procedures; and playing a key support role to senior staff members in all formal and informal training-related activities
Where appropriate, to liaise with other Business Units within the geography and more broadly across the region, providing particular expertise on building structures engineering as appropriate
Effectively manage the time, quality and performance of projects.
Extend relationships with existing key clients to enable an expansion of business opportunities for the Structures team, and (where appropriate) other Business Units within the geography
Assist in the preparation and delivery of detailed tender submissions and presentations.
Prepare project reports for clients summarising key issues and strategically advising on best outcomes
Assist in the on-going development and maintenance of quality systems
Be fully aware of all legislative requirements and other regulations governing Occupational Health and Safety, and assist in ensuring these are adhered to within the office and on all projects
Participate in broader Office, Geography, Regional and/or Arup Group wide activities as assigned or appropriate
Support and actively implement the Arup vision and strategy statement, as measured through the key areas identified in the Australian Region’s Balanced Scorecard and the Buildings group Scorecard
Supporting the firm’s compliance in maintaining ISO 9001, OHSAS 18001 and ISO 14001 requirement.

Engineering-related Skills:

Relevant Degree in Civil Engineering or equivalent
At least 5 years of relevant experience in civil and structural works
Substantial knowledge and consulting and technical experience in building structures engineering and related areas
Ability to independently undertake project and technical analyses, and report on results
Experience in managing key projects, including the supervision of multi-disciplinary project teams where appropriate
Experience in the effective technical supervision and development of less-experience team members
Substantial experience in the consulting engineering environment, including the ability to advise clients on cost-effective, sustainable solutions

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Amazon Web Services (AWS), Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD), DevSecOps, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Microservices, Prisma Photo Editor, Security Tools, Templates, Veracode Platform
Job desc:
Dear Linked Folks
We are hiring for DevSecOps Engineer
Role: DevSecOps Engineer
Location: KL, Malaysia
Fulltime Permanent Role
Please Note:-
Only Immediately available candidates or maximum 2 Months Notice Period candidates are considerable
Minimum overall 5+ Years’ of experienced candidates and at least 2-3 Years’ experience in DevSecOps
This is an onsite role in KL, Malaysia
Preferred Candidate location is Malaysia, but the Client is fine to consider candidates from other countries
Any candidate from any country can apply for this role
Selected candidates must be willing to relocate to KL, Malaysia after the final selection
Malaysian Work Visa will be applied by the client for selected candidates
Mandatory Skills:
DevSecOps
K8 ( Kubernetes )
Jenkins
Microservices
AWS / Azure / Cloud
Job Description:-
Responsible for the automating delivery processes and maintaining the continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline by:
Collaborates closely with development teams to understand their current build and release processes and make recommendations for improvement.
Partner with cross-functional stakeholders, including development, operations, quality assurance and security, to streamline processes.
Provides guidance to development teams to improve performance and operability of the solutions they develop.
Builds and maintain the CI/CD pipelines to improve developer productivity, agility, and code quality.
Works with Solution Architecture COE to make application templates available on the DevOps platform with related modifications to CI/CD pipelines
Develops and continuously improve automation solutions to enable teams to build and deploy code efficiently and consistently.
Builds automated testing to reduce manual effort and improve product quality.
Ensures that systems meet business and customer needs for reliability and availability.
Monitors and manages platform (tools and integrations) performance and service quality, including initial troubleshooting, identification of root cases and issue resolution.
Works closely with cross-functional stakeholders to analyze and troubleshoot complex production issues.
With the addition of experience in integration with security tools Veracode, Prisma.
Interested candidates can send their resumes at javed@aryan-solutions.com

Job title: Mandarin Speaking Senior Audit & Tax Executive
Skills: Communication, Accounting, Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA), Auditing, Companies Act, Executive Management, Finance, Financial Audits, Financial Statements, Mandarin, Tax, Tax Audits, Tax Planning, Tax Preparation
Job desc:
We are seeking a driven Mandarin Speaking Senior Audit & Tax Executive to join our team in Puchong. The ideal candidate will have experience in preparing tax computations and returns, assisting in tax audits and reviews, researching tax issues, and providing tax planning and consultancy services to clients. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are essential in this role as the candidate will be required to interact with clients and work closely with the audit team.

Responsibilities
1) Perform audit on financial statements of companies
2) Prepare audited financial statements
3) Prepare tax computations of companies audited
4) Manage audit and tax jobs assigned, ensuring all jobs are performed diligently and on timely manager

Qualifications
1) 2-3 years of working experience
2) Good command of written and spoken English & Mandarin
3) Good technical knowledge in MFRS and MPERS
4) Knowledge of tax
5) Knowledge of Companies Act 2016, and other law and regulations governing business entities in Malaysia
6) Degree in Accounting / Finance
7) CA(M) / ACCA / CPA
8) Pleasant, presentable and have good communication skill
9) Confident to deal with clients
10) Can work under pressure and independently
11) Can manage tight deadline and make sure all jobs on time
12) Manage all jobs assigned, ensuring all jobs are done diligently and timely manner
13) Assist in other works assigned from time to time

Skills: Accounting, Accounts Payable, Auditing, Bank Reconciliation, Deadline Oriented, Finance, Invoice Verification, Managerial Finance, Teamwork, Value-Added Tax (VAT)
Job desc:
Conduct Accounts payable and payments.
Ensure processes from invoice verification to payments are in accordance with SOPs.
Timeliness, accurate and completeness for recurring and non-recurring transactions.
To assist in providing audit sampling or audit related matter when it comes to AP.
To maintain a good documentation of suppliers listing, such as vendor master data, creation form, bank details.
Ensure payments are prepared and released within the payment terms stated in the invoices.
Supports VAT/GST tax compliance for UK and AUS entities.
Prepare forms and monitor checklist to ensure timeliness of submission and payment.
Support Corporate short-term cash flows forecast.
Detail phasing of all payments on a weekly basis.
Track actual payments to forecasts.  Banking-related matters
Opening of new bank account i. Liaise with bank and company secretary on the required documents. ii. Monitor and follow up status of opening of bank account.
Maintain good documentation for banking audit data on timely manner.
In charge of preparation of bank reconciliation.
Assist in journal preparation for UK/AUS entities:
Able to post journals according to instructions given.
To ensure journals are reviewed and being sign off timely.
SUN automation to improve processes in terms of accuracy and efficiency.
Enhance Finance SOP and process flowchart.
To assist in billing for UK entities.
Controls, Compliance & Risk: Recognizes importance of sound internal control and maintaining high standards of ethical conduct
Other ad-hoc duties as prescribed by the Finance Manager to assist in achieving Finance Department’s objectives.

Requirements
Possess at least Degree in Accounting/Finance, CPA, ACCA or relevant qualification.
At least 3 – 5 years of relevant working experience in auditing and/or accounting (exposure to public listed company in Malaysia is an advantage, but not necessary).
Experience in closing full set of accounts.
Good understanding of indirect taxes regulation
Knowledge of SUN system will be an advantage
Deadline oriented, meticulous and have a keen attention on details
Self-motivated and ability to work in a team
Assertive and able to work under pressure and tight deadlines.

You may apply direct to: jenyfa.hashim@adecco.com.
Please be informed that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

At least 1 - 3 years' of sales experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work

Job title: Area Sales Manager (East Coast) - Personal Hygiene Goods
Skills: Account Management, Customer Satisfaction, Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG), Leadership, Negotiation, New Business Development, Sales & Marketing, Sales Management, Sales Presentations, Training
Job desc:
Competitive salary and benefits
Experience to build a growing brand in Malaysia
Can be based in either Kelantan, Terengganu or Pahang
About The Company

Our client is the world's 5th largest branded manufacturer for their respective product under the personal hygiene care category. They are a global player in the FMCG industry having reached millions of homes in more than 100 countries.

Our client's carries products ranging from home care, hygiene and tissue paper.

About The Job

As the Area Sales Manager for the East Coast, you will be reporting to the Regional Sales Manager.

Job Responsibilities
Assist in setting up new distributor organisation including regional distributors at the assigned region which is Kelantan, Terengganu and Pahang.
Manage distributor teams to deliver listings and annual agreements with key retailers
Manage distributor operations sales team, sales opportunity and achievement, collection, category strategy implementation
Managing, training and providing overall guidance to sales team
Job Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Management or its equivalent
Minimum 5 years of experience in the FMCG Industry
To be based in the East Coast, either in Kelantan, Terengganu or Pahang
Proven leadership skills
To apply to this opportunity, simply click on "apply" to submit your application. Alternatively, you can submit your updated CV to aaron.pek@randstad.com.my

Skills: Communication, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Products, Presales, Presentation Skills, Presentations, Quotations, Sales, Sales Processes, Technical Presentations
Job desc:
About The Company

Randstad is partnering with a US based MNC company that specialize in air compressors. The company is growing their Malaysia entity and looking for a Senior Sales Engineer to be part of their Melaka office.

Duties And Responsibility
Negotiation on tender, contract terms and condition and preparation of Sales contract.
Visit and meet prospective customers in assigned industries to provide required services and solicit for orders.
Prepare a sales report, analyzing cost and sales, quotations and maintaining and creating new client accounts.
Provide pre-sales technical assistance, product training and after-sales support.
Prepare demonstration and technical presentations to customer.
Attending trade shows, conferences, marketing, and other events.
Work closely with supply chain management, sales support and project engineer and order fulfillment team.
Skill/experience
Must possess at least Degree/Diploma in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering.
At least 3 years sales experience selling industrial products.
Product knowledge of air compressors & control systems will be advantageous.
Strong team player who is self-motivated and customer oriented.
Work independently, process good communication and strong presentation skills.
How To Apply

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link. Alternatively, please send your resume to kavilnd.a@randstad.com.my (with subject title: Senior Sales Engineer - Compressor ) or call Kavil at 014-3205572 if you are interested in the job.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

Job desc:
About The Company

Our client is a FMCG food company, their exciting journey began more than 100 years ago with a normal father and son wanting to start a business together, fast forward to today the company they started has now turned into a successful international business.

They offer a full range of cutting-edge services and ingredients to customers in the bakery and patisserie industry worldwide.

About The Job

Reporting to: Sales Director

Working Location: Kepong

Job Description
You will need to sell and market the company's products and ingredients in the area as assigned and to ensure that collection is done within approved credit terms
You will also need to manage and grow the accounts assigned in accordance to the company's objectives
Aside from that, you will also need to achieve new customers by approaching new key accounts with distributors
Working closely with distributors to increase the company's penetration
Job Requirements
Minimum 3 years of experience in the FMCG Industry, preference for food products
Added advantage if the candidate comes with experience in managing distributors
Good communication, resilient and result-oriented
Must be able to work in Kepong

Robot arm programming, troubleshooting and solutions.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, Budgeting, Commercial Leasing, Leadership, Property Management, Shopping Centers, Strategy, Team Management, Tech-savvy, Tenant Relations
Job desc:
About The Company

Your future employer is a well-known Shopping Mall located within the golden triangle area of Kuala Lumpur, looking for a Retail Mall Manager, mainly in charge of leasing functions of the mall.

About The Job
Understand market demand, develop feasible plans for the mall and ensure that the growth and direction of the mall are always on track
Oversee all aspects of the mall management, for example, leasing, tenant relations, retail planning, financial management, profit and loss (P&L), mall marketing, etc.
Conceptualize and develop strategies that will maximize profitability of the mall
Lead the budget planning for the mall
Skills And Experience Required
Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Property Management or equivalent
10-15 years of experience in mall leasing
Ambitious and aggressive character with extensive technical knowledge in mall management
Strong communication skills and leadership qualities
culture and benefits

Your future employer is financially strong and growing rapidly in recent years with a strong portfolio of completed, ongoing and future projects secured. They have a good work environment, with a trusting and supportive management team. They reward their employees generously for good performance and emphasise personal growth for each employee.

how to apply

The above is just a guideline about the position. Please apply through this advertisement or log into www.randstad.com.my for further details. Due to the high volume of applicants, shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

You can reach me via email at yingrui.boey@randstad.com.my or https://www.linkedin.com/in/boey-ying-rui-045743184/. Kindly include your current, expected, project values, reason for leaving, notice period, d.o.b in your resume.
