Skills: Custom Objects, Database Triggers, Force.com, HTML, JavaScript, SOQL, SOSL, Visualforce, Web Services, Workflow Design
Job desc:
Job Summary :

The Salesforce Architect role will be responsible for development and support of initiatives across multiple Salesforce environments; ensuring that build is maintained in accordance to standards and best practices.

Job Requirements :
Strong experience in Salesforce/ Force.com application development as a certified administrator and developer
Proficient in Salesforce architecture, Apex, workflow design, controllers, triggers, SOQL, SOSL, Visual Force, Appexchange, Custom objects and Community Cloud
Should have experience in Web Services based development and use of Salesforce API
Should have knowledge of web technologies like Javascript, HTML/CSS and XML
Should be capable of building on custom code as well as debugging/troubleshooting issues with them
Should have experience of Marketing Cloud and its integration with Salesforce via data extensions
Experience in Salesforce Communities

Nice to Have Skills :
Salesforce Certified Force.com Developer
CPQ Implementation
FSL Implementation
Marketing Cloud Implementation
Salesforce Integration with Middleware like Mulesoft

Qualifications :
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or similar.
Salesforce Administrator (mandatory)
Platform Developer I (preferable)
Platform Developer II (desirable)

Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Travel : No

Job Posting : Jan 27 2023

Job desc:
Job Description:
Functional testing experience in Banking domain - Cards & Payments/ Trade Transformation area - 2-3 years
Hands-on testing experience
Understand & analyze project requirements
Experience in managing end to end delivery of testing, Proven experience in testing standards, tools, processes & methodologies, frameworks, and various delivery methodologies

Quantify, manage, track and report testing status, SLA and KPIs
Knowledge of script development using TOSCA
Knowledge Test Script execution using TOSCA

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, English, Python (Programming Language), Analytical Skills, DevOps, Groovy, Interpersonal Skills, System Development, Systems Approach, Technical Documentation
Job desc:
About The Role

As part of its Instant, Frictionless payments strategy, SWIFT is rapidly expanding its Data & Analytics capabilities to support our customers in this area of understanding payments.

In this context, the Data & Analytics tribe is looking for a DevOps Engineer with good knowledge in DevOps principles and methodologies, CI/CD automation, and a can-do attitude.

What to expect:
Design, develop, test, and implement CI/CD pipelines to support application delivery and release.
Develop and maintain technical documentation and prepare and give presentations to customers on systems.
Analyze the problems, develop, and propose solutions to more senior team members.
Provide technical assistance to other SWIFT colleagues and provide guidance to more junior team members in their daily work.
Assist with the analysis of requirements and the development of recommendations as to the systems approach to follow.
Prepare specifications, codes, tests, deliverables, acceptance criteria, time frames and prepare and study the technical feasibility and estimates of the proposed systems solutions.
Provide timing/scheduling estimates to project lead and propose corrective actions to timelines when necessary.

What make you successful?
University degree in computer science or related field. Or equivalent work experience.
2 to 5 years experience in systems development
Solid understanding of DevOps principles and practices.
Good hands-on knowledge on software release management and deployment (CI/CD) using Bitbucket, Jenkins, Nexus, Ansible and scripting (i.e., Python, Shell, Groovy).
Familiarity on change management processes and continuous delivery pipeline tools: Confluence, Jira, and ServiceNow.
Knowledge of systems and platform security.
Experience in working in an Agile driven team.
Knowledge in scripting (Python, Groovy, Shell) and Java is a plus.
Familiarity on virtualisation and containerization concepts and technologies is a plus (VMWARE/Vsphere, Docker,Openshift and/or Kubernetes).
Team player, ability to collaborate with teams operating in other time-zones (US, Europe, and APAC)
Analytical with very good troubleshooting skills in understanding very complex situations and dependencies.
Excellent written and verbal (English) communication skills.
Interested to stay up to date with the latest technologies and willing to invest time to understand how things work
Strong interpersonal skills and customer centric attitude.

You may like to know the team better by knowing the people in the team. Review LinkedIn profile of the people on the list below :

Elizalde ESTEBAN , Chapter Lead - Payment Operational Dashboard

Pavitra RK , Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist APAC (Recruitment Partner)

What we offer

We put you in control of career

We give you a competitive package

We help you perform at your best

We help you make a difference

We give you the freedom to be yourself

We give you the freedom to be yourself. We are creating an environment of unique individuals - like you - with different perspectives on the financial industry and the world. An environment in which everyone's voice counts and where you can reach your full potential regardless of age, background, culture, colour, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion , or veteran/military status.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Angular, Coding Experience, Content Management, Content Management Systems (CMS), Java, JavaScript, Spring Boot, Spring Framework, TypeScript
Job desc:
About The Role

Customer Interaction tribe is looking for a Senior. Java Developer with knowledge in DevOps principles and methodologies, CI/CD automation, and a can-do attitude.

What to expect:
Design, develop, test, install and support application systems in line with product requirements.
Create, deploy and maintain end-to-end CI/CD pipelines ensuring the development and release of software is as seamless as possible.
Apply automation, monitoring and visualization across the architecture.
Work hand-in-hand with developers and testers to ensure code deploys and operates to the highest quality standards.
Analyze problems, develop and propose solutions to more senior team members.
Prepare and study the technical feasibility and estimates of the proposed systems solutions.
Develop and maintain technical documentation, prepare and give presentations to other team members, management and customers.
Provide coaching and training to more junior team members of your squad.
Provide timing/scheduling estimates to team leader and propose corrective actions to timelines when necessary.
Demonstrate customer centricity by working closely together with the internal customer.
Organize efficient handover through high quality documentation and training.
Collaborate with other engineers to innovate and implement the components of the design system.

What will make you successful:
University degree in Computer Science, Electronics, Information Systems, Business Administration or related field, or equivalent work experience.
5-10 years of IT development experience (candidate with less experience can be considered as Developer)
3+ years of experience in AEM Content Management (CMS)
Knowledge of various AEM components
Experience of creating OSGI bundle, CQ Components, Workflow Knowledge Apache Sling
Solid programming/coding experience in Java EE 8 or newer, Spring Framework, Spring Boot, Angular 2+, TypeScript & JavaScript
Solid understanding of Web technologies including HTML, CSS, AJAX, Web Services, SOAP, REST, Apache Tomcat and Apache HTTP Server.
Practical experience of Linux OS (RedHat Enterprise Linux)
Knowledge in DevOps and experience in branching strategies, continuous integration, testing, deployment, and monitoring. In an Agile environment that require a high degree of scalability and reliability
Knowledge in configuration management and software deployment orchestration using Ansible
Team player, ability to collaborate with teams operating in other time-zones (Europe and APAC)
Excellent written and verbal (English) communications, strong interpersonal skills and customer centric attitude.
Analytical with very good troubleshooting skills in understanding very complex situations and dependencies.
Eager to learn and to stay up to date with the latest technologies

Other technical skills:
Change management and continuous delivery pipeline tools: Confluence, Jira, Git, Jenkins, Service Now, Ansible Tower and Nexus .
Virtualization and containerization concepts and technologies is a plus (VMWARE/vSphere, Docker, OpenShift and/or Kubernetes)
Experience with public cloud (e.g., AWS, Azure) is seen as a big plus.
Experience with monitoring tools (Logstash, filebeat, metricbeat, fluentd, Kibana) is seen as a big plus.

Noorazman Kamaruddin - Team Lead/Chapter Lead

Polly Ip - Recruiter, APAC

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, Problem Solving, Business Analysis, Business Process, Business Requirements, Gap Analysis, Multi-country, Presentation Skills, Presentations, Requirements Gathering
Job desc:
Mandatory Skills:
5+ business analyst experience in IT related projects in understanding the requirements and translate to technical team
Extensive knowledge in SDLC, Agile, Jira, Scrum process
Strong communication skills in both English and Japanese
Must be flexible in weekends and after office hours based on need
Bilingual language business analyst who had good communication in English and Japanese.
Associate needs to work from client location - Tokyo, Japan with Japanese business partners and also work with other stake holders located in Singapore, India in English language.
Fluent communication in Japanese (Oral and written) is mandatory

Nice to have:
Life science domain knowledge
Salesforce application knowledge

Responsibilities:
Excellent Business Analyst skills in understanding business requirements / process, Understanding systems
Understand end-end process of the system architecture and suggest business on improvements
Client management and co-ordinate on business requirement gathering
Work with partners User Story grooming, creating story with acceptance criteria in Jira and maintain the confluence
Manage the multi-country requirements, deployments / roll-outs and manage the process
Attend Scrum meetings and working experience on Agile projects
Perform Gap Analysis and coordinate with to stake holders
Understand business impact & Risk factors and highlight
Good understand of system integrations and data flow between systems.
Leading reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies
Effectively communicating insights and plans to all stake holders
Japan location is key for business partners and able to manage the requirement gathering / clarifications & translate to IT Teams
Work closely with Japanese business in local language and translate to offshore team/other teams in English
Good documentation and presentation skills in both English and Japanese to make requirements are clearly understood
Able to co-ordinate between business and technical team and ensures the delivery

Qualification:

Must have bachelor degree

Travel:

Associate must relocate to Tokyo, Japan and work from client location for long term

Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Travel : No

Job desc:
Sr. Consultant/Manager

Qualification: Responsibility:
Bachelor's Degree in relevant industry field (Required)
Masters in Business Administration, Finance or Engineering (Preferred).

Problem and Scope Definition:
Support formulation of problem statement and definition of scope.
- Drill down beyond the problems surface to understand root cause.
- Construct problem statement including problem description.
- Identify key stakeholders and construct stakeholder analysis ie how they are affected.
- Contribute to project planning and effort estimation within scope.
- Support the identification of risks and mitigation approaches.

Requirements Gathering:

:
Demonstrate exceptional requirementgathering skills, leveraging clear direction from engagement management.
- Support requirement gathering sessions.
- Organize and sequence requirements into a user requirements document.
- Write wellformed, validated requirements and manage changes.
- Use appropriate tools to record, track and manage requirements.

Business Analysis:

:
Review and analyze relevant documentation to ensure the understanding of an organizations function and capabilities.
Conduct relevant research to increase understanding in support of developing comprehensive solutions.
Logically structure recommendations and supporting data to formulate a solid, logical and understandable business case.

Engagement Delivery:
Utilize appropriate business modeling techniques to represent and graphically depict various activities, processes and data These could include:
- Business process modeling.
- Process flow modeling.
- Data flow modeling.
- Stakeholder analysis.

:
Demonstrate excellence in delivery of all solutions/recommendations, including supporting artifacts, on time and with high quality.
Deliver exceptional engagement support, including development and management of project plan(s) as needed.
Develop highquality deliverables that are "reviewready" the first time.
Proactively share ongoing point of view and perspectives.
Display strong listening and communication skills when interacting with client and team.

Thought Leadership:

:
Conduct market research and/or engagementspecific inputs for service offerings eg case studies etc.
Research industry trends and support innovative ideas for practice thought leaders.
Support in the development, research and design of consulting and domain mindshare such as: articles, whitepapers, collateral development, eBooks, info graphics, leadership forums, collabortory sessions, Yammer, etc Business Development:

:
Support Cognizant leadership in the development of RFI's, RFP's and Service offerings.

Customer Relationship Management:

:
Build and maintain strong relationships at different levels of the client organizations.

Practice Development:

:
Support practice building initiatives as planned by practice leadership.

Revenue Management:

:
Ensure utilization targets are achieved by seeking opportunities for one self, internal or external as required.

Knowledge Management:

:
Assist in creating client and/ or practice related materials (deliverables, solutions, industry best practices, standards and other knowledge artifacts) to Cognizant's knowledge management repository.

Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Travel : No

Skills: Business Process, Complex Analysis, Human Capital Management, PY, Payroll Administration, SAP HR, SAP Products, Statutory Accounting Principles (SAP), Technical Specs, Time Evaluation
Job desc:
Role Description: SAP HCM provides business processes/requirements, functional and technical specification support to ensure system efficiency and integration with the overall solution

Work Location: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

Key Responsibilities :
Gather and study business requirements related to HCM processes and provide solutions within SAP PA/OM, Time, Payroll, Benefits, ESS/MSS or other HCM component
design, develop and implement complex new software applications and maintains existing applications
Perform complex analysis and design for SAP HCM.
Liaise directly with business areas to diagnose problems with existing SAP HCM programs or initiate designs of new SAP applications independently, conferring with user groups to define business needs and potential solutions based on information technology
Ensure customer acceptance by soliciting involvement on design, functionality, and testing
Prepare data models, functional flow diagrams, and other documentation as required by departmental standards and methodology
Build and support new SAP HCM environments as required.

Tasks include :
Good Experience in support functions of SAP HR Payroll for ASIA / UK with good expertise in schemas & rules.
Good experience in Time Evaluation, schema & rules changes.
Design of Business blueprint and organizing blueprint workshops
Setting up payroll configuration for the ASIA / EUROPE (UK)).
Should be able to modify or update new schema rules.
Data Migration.
Experience in implementing SAP HR PY enhancements and testing.
Provide support and consultation advice for any payroll issues.

Qualifications :
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience, MIS Business major preferred
5-6 years of SAP work experience in Payroll & Time Modules.
Ability to adhere to schedules and project timelines and communicate issues/problems that may impact the ability to meet objectives
Ability to work with business users technical support personnel and communicate effectively with both
Must possess excellent communication skills and have the ability to effectively interpret needs and requirements on technical level the business process level

Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Travel : No

Job desc:
Featured

HR Manager

Job Description

Our client is a Oil & Gas market leader based in downtown KL and are looking to employ a HR Manager that will focus HR Advisory & Recruitment. This person will lead HR matters in Malaysia for approximately 150 employees and will report to a Regional HRD.

Job Responsibilities

First point of contact for all employees and managers within the region with regards to people related issues supporting and advising as issues arise, ensuring confidentiality and professionalism in handling sensitive issues is maintained at all times.
Build relationships with the management team and develop a good understanding of their work so as to be able to act within a HR partnering role.
Support with the recruitment process for new hires within the KL offices.
Work closely with the Management team to ensure all employees have suitable training and Personal Development Plans.
Ensure the appropriateness of the employee benefits and insurances across the teams providing support and input to any reviews as and when required.
Ensure compliance of group wide initiatives, probationary reviews, annual appraisals etc across the region
Co-ordinate and manage all performance management issues as well as coaching managers in the implementation and development of good performance management practices

Requirements

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
Experience working in cross cultural setting
MNC experience is a must

Job title: Music Content and Promotion Manager (1 year contract)
Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, English, Analytical Skills, Content Management, Google Sheets, Music Industry, Oral Communication, Record Labels, Research, Strategy
Job desc:
Develop and execute the strategy for promoting music and driving engagement across YouTube and YouTube Music, including in Shorts.
Develop and execute strategies for new product programming initiatives.
Build on understanding of Culture and Entertainment consumption trends to drive higher engagement and a deeper connection with the Artists and Fans
Oversee 'lifecycle of a song' programming across on-platform and playlist ecosystems and the broader user experience.
Conduct metrics-based analysis of programming campaigns.
Contribute to YouTube Music’s global programming & content strategy team and its efforts to drive improvements and innovative features on behalf of users worldwide, mainly for the Indian audience.
Support partner and technical teams to troubleshoot customer-facing issues.

Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's degree with any field (Manager is open to Diploma)
4+ years in a programming role in Radio / online digital music content business
Successful track record of delivering user engagement through building multi-platform experiences and communities.
Excellent written, presentation and verbal communication skills.
Ability to speak and write in native-level English (TOEIC score 900-990 or any relevant test) and local languages fluently and idiomatically.
Passionate about music, with a deep understanding of local entertainment industries
Working knowledge of content in Indo & global genres
Strong programming and creative skills - ability to craft messaging and work with design and production resources to drive creative execution.
Strong analytical skills: ability to analyze research or performance data and apply that analysis to optimize our programming strategy.
Digital native, with strong technical skills. Comfortable with content management tools.
Strong understanding of the competitive landscape and knowledge of short form and long form video content.
Comfortable working in a fast-changing environment
Ability to work across functions and divisions, with global teams, and deliver measurable results.

Preferred Requirements
Experience working for a music streaming service / music label.
Professional language proficiency in English & local languages
Expertise in working with Google Sheets
Ability to maintain several different projects simultaneously, while creating precise and effective customer-facing communications.
Deep knowledge and understanding of the music industry in Indonesia and previous experience working with record labels, artists and/or management partners.

You may apply direct to: jenyfa.hashim@adecco.com.
Please be informed that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Job desc:
Responsibilities
· Developing new features and user interfaces from wireframe models
· Ensuring the best performance and user experience of the application
· Fixing bugs and performance problems
· Write highly sustainable, clean, functional and efficient codes.
· Cooperating with back-end developers, designers, and the rest of the team to deliver well-architected and high-quality solutions.
Qualification & Requirements
· Extensive knowledge about mobile app development. This includes the whole process, from the first line of code to app marketplace deployment, both Google Play Store and Apple App Store.
· Proficiency in Flutter
· Familiarity with APIs integrations.
· Experience with profiling and debugging mobile applications.
· Strong knowledge of architectural patterns—BLoC state management and Clean Architecture—and the ability to choose the best solution for the app.
· Familiarity with Git versioning control.
· Understanding mobile app design guidelines on each platform and being aware of their differences.
· Experience in any native mobile app android (java/kotlin) or native IOS (Swift) is a plus.
· Minimum Diploma or Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or relevant field.
· Minimum of 2 years’ experience in related field.

Job desc(HTML):

  • Attending to all customer queries, concerns, and comments posted to the company's social media platforms.

  • Working with the marketing team to develop comprehensive social media strategies.

Job desc:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
Profes Lipid Sdn Bhd is a manufacturing company which located in Semtec Park, Semenyih. We are specialist in producing healthy oil and supplement. We are now looking for energetic young people to growth together with us. https://www.profeslipid.com.my/

Responsibilities
Assist Plant Supervisor to perform activities related to production and maintenance of equipment and machinery industrial plant.
Assist Plant Supervisor to run plant, monitor and manage the PLC system and maintenance.
Assist to carry out routine checks, troubleshooting on all breakdown issues.
Ensure that all machines operate at the highest efficiency and effective level.
Assist to do production filling.
Assist to monitor product quality at critical control points. Taking the sampling of in-process product and tank yard system for Laboratory Department testing.
To carry out the process of inter-tank transfer of end product or raw materials.
Assist in the loading and unloading of raw material, chemical and end product as and when required.
Maintain plant buildings.
Any other assignments as given by the Management.
Requirements
Proven experience as a plant/ filling operator.
Familiarity with production procedures.
Able to read blueprints, schematics and manuals.
Excellent teamwork and communication skills.
Strong physical stamina and strength.
Minimum SPM/O level or equivalent.
Interested candidates please submit your application through Jobstore.com

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, English, Change Management, Continuous Improvement, Data Collection, IT Asset Management, Interpersonal Communication, Process Improvement, Publishing, ServiceNow
Job desc:
About The Role

The main objective is to build out a new reliable IT Asset Management and Configuration management processes well embedded across the entire organization. As a part of the IT Asset Management team, you will define, sponsorship and constantly improve the new End-2-End state of art processes for HAM, SAM and CM practice, push them forward towards a state in which we could rely on them for the entire lifecycle for all SWIFT's assets and configuration data across all environments.

What to expect:
Drive the definition and implementation across entire company of the end-2-end processes covering full asset life cycle from planning till final disposal
Closely work with the ITAM team to detailed every step of each process, link them to the existing workflows by that helping to bring those processes towards the excellent level of maturity
Take end-to-end accountability for our Process, including ensuring all processes are reviewed, updated and published per the defined review period and process ownership is maintained
Sponsorship, design, and continual improvement of the process and its metrics
Administer key processes and procedures within our team, including generating and publishing required reports, and multiple reports and other statistics upon demand
Contribute to initiatives to improve ways of working to increase efficiencies within our team and to enhance end user satisfaction
Ensures consistent execution of the process across the organization
Define and implement the impact on the processes due to the migration from the old tooling landscape towards the new one (ServiceNow)

What will make you successful:
University degree in IT / Engineering or equivalent proved experience
5 -10 years of relevant experience in a comparable technical environment
Experience in Asset management (HAM, SAM, CM certification is plus)
Strong knowledge about the processes frameworks and definition
Knowledge with ServiceNow , Atlassian tools ( Confluence, JIRA , etc) and Office tools
Familiar with Agile methodology
Eagerness to learn on continuous basis
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, fluent in English (spoken and written)
Capability and interest in data collection, analysis and formalization of the results
Autonomous, driven, with strong ability to quickly adapt and respond to change
Open-minded, solutions oriented, and a true team player - gaining energy through collaboration with others
Strong believe in SWIFT values (one accountable team, customer oriented, open-minded and curious)

You may like to know the team better by knowing the people in the team. Review LinkedIn profile of the people on the list below :

Alexandra VALYSHKOVA , Head of ITAM team

Polly Ip , Talent Acquisition Specialist APAC

What we offer

We put you in control of career

We give you a competitive package

We help you perform at your best

We help you make a difference

We give you the freedom to be yourself

We give you the freedom to be yourself. We are creating an environment of unique individuals - like you - with different perspectives on the financial industry and the world. An environment in which everyone's voice counts and where you can reach your full potential regardless of age, background, culture, colour, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion , or veteran/military status.

Job title: IT Platform & Digital Adoption Functional Analyst
Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, Business Requirements, Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, Information Technology, Network Administration, Non-Functional Requirements, Presentations, Process Redesign, User Experience Design (UED)
Job desc:
About The Role

Are you interested in being part of a company at the heart of the global financial system that handles millions of payments, trade and treasury transactions every day, to efficiently support the corporate to bank business across the globe? To achieve our goals, SWIFT needs diverse, motivated and talented people to help drive our success. If you are interested in helping our key customers and partners to service their corporate clients around the globe, then this is a great opportunity for you!

Who we are:

Customer Interactions (CI) Tribe is a group of digital interaction aficionados passionate about attracting, activating, growing and supporting our customers through digital channels

Our Customer promise:

Our CI Tribe's mission is to empower our customers to easily adopt our products and services, by enabling them to have an effortless and meaningful experience in interacting with SWIFT.

What we offer:

We offer an enjoyable, open and collaborative work environment where colleagues can maximize their potential and evolve their career. You would be working as a functional analyst for the Swift.com application platform, that is implemented on Premises and in the Cloud. The applications based on our platform are enabling our Company to share information and collaborate with its community through multichannel digital experience.

What to expect:
Lead and plan the definition, analysis, validation and maintenance of functional and non-functional requirements
Validate proposed solutions to technical and/or business problems/requirements and reconcile business requirements with technical solutions.
Provide highly technical or relevant business knowledge during all phases of the development and resolve unique and complex business problems, recognizing technical constraints.
Produce and maintain conceptual models (data and functional) in accordance with the adopted methodology.
Conduct presentations on system enhancements and/or alternatives. Approve and conduct training sessions on system solutions.
Understand technological trends in own area of responsibility and apply this knowledge to bring solutions to the customers.
Lead and create the business process redesign and documentation as needed, for new technology.
Interface with application software development and other users as appropriate to explain solutions.
Acting like a centre of expertise for the digital adoption platform (sharing best practices, guiding business users through the platform, delivering demos etc).

What will make you successful:
University degree in Computer Science, electronic engineering or equivalent.
2 to 5 years experience , preferably in similar roles, in IT platform context.
Experience in UX design
Basic understanding of network and architecture.
Experience working with a digital adoption platform is a plus.
Knowledge on Jira, Confluence, HTML, CSS and JQuery is a plus.
Take accountability for delivering results and demonstrate operational excellence.
Translate creative ideas into plans or projects for the business, you demonstrate a commitment to learn and develop self and others.
Build and reinforce customer relationships.
Take lead of projects with a team focus in mind.
Communicate effectively in written and spoken English, across a wide range of practical or theoretical issues.

What we offer

We put you in control of career

We give you a competitive package

We help you perform at your best

We help you make a difference

We give you the freedom to be yourself

We give you the freedom to be yourself. We are creating an environment of unique individuals - like you - with different perspectives on the financial industry and the world. An environment in which everyone's voice counts and where you can reach your full potential regardless of age, background, culture, colour, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion , or veteran/military status.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Abstracting, Business Analysis, CRM Software, Facilitation, Presentations, Project Delivery, Project Plans, Resource Management, Software Deployment, Thinking Skills
Job desc:
An exciting CRM Project Manager job has become available at a multinational conglomerate.

About The CRM Project Manager Role

As the CRM Project Manager, you will be responsible for planning and overseeing projects related to CRM within the organisation, from the initial ideation through to completion. You will coordinate people and processes to deliver projects on time, within budget and with the desired outcomes aligned to objectives.

Key Responsibilities

Facilitate workshops and finalise requirements from business users
Compile, evaluate/present responses for the RFP
Define project objectives, project scope, roles and responsibilities
Define resource requirements and managing resource availability and allocation – both internal and third party
Outline a budget based on requirements and tracking costs to deliver project on budget
Prepare a detailed project plan to schedule key project milestones, workstreams and activities
Manage delivery of the project according to this plan
Track projects and provide regular reports on project status to project team and key stakeholders
Manage and adjust for any changes in project scope, schedule and/or budget
Identify and mitigate risks which may impact successful delivery of projects
Manage the relationship and communications with the client and all stakeholders, ensuring the project is delivered to their satisfaction
Act as a point of liaison between the project team and senior management
Use project management tools such as Microsoft Project to plan, monitor and regularly report to stakeholders on the progress of the project

To succeed in this role, you will need to have solid understanding of CRM software deployment.

Key Requirements

A bachelor’s degree in business or related field
A minimum of six years of experience in business analysis or a related field
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions
Advanced technical skills
Excellent documentation skills
Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations
Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook
A track record of following through on commitments
Excellent planning, organisational, and time management skills
Strong analysis, problem resolution, judgement, and decision-making skills
Demonstrated communications, interpersonal, and organisational skills
Fluency in written and spoken English; additional Asian business languages is a plus due to the nature of the role
Ability to effectively achieve results in highly ambiguous and changing environments

This company is leading the market within the conglomerate space. With a strong regional presence, this company is its class leader with key focus on development of their people. The culture is fast paced and demanding given the booming industry, but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude the potential rewards are significant.

If you portray relevant technical skill sets, are able to work with various internal and external stakeholders and ready to challenge yourself to solve complex issues, this role is right for you.

Apply today or email me at yeeni.chen@robertwalters.com.my to discuss this new opportunity.

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Skills: Communication, Problem Solving, Analytical Skills, Computer Literacy, Project Delivery, Project Implementation, Project Management, System Implementations, Team Management, User Acceptance Testing
Job desc:
An exciting Senior Project Manager (Insurance Industry) job has just become available at a renowned insurance provider company.

About The Senior Project Manager (Insurance Industry) Role

This position is responsible for translating business needs into solutions and project execution. You will be giving your input in managing the strategic IT roadmap and help drive process improvement between each functional areas.

Key Responsibilities

Drive, manage, and optimise the delivery of business initiatives & projects including onboarding new partners, execution of tactical initiatives, major rate changes, product revamps, and system implementation and changes
Play an active role in all phases of the project lifecycle: feasibility, planning, analysis and design, development, testing and UAT (if required), and training
Manage the strategic IT roadmap
Help drive and execute on projects and ensures business stakeholders are informed of progress and dependencies. Develop collaborative relationships with distribution and functional partners to support strategies and initiatives
Support improvement to procedures/workflow between business units, functional areas and distribution partners to reduce redundancy, establish consistency, and generate executional speed
Ensure full compliance with regulatory, PIAM, local and global guidelines

To succeed in this role, you will need to have experience in managing projects such as system implementations or integrations.

Key Requirements

At least seven years of work experience as a Project Manager in the insurance/financial industry
Bachelor’s degree in appropriate fields or study or equivalent work experience
Strong hands-on experience in managing teams and project delivery
Good understanding of the financial and/or insurance industry and knowledgeable in insurance systems and operational processes
Strong work relationships with business stakeholders within a cross-functional matrix environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills and networking
Computer literate especially MS office and PowerPoint

This insurance company needs no introduction and is recognised as the leader in their field of expertise. The culture is demanding but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude the potential rewards are significant. This company is also very focused on developing and training their people to the highest standards.

If you are driven, determined and want to take the next step in your career, this is the role for you. Great career progression opportunities await the right person in this exciting Senior Project Manager (Insurance Industry) position.

Apply today or email me at yeeni.chen@robertwalters.com.my to discuss this new opportunity.

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, English, Cancellations, Command, Fashion Retail, Identifying Issues, Key Performance Indicators, Merchandising, Presentation Skills, Presentations
Job desc:
An attractive Merchandising Manager (Fashion) job has just become available at Southeast Asia's largest fashion retailer based in Malaysia.

About The Merchandising Manager (Fashion) Role

Reporting to the General Manager, this is a role for aspiring individuals passionate about merchandising/category management functions in a fashion retail industry.

Key Responsibilities

Review weekly trading performance and achieved KPIs, identifying issues and the course of action in preparation for the weekly trading meetings
Manage weekly branch visits
Propose and agree on actions to recover risk and maximise opportunities with the buyer at category and line level
Meet and gain approval, incorporate forecasting of any sales variance to plan, create OTB, manage commitments – on-time delivery, rebuy cancellations, markdown proposals, promotions
Manage the range plan in season reflecting any changes
Manage intake at brand, category, and line level
Create and manage/monitor sell out dates against all products
Review previous season and capture the lessons learned and create the strategy for the department going forward

To succeed in this position, you must be numerically and analytically sound.

Key Requirements

Minimum of four years of work experience in a buying/merchandising function in the retail industry, preferably in fashion retail
Good communication and presentation skills, with strong command of English
Good analytical, organisational and project management skills, and has a positive work attitude

This international fashion retail company is no stranger to consumers and is constantly expanding. The culture is open and ambitious but also not limited to developing and training their people to the highest standards.

  • Manage weekly branch visits

Job desc:
A Project Manager (Fintech) job has become available at a solutions provider company for the financial services industry.

About The Project Manager (Fintech) Role

You will be working on retail banking related project and is responsible for overall management of resources, including the technical, time, cost aspects of a project, and the motivation of all those involved.

Key Responsibilities

Ensure the project is delivered with required quality acceptable to the customer and within budget constraints and agreed timeframe
Be an effective communicator with the customer, team members, Biz Head, product specialists and the sales team. In short, the project manager is to be a focal point for communications, effectively
Manage multiple projects simultaneously through meticulous monitoring, controlling and documenting the projects’ progress, seeing each project through to completion
Anticipate, identify and manage any problems e.g. costs, timeframe, technical, staff morale
Provide input to the management on team members’ performance. These inputs are based on set objectives at the beginning of the project for all team members
Keep to payment schedules as well as initiating billings and collections; the provision of project costing reports to the Finance department. You will also liaise with Sales/Account Management teams on commercial issues liaise with Customer Support group for formal handing over of customer care after successful implementation

To succeed in this role, you will need to have experience in IT project management and familiar with software implementations.

Key Requirements

Business and commercial awareness
Must have prior Project Manager experience and owning/managing a project man-day budget of at least 1,000 man-days
Ability to provide pre-sales support is desired
Proficient in harnessing the varied talents of the team and utilise their skills effectively
Experience with payments and/or financial industry is an advantage
Professional certifications in project management is desired

With clear business objectives in place, this company is growing progressively in its competitive market. The business succeeds on the speed of its innovation and there are great opportunities to progress in this dynamic company.

If you have a heart for emerging technologies within the financial services industry, this Project Manager (Fintech) role is right for you.

Agensi Pekerjaan Robert Walters Sdn Bhd


Business Registration Number : 729828-T


Licence Number : JTKSM 423C

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, English, Apparel, Financial Goals, Open to Buy Management, Presentation Skills, Product Demonstration, Product Requirements, Reverse Logistics, Turnover
Job desc:
An attractive Buyer (Apparel) job has just become available at a fashion retailer based in Malaysia.

About The Buyer (Apparel) Role

The Buyer (Apparel) is responsible for implementing and executing as per the strategic buying plans for the assigned brand/category and also ensures smooth buying operations through vendor identification, evaluation and selection, in compliance with the contract principles to achieve the strategic and financial objectives of the brand/category of products.

Key Responsibilities

Analyses historical data and current trends to identify current and future risks and opportunities
Helps the business unit meet the profit targets by ensuring timely procurement of the department/category merchandise
Assists in creating clear, comprehensive brand/category plans to ensure profitability by maintaining and building consumer focused brand/category lines
Places orders with the selected vendor(s) based on the buying plans and ensures merchandise is delivered as per the plan based on the agreed service level agreement
Recaps and analyses actual sales results to plan and forecast in-season sales/inventories on weekly, monthly and quarterly basis to drive sales, bottom-line profitability and inventory targets to meet or exceed financial goals
Prepares periodic reports on sales turnover and customer trends per product to arrive at decision to maintain, liquidate or dispose-off the stock, and/or continue or discontinue the product line
Communicates, collates and follows-up on various product requirements and findings obtained from the sales/store data
Identifies buying opportunities to source products and to ensure that Business maintains its competitive edge by constant renegotiation
Maintains vendor contacts; ensures product demonstrations, procures product samples and literature in order to help the senior buyer take appropriate decisions
Executes as per the financial and credit services agreement with the vendor that maximises profit and positively contributes to cash flow
Tracks the merchandise transportation from supplier to warehouse/distribution centre and ensure smooth flow of goods
Executes reverse logistics guidelines to send the faulty/damaged goods back to the vendor
Assists in generating periodic reports on consumer behaviour, consumer trends per product, etc., to facilitate decisions to maintain, liquidate or dispose-off products or continue/discontinue with the brand/category lines

To succeed in this position, you will need to be mathematically sound and have adequate years of experience in buying.

Key Requirements

Minimum of one to three years of relevant experience as a product buyer with a large retail organisation
Good communication and presentation skills, with a strong command of English
Good analytical, organisational and project management skills, and has a positive work attitude

This is a fashion retail chain. They have a strong background and the company aims to grow rapidly, hence the culture is open and ambitious. They develop and training their people to the highest standards.

If you are driven, determined and want to take the next step in your career, this is the role for you. Great career progression opportunities await the right person in this exciting Buyer (Apparel) job.

Apply today or email me: beatrice.chin@robertwalters.com.my to discuss this new opportunity.

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Licence Number : JTKSM 423C

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, Command, Gas Industry, Legal Assistance, Legal Document Preparation, Legal Issues, Oil & Gas, Oil & Gas Industry, Presentation Skills, Presentations
Job desc:
A well-established oil and gas corporation is currently seeking a capable Manager/Assistant Manager, Legal to join their legal team based in their Kuala Lumpur office.

About The Manager/Assistant Manager, Legal Role

Reporting to the Head of Legal & Secretarial, you will be responsible for providing effective and efficient legal services by utilising internal and external legal resources to promote and safeguard the company’s interest as well as to ensure continuous growth and success of the team.

Key Responsibilities

Rendering various legal advice to various business units pertaining to the management of legal and commercial risks associated with, amongst others, associated with procurement, revenue generating & non-revenue generating contracts, corporate services, corporate governance, compliance, general advisory, dispute management, legal projects, new ventures, management of local and regional issues
Developing, controlling, analysing and/or reviewing legal framework and strategies that are aligned to the company’s business activities and safeguarding its interests as well as reviewing and providing legal advice on matters relating to contractual procurement and subcontract documents (e.g., tenders and bids, charter, sales and purchase agreements, sponsorship and bonds and agreements) for management and business units
Drafting, reviewing and/or attending to documentations in relation to the core legal services to ensure that any legal and binding contract(s) and other documentations to be entered by the group will have minimum and acceptable level(s) of legal risks as well as leading negotiations to protect the company’s interests at all times
Leading assigned legal work and driving execution on action plans as approved as well as collaborating with external appointed legal firms/panel lawyers that provide legal documentation, verification, registration, advisory and litigation services to ensure requirements are met
Managing/assisting assigned superiors in all assigned legal work and follow up on action plans as approved by superior

To succeed in this role, you must have the ability to work independently and effectively as well as possess a keen understanding of the oil and gas industry preferably.

Key Requirements

A degree in law with at least 8 - 12 years of experience as a legal practitioner in a law firm or in-house counsel. Experience in the oil and gas industry is advantageous but not mandatory
Excellent communication and presentation skills with strong persuasive and convincing capabilities and strong command in English Language (both written and verbal)
Capable of leading negotiation and driving legal strategies to achieve business objectives, staying abreast of current legal issues and consulting experts to expand knowledge base
Team player, well-organised, self-driven with keen eye for accuracy and detail-oriented

This organisation is much more than pure oil and gas alone and is anything but traditional. The successful legal counsel will join an organisation whose expertise and experience has made them a leader in its niche market.

If you are a progressive leader with a can-do attitude, this Manager/Assistant Manager, Legal role is an excellent opportunity to work with a strong industry player that is looking to break new ground.

Apply now or email me today at eujinn.teo@robertwalters.com.my to discuss this new opportunity.

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Job desc:
An exciting Trade Marketing Manager (FMCG) job has just become available at one of the most respected global FMCG firms based in Malaysia. Reporting directly to the Senior Manager, this is a role for a trade marketer who is a leader in their field.

About The Trade Marketing Manager (FMCG) Role

In this business critical role, you will be responsible for formulating a comprehensive commercial calender detailing distribution, display, promotion and activation priorities, delivering the highest quality service alongside other trade marketing managers. You will also take the lead in providing direction to all trade related activities, including working across sales, marketing, supply chain, finance, commercial excellence and external agencies.

Key Responsibilities

Translate marketing objectives into channel strategies to maximise corporate sales, profitability and growth
Implement and monitor promotions and activities for overall trade marketing activities
Drive promotional effectiveness across all channels – recommend the right type of POSM and quantify for generic display, launches or campaigns to engage with shoppers
Improve trade visibility across all channels
Ensure proper accountability and control of trade investment budgets and ensure proper return on investment spend

To succeed in this Trade Marketing Manager (FMCG) role, you will need to have the ability to work effectively and co-operatively with senior business development teams, across borders and internal matrix.

Key Requirements

Degree in marketing or business studies, or its equivalent
At least five years of experience in trade marketing of FMCG products
Team player, strong leadership and communication skills
Knowledge of key accounts is an advantage
Critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills and strong judgement and decision making

This global FMCG firm needs no introduction and is recognised as the leader in their field of expertise. The culture is demanding but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude, the potential rewards are significant.

This firm is also very focused on developing and training their people to the highest standards. If you are driven, determined and want to take the next step in your career, this is the role for you. Great career progression opportunities await the right person in this exciting Trade Marketing Manager (FMCG) job.

Job desc:
A world-leading chemical company is seeking a Category Manager (Procurement). In this job, you will drive improvements to the overall category performance in procurement.

About The Category Manager (Procurement) Role

In this position, you will drive improvements for category performance by establishing category strategic partners and liaise frequently with key stakeholders to ensure all business requirements are being met for transition and transformational projects.

Key Responsibilities

Develop appropriate category strategy which enables efficient and effective operational execution
Gather and analyse market intelligence data, analyse the implications and inform decisions on category strategy to stakeholders
Support optimisation of requirements that promotes transformational, agile and innovative approach to supply market
Develop insights on category spend profiles to eliminate non-value add spend within the category which will drive subsequent sourcing initiatives
Analyse supply market insights to create robust future sourcing solutions
Promote thought leadership regarding the impact of innovation and technology towards the category strategy

To succeed in this Category Manager (Procurement) role, you will need to have solid category management experience in corporate services (HR) or professional services.

Key Requirements

Tertiary qualifications in supply chain management or related field of study
10 - 15 years of procurement experience, specialising in corporate services (HR) or professional services in the recent three years
Familiar with the usage of procurement tools (e.g. Ariba Source to Pay, Salesforce and Compass)
Innovative, proactive, resilient, results-oriented and possess an improvement mindset
Analytical approach and able to work in a collaborative cross-functional manner
Strong interpersonal skills and able to drive initiatives/improvement projects
Application is open to Malaysians and/or candidates with existing right to employment in Malaysia

This international firm needs no introduction and is recognised as the leader in their field of expertise. With great corporate environment and culture, they have gain industry recognition. The culture is demanding but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude the potential rewards are significant.

If you are a procurement professional who is seeking a challenging role to take your career to the next level, this Category Manager (Procurement) role is the right opportunity for you. You will be part of a progressive team that is poised to break new grounds in the industry.

Job desc:
An exciting Digital Marketing Manager (Hospitality/Tourism) job has just become available at a reputable hospitality group in Malaysia. Reporting directly to the AVP, this is a role for a marketer who is a leader in their field.

About The Digital Marketing Manager (Hospitality/Tourism) Role

In this business critical role, you will be responsible for leading the development and execution of digital marketing strategy on all digital platforms to ensure an engaging, consistent and seamless messaging are delivered to achieve the company's business objectives.

Key Responsibilities

Lead the planning and execution of digital marketing strategy including but not limited to web, SEO, SEM, social media, database marketing, email, and online display ads, based on the overall integrated marketing plan
Build and enhance social media presence across all digital channels, which requires overseeing content and captions for social media
Plan and allocate digital marketing budget and optimise the spending to gain measurable ROIs
Keep track and report all digital marketing campaigns performance against the assigned goals (ROI and KPIs), evaluating customer research, market conditions and competitor data
Keep abreast of new technologies/trends to keep the company at the forefront of developments in digital marketing

To succeed in the Digital Marketing Manager (Hospitality/Tourism) job, you must have a solid background in digital marketing, proven track record in people management, and carry strong passion for the hospitality/tourism industry.

Key Requirements

At least a bachelor's degree, postgraduate diploma, or professional degree in creative multimedia, advertising/media, mass communications, marketing or equivalent
At least six years of work experience (preferably with primary digital marketing-focused)
At least three years of prior experience in a people management position
Excellent command of English with creative content writing skills
Analytical, data-driven person with strong problem-solving skills
Strong leadership qualities, self-starter, highly organised, excellent interpersonal skills, and capability to interact with management and peers
Willing to work beyond official work hours when required

This group needs no introduction and is recognised for its presence locally in Malaysia.

The working culture can be demanding at times, but if you are someone resilient, up for challenge, and with high enthusiasm for the hospitality/tourism industry, this Digital Marketing Manager (Hospitality/Tourism) role is right for you.

Job Roles and Responsibilities
To perform scoping and plant surveys to understand the customer requirement and provide the solution to save thermal energy
To propose engineering solutions to the customers and in the process, sell steam products such as steam Traps, condensate recovery systems, hot water generators, control valves, steam flow meters, etc.

To make proposals and follow company instructions and nomenclature
To visit customers every week – 10 to 12 customers in a week
Offer generation – 4 offers in a week

Auto CAD basic Knowledge
Market knowledge
You will have an advantage if you possess:
Competence to do Steam trap / Plant survey.
Know of Basic Steam Engineering
Have an existing customer base in the food and beverage industries (at least 30 customers

Job title: Record to Report Specialist / RTR Accountant - MNC / SSC
Skills: Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA), Balance Sheet Review, Balance Sheets, Fixed Assets, General Ledgers, Intercompany Accounts, P&L Management, Record to Report, Reporting Requirements, Trend Analysis
Job desc:
Featured

Record to Report Specialist / RTR Accountant - MNC / SSC

Job Description

About our Client

Company with excellent global support and training
Regional exposure to work with multiple country
Accessible via public transport

Our Client is a Multinational Company and a top leader in its respective industry. Being a public listed MNC with over billions of revenues, they invest massive resources into their staff training programme to develop their people from the ground. They are currently looking for multiple roles of Accounts Executive / Accountant - Record to Report Specialist - GL & Reporting Analyst

Job Responsibilities

In charge of end to end Record to Report accounting Scope
Responsible to meet the monthly, quarterly and annual reporting requirements of company
Ensure verification of inventories subledger - existence, classification and valuation method.
Maintain accounting records including data entry of complete and accurate data for day to day business transactions.
Prepare accounting documents and monthly schedules.
Responsible for completeness, accuracy and timeliness of operations in the general ledger, fixed asset and intercompany accounts, as well as treasury transactions and bank reconciliations.
Reconcile and analyze various trial balance accounts including, but not limited to, cash accounts, prepaid expenses, other assets, intercompany accounts and miscellaneous accruals.
Prepare other balance sheet reconciliation to ensure robustness of accounts, and investigate and clear differences on a timely basis.
Prepare and consolidate (when necessary) month-end & year end financial reports
Prepare P&L accounts, perform analytical review and trend analysis

Main Requirements

Minimum 2 years of relevant working experience in accounting / Record to Report Scope
Degree in Finance & Accounting/Commerce or equivalent with professional qualifications such as ICAEW/ACCA/CPA/MIA will be advantageous
Able to work well with the team in a fast paced MNC environment
Prior experience in SSC / International MNC environment will be advantageous

How To Apply

Submit your resume and APPLY NOW by clicking the button below.

For similar roles, please visit

Job desc:
Client specialist in industrial products and solutions such ascompressors, pump, motors, inverters, UPS, etc.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Obtain market intelligence to support project sales activity in order increase hit rate. Discover and develop new markets and new products to support Group sales growth.
Monitor competitors’ movement and provide marketing information and intelligence.
Execute business strategies & formulate action plans to create potential sales pipelines.
Attends sales enquiries, tenders and/or technical clarification.
Scrutinizes and prepares tender submission including deviations, if necessary.
Performs market analysis, proposes competitive price structure and respectively for commercial conditions.
Attend business discussion with owners, M& E consultants and contractors.
Monitors project’s progress, individual customer’s payment behaviors, assists credit controller in dealing with bad paymaster.


REQUIREMENT:
Minimum 1 - 5 years in either of the following
Project Sales & Services or:-
Project Management
exposure to industrial segment especially O&G and large production plants

Degree in Engineering / Business Admin/Economics / Marketing

Skills: Communication, Contract Management, Contract Negotiation, Coordination Skills, Procurement, Purchase Management, Supplier Evaluation, Supplier Negotiation, Vendor Management, Vendor Relations
Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Lead the department in sourcing required parts /materials/services/products.
Make strategic plan to establish reliable suppliers; activities include selection of suppliers, evaluation, negotiation of terms and conditions to safeguard the Company interests.
Monitor and ensure the optimum and efficient stock levels for operations at the same time minimize stock holding costs.
Continuously review and improve monitoring and reporting capability within the category framework to ensure cost reduction, supply improvement and quality opportunities are maximised.
Ensure on-going improvement of communication flow and processes with suppliers to monitor current activities and performance and to keep up with suppliers’ future plans.
Build effective vendor relationships in the delivery of contracts and long-term procurement agreements.
Actively engage in the assessment of product and suppliers to fulfil users’ needs and in conjunction with the governance frameworks


Job Requirements

Degree holder with a minimum 5 years of procurement experience in a similar capacity
Driven with positive mentality, strong initiative, resourceful and meticulous
Possess strong communication, interpersonal and coordination skills
Experience in newly setup is an advantage
Job desc(HTML):
Job Responsibilities


  • Lead the department in sourcing required parts /materials/services/products.
  • Make strategic plan to establish reliable suppliers; activities include selection of suppliers, evaluation, negotiation of terms and conditions to safeguard the Company interests.
  • Monitor and ensure the optimum and efficient stock levels for operations at the same time minimize stock holding costs.
  • Continuously review and improve monitoring and reporting capability within the category framework to ensure cost reduction, supply improvement and quality opportunities are maximised.
  • Ensure on-going improvement of communication flow and processes with suppliers to monitor current activities and performance and to keep up with suppliers’ future plans.
  • Build effective vendor relationships in the delivery of contracts and long-term procurement agreements.
  • Actively engage in the assessment of product and suppliers to fulfil users’ needs and in conjunction with the governance frameworks


Job Requirements


  • Degree holder with a minimum 5 years of procurement experience in a similar capacity
  • Driven with positive mentality, strong initiative, resourceful and meticulous
  • Possess strong communication, interpersonal and coordination skills
  • Experience in newly setup is an advantage

Skills: Automation, CMMS, Distributed Control System (DCS), E&I, Electrical Equipment, Engineering Design, Instrumentation, MV, Programmable Logic Controller (PLC), Scopes
Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

In charge of planning and executing E&I maintenance, medication as well as new installation activities, supporting E&I Department Head.
To coordinate and implement plant improvements and expansion projects.
To monitor operation of plant E & I equipment and systems to ensure smooth operation and minimize downtime.
To manage safety program for the E & I department.
To ensure compliance to all local, federal and any other relevant regulations relating to the E & I department.
To train and develop E&I team members to ensure competency based on designated department job scopes.


Job Requirements

Possesses Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in Electrical / Electronic / Instrumentation / Automation / Control System Engineering or equivalent.
Possesses at least 5 years of experience in Electrical & Instrumentation (E&I) role in manufacturing industry, with relevant leadership experience.
Experience in food industry and related standards (i.e FSSC 22000, HACCP, GMP etc.) would be added advantage.
Knowledgeable on Suruhanjaya Tenaga requirements.
Strong technical skills in MV/LV Electrical Equipment, PLC & Instrumentation.
Familiar with CMMS system.


Interested candidates are welcomed to apply online or send your latest resume to waikin.lee@jac-recruitment.com

Skills: Bank Reconciliation, Business Process Re-engineering, Certified Public Accounting (CPA), Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Fixed Asset Management, Infor Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Microsoft Dynamics, Microsoft Dynamics AX, Process Improvement, System Configuration
Job desc:
Company Overview
A well-established International Consulting MNC that is a strong player in its industry and has presence globally. They are looking to bring on board an excellent Assistant Manager ERP Advisory Consultant to support their team in Petaling Jaya.

Job Description
Involve in business process improvement and ERP enablement initiatives.
Conduct requirement gathering, As-Is business processes analysis, business needs analysis and identify key business challenges in relation to Finance/Accounting area.
Identify improvement opportunities to achieve clients’ desired business outcomes.
Define To-Be state for Finance/Accounting related processes, procedures, organizations, capabilities, solution application requirement and performance measurements.
Perform system implementation activities in relation to Finance/Accounting area, which may include design blueprint documentation, system configuration, test scenario & script development, UAT support, user training, etc., for MS Dynamics 365 F&O.
Act as a liaison between the client and the technical team and facilitate any kinds of interactions e.g. workshops, testing sessions, trainings, issue resolution, etc.
Other activities as directed by Management or as required by operational needs.

Requirements to Succeed
A recognised Degree qualification
For Assistant Manager: Min. 5 years of relevant experience
At least 4 years of experience in performing Microsoft Dynamics AX/365 configuration/implementation
MS Dynamics 365 certifications (i.e. MS Certified: Dynamics 365 Finance Functional Consultant Associate)
Strong understanding of Finance/Accounting related processes, e.g. month-end closing, account reconciliation and consolidation, fixed asset management, bank reconciliation, etc.
Ability to design and drive changes for Finance/Accounting related process re-engineering and organisational change
Accounting certifications (e.g. ACCA, CPA, etc.) will be advantageous
Good understanding of ERP functionalities of one or more of the following areas will be advantageous:
a) Sales and CRM
b) Supply Chain Management

To Apply
If you are interested in this role, click 'apply now' to submit your resume (in MS Word format). Due to overwhelming responses, we will only be able to contact shortlisted candidates.

Skills: Campaigns, Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG), Market Planning, Marketing, Marketing Mix Modeling, Marketing Support, Retail Marketing, Sales, Tactical Plans, VM
Job desc:
Retail Marketing Executive fills a vital support role within the Retail Marketing team, crafting,
developing, and executing revenue-boosting joint marketing programs. In this role, retail
marketers will work closely with Sales teams, merchandise team, VMD team, and external retail
partners to deliver retail publicity programs and effective marketing activity on message, on time,
and on budget.

Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment with many priorities and possess the interpersonal
skills to effectively interact across functions with minimum supervision to be hands-on in
developing and executing both strategic and tactical plans.

Responsibilities
Develop and execute marketing plans that support the business objectives for multiple retail locations, from start to finish on strategy, on time, and on budget. Maintain and update thematic campaign planner, product marketing planner.
Drive traffic and sales through effective local store marketing initiatives, including but not limited to print, digital, direct mail, social media, in-store events, and grassroots marketing
Works with other Retail functions (Sales, MD, VM) to ensure key stores have special retail marketing support
Product marketing – plan and execute new product launches, value proposition development for ‘focus funds’ – developing compelling communications and delivering these through the marketing mix (events, emails, client communications, collateral, digital, PR )
Manage budgets for each retail location, ensuring cost-effective use of marketing resources.
Coordinate the production of all marketing materials, from conception to delivery; Collaborate with creative teams to provide the best content to suit our retailer’s needs, including images, video, and ad copy. Ensure that deadlines are met.
Liaise with Commercial Brand Marketing to ensure Visual Refreshment activities carried annually, brand contents direction for digital marketing to schedule on social media within brand assets guidelines.
Work closely with shopping malls for all mall related activities such as mall's social media, events collaboration, loyalty program, in-mall media booking and advertising space opportunities.
Monitor competitor activity, market trends, and analyze market research data and adjust marketing plans accordingly to maintain a competitive edge to determine consumer needs.
Develop strong relationships with key stakeholders, including store managers, regional managers, corporate marketing, and advertising agencies, and other third parties’ corporate collaboration.
Work with store management and staff to ensure all marketing activities are carried out flawlessly and in a timely manner
Visits retail locations and speaks with the manager about service concerns, sales programs, newspaper shrink, incentive programs and all placement opportunities
Evaluate campaigns with written analysis in a timely manner. Analyze data and make recommendations based on results.
Maintain a library of grassroots marketing collateral i.e. flyers, discount cards, and tear pads updated bi-annually.
Train and manage a team of marketing coordinators responsible for executing marketing plans at the store level.
Tackle tasks as assigned by the management, requested by marketing teams, requested by sales teams, and retailers.

Qualifications
Candidate must possess at least Diploma/Bachelor's Degree/Professional Degree in Marketing, or equivalent
At least 3 years related working experience in Retail/FMCG industry
Mature with positive work attitude

Skills: English, Microsoft Excel, Business Administration, Forecasting, Inventory Management, Purchase Orders, Quality Assurance, SAP Products, Supply Chain Management, Tenders
Job desc:
Job Scope
Responsible for effective operations of Supply Chain Management in order to achieve the agreed business plan with appropriate level of inventory, as well as meeting required customer service level.
Major Responsibilities
Forecast Accuracy:
Collect/review sales forecast from Sales teams (5 teams by area) by channel and prepare for Pre S&OP meeting, showing if current sales forecast is reflecting to TGT & LF.
Organize Pre S&OP meeting monthly with each team to monitor Forecast Accuracy by team
Provide monthly Forecast Accuracy Performance report by country and by team to Sales team and Regional team
Organize S&OP meeting monthly to update Forecast Accuracy Performance, Demand/Supply status, Inventory level and New launch status to team
Update and maintain Sales forecast, Order forecast, Actual sales, Total inventory on hand and selling price in APO (P38)
Inventory Management:
Propose order plan to 3rd party distributor to ensure supply availability and inventory according to sales forecast from Pre-S&OP meeting
Update Short Expired products/ Slow moving product list monthly to the team to avoid unnecessary write-off
Monthly TC with sites on order status and delivery confirmation to make sure LO is updated and delivered
Make sure transaction in SAP is correct and complete every month
Update PFR/Critical Supply topics report/Zero stock item report monthly
Support Tender business by making sure the shipment schedule is shared. Also, review if stock is available for Tender participation
Understand Finance process and support with Supply Chain data
Manage product life cycle including new product introduction, changes, transfers, pruning and divestment
3rd Party Distributor Management:
Share sales forecast by SKU for Purchase Order according to production lead time and the agreement with 3rd party distributor and place PO in SAP
Manage 3rd party distributor’s inventory as agreed inventory level
Make sure that sales and inventory report from 3rd party distributor is accurate by cross-checking with Finance monthly
Coordinate for shipping documents to 3rd party distributor for Custom clearing
Coordinate for Import License, and registration status for in-coming shipments to country between manufacturing sites and 3rd party distributor to ensure smooth importation
Act as the contact point between manufacturing site and 3rd party distributor for product release to market, in case of temperature excursion on shipments
Act as the contact point for damaged goods from transportation and make sure goods are claimed according to the agreement
New Launches:
Manage on Pre-Launch Check list to Manufacturing sites with information from DRA, marketing team and BPA
Create and maintain Material Master into local SAP for placing purchase order
Coordinate for product artwork creation with final approval by DRA, make sure that artwork design is according to Sandoz guideline and ready according to timeline
Others:
Act as the contact point between Sales & Marketing, DRA, BPA and SCM for all supply matters
Act as the contact point for Regulatory Affair between DRA (distributor) and RCC/RCC LCM for document submission
Manage document to be signed by Country Head, Thailand as Myanmar’s product owner is Novartis (Thailand) Limited
Artwork creation for new submissions/variation, also updating leaflet according to RCC LCM for whole portfolio
Support Vietnam business for SAP transactional activities (PO, Good Received, and Invoice)
Support Malaysia business for SCM documentation/paperworks, and SAP transactional activities (PO, Good Received, and Invoice)
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field
Languages:
English
Experience and skills:
2-4 years experience in Supply Chain Management
Can work independently
Moderate to high ability in Excel
Moderate ability in SAP
Excellent organizational & planning skills in a complex environment.
Ability to communicate throughout different hierarchies.
Good understanding of the (generic) pharmaceutical industry in preferred.
Awareness of Regulatory processes, and Quality Assurance.
