Location: Bandar Baru Enstek, Negri Sembilan, Malaysia
Skills: Interpersonal Skills, Mathematics, Negotiation, Presentations, Purchase Orders, Record Keeping, Road Maps, Sales, Sales Finance, Sales Targets
Job desc:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
FAIZA MARKETING SDN BHD was founded by Mdm Hajah Faiza Bawumi Sayed Ahmad in 1968 with a humble beginning. Since then, our venture has grown immensely. By 2001, FAIZA MARKETING SDN BHD has become a household name in spices manufacturing business with over 20 types of products under three main categories, Powdered Spices Mix, Dry Condiments and Rock Salt. Our steady market growth over the years has prompted us to expand. We advocate innovative, aggressive and collective team management top to bottom under the leadership of Mdm Najwa Abu Bakar. Our tagline “Hygiene and Quality” clear indicates the prime importance of our products to acquire the best quality of selected ingredients for the purpose to preserve and maintain the traditional recipes and the originality of Malaysian taste. Our products are free from preservative, additional colours and artificial flavours. FAIZA MARKETING SDN BHD is operating the art machinery with well trained staff to do the processing and packaging of the products. In March 2010, FAIZA MARKETING SDN BHD was awarded QMS ISO9001:2008 by KGS Certificate. We always emphasise our customer’s satisfaction and are No. 1 in the spices business.

VAN SALESMAN LOCATION REQUIRED
NEGERI SEMBILAN & SEPANG AREA (1 VAN SALESMAN NEEDED)
SHAH ALAM, SUBANG, DENGKIL, BANTING & KLIA AREA (1 VAN SALESMAN NEEDED)
KEDAH & PERAK (1 VAN SALESMAN NEEDED)
RESPONSIBILITIES:-
Driving van to different locations to sell products
Promoting existing and new products to customers
Undertaking the delivery of purchase orders
Preparing, updating, and maintaining sales report
Collecting payments and maintaining an accurate record of the same
Delivering all the products in a safe and timely manner
Meeting monthly and yearly sales targets
Maintaining the vehicles (van/lorry) in proper working order
Cleaning the vehicles (van/lorry) interior and exterior on a regular basis
Scheduling timely servicing appointment for the van, send vehicles for repair and for PUSPAKOM
REQUIREMENTS:-
Minimum SPM
Proven work experience as a Van Salesman or a similar role in the Sales industry
Holding a valid driver’s license and a clean driving record
Familiarity with GPS tools and road maps
Having an excellent sales record
Good communication and interpersonal skills
Basic mathematical and recordkeeping skills
Willingness to travel to different locations and work at flexible hours
Detail-oriented and highly motivated individual
Impressive presentation and negotiation skills
Ability to offer excellent customer service
Interested candidates please submit your application through Jobstore.com

Job desc:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
We, PMC Ultra Mega Management Sdn. Bhd and its Group of Company are an established Engineering Management and Technical Service company with PETRONAS License in Malaysia for the Oil & Gas (Onshore/Offshore) project. Certified with MS ISO 9001:2015, MS ISO 14001:2015 and OHSAS 18001:2007, we have served for more than a decade and are experienced in human resource consultancy and services mostly in Oil & Gas and Petrochemical industry.

Our mission is to provide human resource consultancy services at the highest professional standards to our client.

If you are highly motivated, suitably qualified and ready to take challenges, we have a carrier awaiting you.

Job Summary

To take an engineering role and be responsible for specific engineering tasks in terms of man-hour cost, quality, schedule, productivity and technical excellence.

Qualification
Degree in the Mechanical Engineering and have about 2 to 6 years min. of experience in Oil and Gas design engineering.
Registered to Board of Engineers Malaysia (BEM)
Management skill and experience is required.
Having working knowledge of codes and practices applicable to the design, and familiar with software used for related analysis and design activities.
Capable to perform all Eng. tasks with minimum guidance.
Responsibilities
To be accountable to and assist the Senior Mechanical Engineers and Manager, Mechanical Engineering.
To provide input to PDMS database and ensure consistency with equipment design and piping design.
To review and check the deliverables from PDMS section, other Mechanical Engineers and other disciplines.
To review access and handling requirement for equipment, valves, and instrument items.
To report to clients on specialist topics as and when required.
To prepare and/or provide input to the technical aspects of main Mechanical Engineering activities including:-
Equipment specifications and data sheets pressure vessels, pumps, turbo machinery, material handling aids etc.
Piping Engineering.
Pipe Stress analysis.
HVAC design.
Material and corrosion engineering.
Mechanical reports.
Calculations.
Design and drawing reviews.
Technical bid evaluations.
Vendor data review.
Mechanical/Piping design documentation.
Material handling
To interact with equipment and material vendors to stay informed on the most recent trends and technology in the oil & gas industry.
To maintain a detailed knowledge of all applicable codes and standards including client's requirements in relation to the field of expertise.
To maintain the company QA procedures.
To prepare design documentation including calculation manuals and design reports.
To provide input to feasibility and conceptual studies in the area of expertise.

We, PMC Ultra Mega Management Sdn. accordance with client's requirements.

Job desc:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
We, PMC Ultra Mega Management Sdn. Bhd and its Group of Company are an established Engineering Management and Technical Service company with PETRONAS License in Malaysia for the Oil & Gas (Onshore/Offshore) project. Certified with MS ISO 9001:2015, MS ISO 14001:2015 and OHSAS 18001:2007, we have served for more than a decade and are experienced in human resource consultancy and services mostly in Oil & Gas and Petrochemical industry.

Our mission is to provide human resource consultancy services at the highest professional standards to our client.

If you are highly motivated, suitably qualified and ready to take challenges, we have a carrier awaiting you.

Job Summary

To take an engineering role and be responsible for the timely and effective compleion of all specific instrumentation engineering activities assigned and to ensure that the quality of the work meets the required standards.

Qualification
Degree in the Electrical/Instrumentation Engineering and have about 0 to 6 years of experience in Oil and Gas design engineering.
Registered to Board of Engineers Malaysia (BEM)
Having working knowledge of codes and practices applicable to the design, and familiar with software used for related analysis and design activities.
Capable to perform all Eng. tasks with minimum guidance.
Responsibilities
To undertake assigned work in the most efficient and professional manner, and is accountable to the Manager, Instrument Engineering, Lead/Senior Instrument Engineers on the project.
To assume responsibility for the assigned work and report progress of assigned activities to the Design Lead/Senior Instrument Engineers.
To prepare Instrumentation specification for all instruments, controls and systems equipment for approval of the Lead/Senior Instrument Engineer on the assigned project.
To size all instrumentation, controls, equipment and in-line instrument components for approval of the Lead/Senior Instrument Engineers on the assigned projects.
To coordinate drafting activities with the drafting coordinator and lead designers.
To assist the Lead/Senior Engineer to liaise with the clients for athe assigned work activities and keep the team fully informed.
To keep abreast with the company's latest quality assurance procedures and ensure that they are being followed.
To maintain filing systems of all documentation pertinent to the work allocated to him/her on a project.
To write instrument requisitions from data supplied by the process department for the Lead/Senior Instrument Engineers.
To analyse vendor quotations, make recommendations on bid tabulations and write pruchase order requisitions for the selected instruments for the approval of the Lead/Senior Instrument Engineer.
Responsibilities (contd)
To prepare instrument index, database plus other instrumentation list for the approval of the Lead/Senior Instrument Engineer.
To assist in vesses I.D. checks, number instrument on P & IDs and keep the Lead/Senior Instrument Engineer current with respect to instrumentation.
To assist in the preparation of instrument layouts, installation details, control room and panel layouts, graphic's, logic diagrams, wiring diagrams, hook-up diagrams, mounting details, cable schedules, loop diagrams, block diagrams, schematic and material take off.
To assist in the preparation of the P & IDs and Utility flow diagrams and cause and effect matrix.
To check, approve and combine comments on vendor drawings for the approval of the Lead/Senior Instrument Engineer.
To assurance compliance with the project specifications, standards, control estimates, man-hour estimates and project schedules.
To prepare changes notices for the approval of the Lead/Senior Instrument Engineer when the design deviates from the control estimate and design requirements.
To witness performance test by bendor and inspect instrumentation as required.
To provide necessary assistance during construction and commissioning in the field.
Interested candidates please submit your application through Jobstore.com

Job Summary

To assist in the preparation and implementation of all Safety,

Health and Environmental policies and design procedures; and

to ensure standards compliance across Safety Engineering

Team and for the provision of project safety engineering under

the supervision of lead/senior safety engineer.

Qualification/Skills
Degree in any Engineering Discipline with at least 2 to 6 years relevant experience in Fire Protection and Detection and Safety engineering, HAZOP and ESD design.
Experienced in operational fire and safety, including a strong element of Loss Prevention engineering, comprising safety engineering reviews, system design and HAZOP, Safety Studies.
Min of 2 years’ experience in a HSE role within onshore and offshore oil and gas projects.
Must be registered with BEM.
Be a team player with excellent leadership and strong coordination skills.
Organizational skills and time management.
Effective computer skills.
Responsibilities
Responsible for input into and implementation of all Safety, Health and Environmental policies and procedures design activities.
Providing input into the Design Basis Manual.
Responsible for provision of project Safety Engineering.
Participate in workshops, i.e. HAZOP and HAZID.
Preparation of hazardous area classification schedule & reports, input/checking to hazardous area classification drawings.
Involvement with Early Risk Assessment studies.
Promoting and ensuring feedback of project experience together with input from new technology to ensure continuous improvement.
Prepare firewater hydraulic calculation, design basis and report.
Prepare firewater P&ID, UFD, process datasheet and line list.
Preparation of HSE/Safety Philosophy; EERA.

We, PMC Ultra Mega Management Sdn. Bhd and its Group of Company are an established Engineering Management and Technical Service company with PETRONAS License in Malaysia for the Oil & Gas (Onshore/Offshore) project. Certified with MS ISO 9001:2015, MS ISO 14001:2015 and OHSAS 18001:2007, we have served for more than a decade and are experienced in human resource consultancy and services mostly in Oil & Gas and Petrochemical industry.

Our mission is to provide human resource consultancy services at the highest professional standards to our client.

If you are highly motivated, suitably qualified and ready to take challenges, we have a carrier awaiting you.

Job Summary

To assist in the preparation and implementation of all Safety,

Health and Environmental policies and design procedures; and

to ensure standards compliance across Safety Engineering

Team and for the provision of project safety engineering under

the supervision of lead/senior safety engineer.

Qualification/Skills
Degree in any Engineering Discipline with at least 2 to 6 years relevant experience in Fire Protection and Detection and Safety engineering, HAZOP and ESD design.
Experienced in operational fire and safety, including a strong element of Loss Prevention engineering, comprising safety engineering reviews, system design and HAZOP, Safety Studies.
Min of 2 years’ experience in a HSE role within onshore and offshore oil and gas projects.
Must be registered with BEM.
Be a team player with excellent leadership and strong coordination skills.
Organizational skills and time management.
Effective computer skills.
Responsibilities
Responsible for input into and implementation of all Safety, Health and Environmental policies and procedures design activities.
Providing input into the Design Basis Manual.
Responsible for provision of project Safety Engineering.
Participate in workshops, i.e. HAZOP and HAZID.
Preparation of hazardous area classification schedule & reports, input/checking to hazardous area classification drawings.
Involvement with Early Risk Assessment studies.
Promoting and ensuring feedback of project experience together with input from new technology to ensure continuous improvement.
Prepare firewater hydraulic calculation, design basis and report.
Prepare firewater P&ID, UFD, process datasheet and line list.
Preparation of HSE/Safety Philosophy; EERA.
Interested candidates please submit your application through Jobstore.com

Job desc:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
We, PMC Ultra Mega Management Sdn. Bhd and its Group of Company are an established Engineering Management and Technical Service company with PETRONAS License in Malaysia for the Oil & Gas (Onshore/Offshore) project. Certified with MS ISO 9001:2015, MS ISO 14001:2015 and OHSAS 18001:2007, we have served for more than a decade and are experienced in human resource consultancy and services mostly in Oil & Gas and Petrochemical industry.

Our mission is to provide human resource consultancy services at the highest professional standards to our client.

If you are highly motivated, suitably qualified and ready to take challenges, we have a carrier awaiting you.

Job Summary

To ensure that assigned project is fully executed within the specific time and requirement by the clients.

Qualification
Degree in the Civil/Structural Engineering and have about 2 to 6 years of experience in Oil & Gas design engineering.
Registered to Board of Engineers Malaysia (BEM)
Computer software knowledge in Structural simulation and calculation is essensial.
Responsibilities
To perform all activities, including detailed design calculations associated with the assigned project. Undertake the work in an efficient manner and be accountable to the Project Lead Engineer/Manager.
To coordinate with the project designers for all the drafting activities associated with the project.
To keep abreast with the client requirements/practices and ensure that all work performed conform to these requirements.
To interact with other disciplines to ensure a smooth and successful functioning of the project.
To keep up to date and ensure adherence with the company's quality procedures and practices.
To generate complete project design documentation covering all aspects of the structural/civil design.
To be accountable to and assist the Senior Structural Engineers and Manager, Structural Engineer.
To interact with equipment and material vendors to stay informed on the most recent trends and technology in the supply industry.
To maintain a detailed knowledge of all applicable codes and standards including client's requirements in relation to the field of expertise.
To provide input to feasibility and conceptual studies in the area of expertise.
Interested candidates please submit your application through Jobstore.com

Job desc:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
We, PMC Ultra Mega Management Sdn. Bhd and its Group of Company are an established Engineering Management and Technical Service company with PETRONAS License in Malaysia for the Oil & Gas (Onshore/Offshore) project. Certified with MS ISO 9001:2015, MS ISO 14001:2015 and OHSAS 18001:2007, we have served for more than a decade and are experienced in human resource consultancy and services mostly in Oil & Gas and Petrochemical industry.

Our mission is to provide human resource consultancy services at the highest professional standards to our client.

If you are highly motivated, suitably qualified and ready to take challenges, we have a carrier awaiting you.

Job Summary

To ensure that assigned project is fully executed within the specific time and requirement by the clients.

Qualification
Degreee in chemical engineering or equivalent and preferably with the 8 years of experience in Oil and Gas design engineering (concept, FEED and Detailed Design) for onshore and offshore oil and gas processing projects.
Registedred to Board of Engineers Malaysia (BEM)
Familiarisation with computer software for Process simulation and calculation is essensial.
Able to perform all engineering tasks with close supervision and simple engineering tasks independently.
Have excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical staff.
Responsibilities
To execute process engineering design.
To perform all design activities as directed by the Senior/Lead Process Engineers.
To become familiar with the Process Engineering calculation methods and software used int the department.
To attend all designated training courses.
To work in accordance within the requiremtns of the contract Quality Plan and familiar with corporate Quality Management Initiatives.
To interface with other disciplines under the guidance of Senior/Lead Engineers in order to gain an understanding of the significance of Process Engineering activities and overall project execution.
To be accountable to and assist the Senior/Lead Process Engineers and Manager, Process Engineering.
To maintain a detailed knowledge of all applicable codes and standard including client's requirements in relation to the field of expertise.
To be informed on the recent trends and technology in the oil and gas industry.
To assist the Senior/Lead Process Engineer to liaise with the client or the assigned work activities and keep the team informed.
Interested candidates please submit your application through Jobstore.com

Skills: Communication, Interpersonal Skills, Negotiation, Presentations, Purchase Orders, Record Keeping, Road Maps, Sales, Sales Finance, Sales Targets
Job desc:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
FAIZA MARKETING SDN BHD was founded by Mdm Hajah Faiza Bawumi Sayed Ahmad in 1968 with a humble beginning. Since then, our venture has grown immensely. By 2001, FAIZA MARKETING SDN BHD has become a household name in spices manufacturing business with over 20 types of products under three main categories, Powdered Spices Mix, Dry Condiments and Rock Salt. Our steady market growth over the years has prompted us to expand. We advocate innovative, aggressive and collective team management top to bottom under the leadership of Mdm Najwa Abu Bakar. Our tagline “Hygiene and Quality” clear indicates the prime importance of our products to acquire the best quality of selected ingredients for the purpose to preserve and maintain the traditional recipes and the originality of Malaysian taste. Our products are free from preservative, additional colours and artificial flavours. FAIZA MARKETING SDN BHD is operating the art machinery with well trained staff to do the processing and packaging of the products. In March 2010, FAIZA MARKETING SDN BHD was awarded QMS ISO9001:2008 by KGS Certificate. We always emphasise our customer’s satisfaction and are No. 1 in the spices business.

VAN SALESMAN LOCATION REQUIRED
NEGERI SEMBILAN & SEPANG AREA (1 VAN SALESMAN NEEDED)
SHAH ALAM, SUBANG, DENGKIL, BANTING & KLIA AREA (1 VAN SALESMAN NEEDED)
KEDAH & PERAK (1 VAN SALESMAN NEEDED)
RESPONSIBILITIES:-
Driving van to different locations to sell products
Promoting existing and new products to customers
Undertaking the delivery of purchase orders
Preparing, updating, and maintaining sales report
Collecting payments and maintaining an accurate record of the same
Delivering all the products in a safe and timely manner
Meeting monthly and yearly sales targets
Maintaining the vehicles (van/lorry) in proper working order
Cleaning the vehicles (van/lorry) interior and exterior on a regular basis
Scheduling timely servicing appointment for the van, send vehicles for repair and for PUSPAKOM
REQUIREMENTS:-
Minimum SPM
Proven work experience as a Van Salesman or a similar role in the Sales industry
Holding a valid driver’s license and a clean driving record
Familiarity with GPS tools and road maps
Having an excellent sales record
Good communication and interpersonal skills
Basic mathematical and recordkeeping skills
Willingness to travel to different locations and work at flexible hours
Detail-oriented and highly motivated individual
Impressive presentation and negotiation skills
Ability to offer excellent customer service
Interested candidates please submit your application through Jobstore.com

Skills: Communication, English, Administrative Assistance, Attention to Detail, Command, Customer Service, Data Entry, Databases, Online Data Entry, Spreadsheets
Job desc:
Job Details

Position: Data Entry Clerk

Company Industry: Professional Association

Working Hours: Monday – Friday (0900 to 1730)

Working Location: Puchong Business Park, Off Jalan Puchong, 47160 Puchong, Selangor

Working Duration: 1 month contract with PERSOLKELLY (Temporary)

Salary: RM1500 with statutory contribution

Responsibilities

Transfer data from paper formats into computer files or database systems using keyboards, data recorders or optical scanners
Type in data provided directly from customers
Create spreadsheets with large numbers of figures without mistakes
Verify data by comparing it to source documents
Update existing data
Retrieve data from the database or electronic files as requested
Perform regular backups to ensure data preservation
Sort and organize paperwork after entering data to ensure it is not lost

Requirements And Skills

Proven experience as data entry clerk
Excellent knowledge of word processing tools and spreadsheets (MS Office Word, Excel etc.)
Working knowledge of office equipment and computer hardware and peripheral devices
Basic understanding of databases
Good command of English and BM both oral and written and customer service skills
Great attention to detail
High school degree or equivalent

Serious applicants can send your updated resume to Nursabrina_Zaidi@persolkelly.com

Subject: Job application for Data Entry Clerk
Please also provide your expected salary and notice period

Due to high number of applicants, only qualified candidates will be contacted for interview.

We thank you for your application 😊.

Job desc:
Working duration: 12 months contract with PERSOLKELLY

Location: 165 Jalan Ampang, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

Working days: Monday - Friday

Working hours: 9am – 6pm

Salary: RM 2100

Main Responsibilities

Performs secretarial and clerical duties for one or more people
Answers, places, and screens telephone calls.
Schedules appointments, makes travel arrangements.
Distributes mail, receives visitors, maintains files, prepares correspondence and reports.
May take dictation or transcription.
Has knowledge of one or more word processing programs and basic on the job PC experience producing general memos and letters.
Can perform general functions such as start-up, deleting, saving, and printing.
Handling billing administrative processes

Experience / Qualifications

Degree fresh graduate
Experience and knowledge in Microsoft Words, Excel, and managing emails
Knowledge in Accounting

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Business Requirements, Cash Management, Cash Reconciliation, Collateral, Dispute Management, Dispute Resolution, Microsoft Office, Sanction, Teamwork, Working with Brokers
Job desc:
Working duration: 9 months contract with PERSOLKELLY

Location: 165 Jalan Ampang, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

Shift Hours: (7am – 4pm / 9am – 6pm / 2pm – 11pm)

Job Description

Responsible for the cash and FX processing, sanction queue monitoring and disposition, daily cash reconciliation, investigate cash related issues.
Responsible for efficient and proper utilization of cash & collateral throughout the firm, and its subsidiaries, on both a domestic and international basis
Working with the funding and credit relations groups, will analyze cash flow, use of cash capital and collateral, transfer of funds (intra-company and with outside parties), bank account usage, bank compensation, and flow-through of funds
Establish controls for all cash & collateral movements and cash usage and coordinate activities with auditing functions
Play a significant role in developing and coordinating data processing systems as they relate to the cash management group and the entire treasury function along with the collateral operations group
Monitor portfolios and associated exposure to ensure collateral is requested from internal and external counterparties in a timely manner
Exposure monitoring & margin calling
Monitoring deliverable positions
Supporting the clearance of trades including reallocations & transfers
Supporting the daily reconciliation of trades, positions, margins, and cash versus the exchanges and carry brokers
Supporting daily margining and settlements with exchanges, carry broker and the firm’s clients
Participating in documentation of business requirements and testing of new processes and systems
Portfolio maintenance
Portfolio reconciliation & dispute management

Qualification

Knowledge of custody and settlements operations
Knowledge of SWIFT instructions added advantage
Knowledge of cash SWIFT instructions.
Proficient in basic Microsoft Office
Degree holder

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Commercial Banking, Communication Training, Credit Risk Management, Executive Management, Group Policy, Lending, Loans, Oral Communication, Presentations, SME
Job desc:
Featured

Head of Post Approval Review

Job Description

Main Responsibility:

Oversee the day-to-day management of the post-approval credit review for Business Banking, Consumer and Emerging Business (SME) portfolio
Conduct post-approval credit review for Business Banking portfolio including raising credit observations to Business Units for formal responses.
Track for closure on those credit observations which required actions to be taken by Business Units
Establish and review the post-approval credit review process and framework and sampling guidelines to ensure compliance with local regulatory requirements as well as group policies

Requirements

Minimum of 12 years of working knowledge and experience in Business Banking, Consumer and/ or SME lending business portfolio.
Strong knowledge in the end-to-end credit risk process from credit risk assessment and credit approval to credit risk monitoring activities
Matured, analytical, objective and with proven leadership track record
Strong written and verbal communication skills as job requires frequent interactions with Senior Management and presentation at Board Risk Management Committee

To apply, please click "APPLY NOW" or email Reeve at reeve.ng@ambition.com.my quoting reference number #262855. Data provided is for recruitment purposes only.

Due to the volume of applications received, we regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

JTK Number: JTKSM 995 | Company Registration Number: 201301019088 (1048918-T)

Skills: Accounts Payable, Celonis, Commerce, Coupa, Critical Thinking, Finance, Japanese, PTP, Statutory Accounting Principles (SAP), Transactional
Job desc:
An exciting PTP Team Lead (Japanese Speaker) job has just become available at one of the pharmaceuticals SSC based in Petaling Jaya. Reporting to the Head of PTP, you will be a part of the dynamic team.

About The PTP Team Lead (Japanese Speaker) Role

In this position, you will be responsible for monitoring day-to-day operations of accounts payable activities to ensure all vendor transactions are processed timely and accurately.

Key Responsibilities

Ensure timely and smooth AP close and maintain clean sub-ledger through proper follow up on action plans on ageing items
Drive KPI metrics and review with the team. Maintain service delivery quality, identify improvement opportunities and drive actions
Build and sustain effective relationships with stakeholders (procurement, local users, local finance) to deliver performance and implement best practices
Take the lead in issue resolution and escalation on accounts payable operational matters
Set clear team objectives, manage the development and performance of the team to achieve efficient processing and effective team working by taking appropriate follow-up action according to the defined process and own judgement
Develop knowledge and capability in team members to raise competence to expected levels to meet current and future business needs
Drive continuous improvement and standardisation/simplification across the global accounts payable processes

To succeed in this PTP Team Lead (Japanese Speaker) role, you will need to have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

Key Requirements

Degree in finance, accounting, commerce or equivalent
At least six to seven years of experience in finance and accounting, including a minimum of two years of experience managing transactional accounting teams
Proficient in Japanese language (reading, writing and speaking)
Excellent communication skills in English
Strong understanding of the accounts payable process and core accounting concepts

Job desc:
An attractive Head of Call Centre job has become available at a reliable financial organisation based in Kuala Lumpur.

About The Head Of Call Centre Role

You will strategise, implement, monitor selling and retention strategies for the call centre and ensure it is aligned to the overall business strategy.

Key Responsibilities

Planning, organising, leading and being accountable for the team performance to achieve the targets set and the approved key performance indicators with high level of customer experience through effective and optimal utilisation of resources approved
Analysing performance, set both monthly and weekly sales target and plan activities to boost sales
Planning annual budget required to meet target set
Formulating Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and formulating tracking mechanism or provision of adequate support for the team
Identifying and recruiting the right talent and being accountable for the development of the team to improve the level of competency and achieve performance targets set
Developing succession plan and training needs for the team
Identifying, implementing improvement initiatives to improve call centre operations to meet business goals
Developing, implementing structured compliance guidelines and being responsible to ensure team exercise strict compliance to meet the organisation business strategies
Reporting to the management on department performance and ability to take adequate actions
Managing and ensuring resolutions of complaints are handled professionally with action implementation to avoid recurrence of the same

To succeed in this role, you must be able to communicate clearly and comprehensively on the sales channels' expectations to the team for execution.

Key Requirements

Develop, execute customer delivery strategy and operational planning
Create team spirit for positive environment to foster group performance
Define and identify training needs of team - input/develop training plans
Be responsible for retention of staff within the team, and to ensure that targets set are met
Prepare and conduct report analysis in a timely manner

This financial organisation provides a wide range of wealth management, debt management, personal financing, financial advisory, business financing, investments consultation, insurance and real estate services to over 12,000 customers. It is much more than financial services and is anything but traditional. They have the people and ethos to act with speed, innovation, enterprise, and creativity. The scope of the offer, the size of the business, the freedom and autonomy to drive your career forward all adds up to a great place to work.

If you are a talented and focused professional seeking the right opportunity to take your career forward, this Head of Call Centre role is right for you.

Job desc:
An attractive Head, Credit Card Acquisition job has become available at a prestigious financial institution in Kuala Lumpur.

About The Head, Credit Card Acquisition Role

Reporting to the HOD, you will be responsible for running and managing acquisition programmes and channels to acquire new credit cards.

Key Responsibilities

Drive and develop card acquisition programmes while balancing cost per acquisition (CPA) by looking at better cost efficiencies and channel productivity, and growing alternative new channels to enable channel diversification
Manage key stakeholders such as Operations, Fraud, Credit Initiation/Policy, Partnerships, CDD, Compliance, Legal, Sales (DSMS, TPS, Digital, V&V, Branches)
Review existing credit policy and find opportunities to increase approval rates (i.e. test programmes, waiver of checks) and optimising turnaround time
Curate acquisition campaigns for both offline and online with the objective to acquire new customers
Manage onboarding projects (RTOB) – review requirements, testing, process flow development and automation process to result in straight-through-processing (STP) which results in cost savings
Develop organisational resilience and competitive advantage through people initiatives
Drive management direction for business growth objectives

To succeed in this Head, Credit Card Acquisition role, you must have experience planning and coordinating all activities related to the design, development, enhancement, adoption, maintenance, and implementation of credit cards.

Key Requirements

Academic qualifications i.e. degree in any discipline (preferably banking and finance)
Relevant experience: minimum of 10 years in banking (preferably in credit or product management for retail banking)
Analytical and able to articulate issues along with solutions/insights
Adaptable to change and able to evolve with business trends
Personal traits: agile, curious, enthusiastic and goal-driven

This financial institution is much more than financial services and is anything but traditional. They have the people and ethos to act with speed, innovation, enterprise, and creativity. The scope of the offer, the size of the business, the freedom and autonomy to drive your career forward all adds up to a great place to work.

If you are a progressive individual, this Head, Credit Card Acquisition role is an excellent opportunity to work with the organisation.

Job desc:
An attractive Digital Product Specialist job has become available at a prestigious financial institution in Kuala Lumpur.

About The Digital Product Specialist Role

This role requires you to establish the product vision, roadmap as well as growth opportunities.

Key Responsibilities

Providing alignment and direction to the development team and stakeholders throughout the project
Gathering and defining product functionalities and translate such requirements into the product requirement document
Assessing value, developing use-cases and prioritising user stories, epics and themes to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value that are aligned with product strategy
Working closely with the business development team to create and maintain product offerings according to business value or ROI
Being involved in the product release plans, backlog management, iteration planning and setting expectations for delivery of new functionalities
Providing an active role during sprint planning and product testing
Running beta and pilot programmes with early-stage products and samples
Researching and analysing competitive landscape, user behaviour and the product roadmap
Recommending product enhancements and updates to identify new business opportunities
Keeping abreast with the best practices and new trends

To succeed in this Digital Product Specialist role, you must ensure successful product delivery and alignment with overall product strategy by closely engaging with other teams/key stakeholders including, but not limited to management, UI/UX, content and copy, operations and support, technical development, data analytics, business development and marketing, data governance, and risk.

Key Requirements

Creative thinker with a vision and attention to detail
At least five years' work experience as a product owner
Bachelor’s degree in any field with strong interest in digital products and services, study of anthropology or start-up
Demonstrated success defining, launching and growing excellent digital offerings
Analytical and problem-solving capability. Operational experience is an advantage
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Customer-oriented with a strong understanding of the evolving digital landscape, technologies and paradigms
Self-starter, fast leaner and highly adaptable to new environment
Competent with various development process and principles
Outstanding communication, presentation and stakeholder management skills
Excellent organisational and time management capabilities

This financial institution is much more than financial services and is anything but traditional. They have the people and ethos to act with speed, innovation, enterprise, and creativity. The scope of the offer, the size of the business, the freedom and autonomy to drive your career forward all add up to a great place to work.

If you are a progressive individual with a can-do attitude, this Digital Product Specialist role is an excellent opportunity for you.

Job desc:
A leading independent consulting firm is seeking a highly skilled Manager, Brand and Communications Support in Kuala Lumpur to lead work in the area of brand and communications support for the Greater Asia Life practice.

About The Manager, Brand And Communications Support Role

This is a great opportunity for the Manager, Brand and Communications Support to communicate and work with consultants and stakeholders across different roles and countries in Asia Pacific.

Key Responsibilities

Designing and preparing proposals and presentations
Understanding messaging from consultants and converting this into a presentable format and design output with clarity and a clean look and feel within brand guidelines
Taking responsibility for maintaining and updating and being responsible for various decks/presentations of credentials that are used to support client pitches and proposals
Challenging stakeholders if content provided is too much, redundant or violates provided brand guidelines
Taking pride in the look and feel and consistency of materials
Supporting other activities relating to business development support for the practice

To be successful as the Manager, Brand and Communications Support, you should have experience and knowledge of preparing reports and presentations, working within constraints of house style/brand guidelines imposed by global standards and corporate templates.

Key Requirements

A commitment to meet deliverables, often working within tight timelines
Strong communication skills in English (written and verbal)
Expert at using Microsoft Word and PowerPoint to prepare finished, client-ready proposals, reports, newsletters and other presentation documents. Proposals/presentations will usually include text, graphs, tables and charts that may need to be created/redesigned and organised using templates and/or brand guidelines
Quick learner with the ability to work calmly under pressure
Five or more years of experience and knowledge of working within constraints of house style imposed by global standards and working with corporate templates

This leading consulting firm has an outstanding international reputation in its field and great value is placed on business and profitability. With offices in principal cities worldwide, covering markets in North America, Latin America, Europe, Asia Pacific and the Middle East, this is a great brand to join at an exciting time in their development.

If you have a successful track record of doing similar work with professional services firms (accounting, law, banking, strategy firms, etc.), you can take your career forward with this exciting Manager, Brand & Communications Support role.

Job desc:
An exciting Pricing & MDM Supervisor (Hybrid) job has just become available at one of the new SSC based in Petaling Jaya. Reporting to the Head of OTC, you will be a part of the dynamic team.

About The Pricing & MDM Supervisor (Hybrid) Role

In this position, you will lead a team of four Pricing & MDM Specialists to support the APAC region.

Key Responsibilities

Process relevant updates to customer master data and O2C transactional data
Create and maintain pricing conditions and TTS per instructions from the region
Create and maintain rebate agreements (and accruals) for promotional agreements
Account for the accurate capture and coding of losses to allow for root-cause analysis and improved CS levels
Support account teams through ad hoc reporting
Create new customer accounts, maintain customer credit data in line with finance approvals, and provide quality control and data governance for relevant data objects
Be responsible for contract simulations and condition contracts proactive reviews
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure business and customer needs are being met
Support with the training of a new team of Pricing & MDM Specialists to ensure full readiness for go-live

To succeed in this Pricing & MDM Supervisor (Hybrid) role, you will need to have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

Key Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field
At least five years of business experience preferably in pricing and MDM processes
Familiar with SAP functionalities (with preference in SAP S/4HANA)
Good verbal and written communication skills
Proven track record in improvement performance
Excellence in line management
Service-oriented attitude
Able to adapt to changes quickly
Fluent in English

This new SSC needs no introduction and is one of leaders in their field of expertise and they have a strong presence in the market. The firm is also very focused on developing and training their people to the highest standards.

Job desc:
A global chemical distributions company is recruiting for a Sales Executive to join their team. You will be using your expertise to analyze the industry trend and identify new growth areas, leading to sales opportunities.
Responsibilities
To identify potential opportunities and develop new business in the responsible markets.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Communication, Analytics, Business Insights, Enterprise Risk Management, Financial Risk Management, Operational Risk Management, Regulatory Capital, Risk Assessment, Stakeholder Management, Team Management
Job desc:
Featured

Head of Risk Portfolio Management

Job Description

Main Responsibility:

Assess risk & opportunities in the context of risk appetite & macro conditions.
Analyse portfolio performance, identify trends & drivers, draw insights and develop recommendations.
Develop and maintain risk measurement & management frameworks, models, policies, processes, systems and infrastructure. These include capabilities such as IRB rating models, stress testing & expected credit loss models, and economic & regulatory capital models.
Design and produce reports that provide insights & identify opportunities on business developments, and track vulnerabilities to risk developments.

Requirements

At least 12 years of relevant experience with strong analytics & quantitative background.
Strong communication as well as project and stakeholder management skills, ideally at C-suite/Board levels and with regulators.
Subject matter expert in credit portfolio risk management, including credit modelling (IRB, stress test, ECL, Ecap, etc.) and credit risk underwriting or analysis.
Subject matter expert in Basel rules and its local regulatory implementation, FRS regulations, and lending unit management (both wholesale and retail).

To apply, please click "APPLY NOW" or email Reeve at reeve.ng@ambition.com.my quoting reference number #262850. Data provided is for recruitment purposes only.

Due to the volume of applications received, we regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Skills: Employee Engagement, HR Management, HR Policies, Human Resources (HR), Industrial Relations, Labor Relations, Labor and Employment Law, Resource Management, Resource Planning, Talent Management
Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

Promotes and implements human resource values by leading, planning and coordinating human resources initiatives aligning with the organizational objectives.
Leads and co-ordinate the overall Human Resources functions, which includes training & development, compensation & benefits and industrial relations for the entire group.
Implements human resources strategies by establishing department accountabilities, including talent acquisition, staffing, employment processing, compensation, health and welfare benefits, training and development, records management, safety and health, succession planning, employee relations and retention, Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action compliance and labour relations.


Job Requirements

Degree in Human Resource Management or equivalent.
Minimum 10 years of manager role experience in HR management.
Previous experience of managing Human Resources team.
Understanding of all legal implications and ability to resource plan accordingly and comply with legal obligations.
Strong working knowledge of employment law issues and the ability to apply these to a variety of situations.
Familiar with best practice redundancy processes and experienced in coaching managers through this and leading where necessary.
Willing to work at Bintulu, Sarawak.

Work life balance

Skills: Communication, Japanese, Manual Testing, Quality Assurance, Root Cause, Software Testing, Test Automation, Test Cases, Web Testing, Writing
Job desc:
Open to Junior / Fresh graduates


JOB REPONSIBILITIES

Report to a test lead from Japan or another lead which might be in another country.
Understand and follow the testing methodology.
Follow and update test results in standard Japanese template.
Test scope might require following familiarity to software used (you might use similar): SQL and JSON.
Create your own or shared test data
Participate in update meetings
Provide other supplementary test information such as documentation, statistics
Able to determine patterns of error to identify root cause (where possible)
Participate in manual testing and learn automated testing.


Job Requirements

Understanding automated testing an added advantage
The knowledge of scripting for automated testing an added advantage
Must understand Japanese (Reading, writing, speaking).
To be able to use Microsoft Office
Self-discipline and focus on quality and timeliness in project assignment
1 year contract *Renewable after performance assessment.


Should you have any question, please do not hesitate to reach out. Thank you.

Job desc:
Your New Company

This company is an international company that has been in Malaysia since 1962. They provide its different customers with high-quality products and excellent after-sales service in the zipper space.

Your new role

You will be responsible to analyze, explore and develop new zipper, textile & plastic item businesses from fashion, pants, uniform, furniture industry and industry usage, and cover sales territory in Malaysia States except Johor State. This is a sales role.

Job Responsibilities:

Oversee Domestic customer orders
Oversee Export Process Manufacturer Orders
Monitor Accounts Receivables
Handling customers inquiry
Handling customers complaints and feedbacks
To visit customers and build rapport
To understand, comply and fulfill EMS,QMS,ISMS,OHMS and Social compliance requirements as listed in our YGCC latest version.


Job Requirements:

Minimum Diploma or Equivalent
Basic computer literacy
Possess valid driving license
Sales experience is an advantage but not mandatory

Job desc:
Company Background: Air-conditioning
Start From Basic (RM 7000+) +Sales Quarterly commission.
Incentives = meal allowance, phone allowance, years of service allowance (min 1 year)
Working Location: Oasis Ara Damansara, Oasis Square
Working Hours: 9am -6pm, Mon - Fri

Job Description
To identify VRF and HVAC Light Commercial Business opportunities in Malaysia.
To manage multiple distributors’ project pipelines and provide necessary support to ensure successful business closure.
To maintain long term business relationship with consultant, owner, contractor, and potential customer.
To provide sales forecast and market information.
To ensure adequate communication with customers on the order status, vessel booking, delivery on time to meet project deadlines.
To organise marketing activities in line with company marketing strategies and build long term relationship with customers.
To achieve the sales target and debtors’ collection.
To perform sales support and administrative duties for Sales & Marketing Department.
To carry out other duties as assigned by the Immediate Superior or Head of Department.
Job Requirement:
Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering.
Basic understanding on HVAC Knowledge.
Preferable 5-8 year of working experience specializes in Sales & Marketing area.
Language proficiency: English, Malay and Mandarin is added advantage.
Aggressive and self-motivated personality and able to work independently in a fast-pace environment.
Have good communication skills (verbal & written), dedication, hardworking and prefer challenging tasks.
Familiar with Windows system & Microsoft office.
Possess own transport and able to travel outstation to other states

Job desc:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
Main duties

Administrative assistants perform some or all of the following duties:

Prepare, key in, edit and proofread correspondence, invoices, presentations, brochures, publications, reports and related material from machine dictation and handwritten copy

Open and distribute incoming regular and electronic mail and other material and co-ordinate the flow of information internally and with other departments and organizations

Schedule and confirm appointments and meetings of employer

Order office supplies and maintain inventory

Answer telephone and electronic enquiries and relay telephone calls and messages

Set up and maintain manual and computerized information filing systems

Determine and establish office procedures

Greet visitors, ascertain nature of business and direct visitors to employer or appropriate person

Record and prepare minutes of meetings

Arrange travel schedules and make reservations

May compile data, statistics and other information to support research activities

May supervise and train office staff in procedures and in use of current software.

May organize conferences

Administrative officers perform some or all of the following duties:

Oversee and co-ordinate office administrative procedures and review, evaluate and implement new procedures

Establish work priorities, delegate work to office support staff, and ensure deadlines are met and procedures are followed

Carry out administrative activities associated with admissions to post-secondary educational institutions

Administer policies and procedures related to the release of records in processing requests under government access to information and privacy legislation

Co-ordinate and plan for office services, such as accommodation, relocations, equipment, supplies, forms, disposal of assets, parking, maintenance and security services

Conduct analyses and oversee administrative operations related to budgeting, contracting and project planning and management processes

This job is provided by Shine.com
Desired Skills and Experience
"business administration", "administration management", administration, admin, "administrative assistance"

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities

Plan and perform all bench, machine, and finishing operations required to maintain, repair, troubleshoot and alter intricately designed and constructed plastic injection molds.
Operate all tool room machines.
Perform preventative maintenance of plastic injection molds by performing scheduled mold inspections which include the disassembly, cleaning and reassembly of mold.
Troubleshoot mold problems and recommend corrective actions to modify or repair molds accordingly.
Complete appropriate detailed documentation of work performed on tooling maintenance and/or repair.
Troubleshoot and correct wiring issues involving hot manifold equipped injection molds.
Examine molds to determine feasibility of in-house repairs or modifications.
Ensure molds are in good and proper mechanical working order.
Perform polishing, benching, spotting, grinding, drilling, machining, and fitting of tooling as required.
Help maintain and control spare parts inventory.
Understands and practices all aspects of industrial maintenance safety
Handle and dispose of hazardous and non-hazardous chemicals in compliance with government regulations.
Communicate effectively with supervisor and report all issues that may need attention.
Maintain clean work area.

Perks And Benefits

period of contract 2 year renewable
working hours 9 hour per day+ 3 hour over time
Accommodation provided by company
Air passage provided by company
working days 6 days/week

This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
Front desk managers act as the face of an establishment and ensure visitors feel welcomed. Front desk managers are primarily employed in the hospitality industry and should not be confused with front office managers who are employed in any number of industries. The position of front desk manager entails managing the reception area, coordinating all front desk activities, and supervising the support staff. Front desk managers also compile reports for management, including occupancy reports and financial information.

Responsible for the running of the front desk by hiring and training all front desk agents and leading by example
Anticipate and handle any guest requests and satisfy their needs within acceptable guidelines
Assist in the development and monitoring of the budget to provide top quality customer service
Schedule the front office staff and supervise workload during shifts
Act as liaison between the General Manager and staff
Answer phone inquiries, direct calls, and provide basic information
Interested candidates should send his/her updated CV/RESUME : careerjobshrd2020@gmail.com

Head of Recruitment officer.

This job is provided by Shine.com

"document preparation", prioritization, "detail oriented", "records management", "space management", "inventory management", scheduling, "facilities management", "time management"

Job desc:
JOB OBJECTIVE

To improve the performance and partner experience across entire partner lifetime journey from acquisition, onboarding, retention to nurturing.

Job Responsibilities

Responsible for developing a solid and trusting relationship with IB and affiliate partners in the Vietnam market
Responsible for acquiring quality partner in the market and onboarding that partner smoothly to our partner management system
Responsible for complying partner tier policy whilst maintaining the partner acquisition performance
Single point of contact for all partner business
Handle complaints from partners in accordance with established internal policies and deliver compliance approved responses to partner when requested.
Responsible for professional, sound, healthy communication, and relationship with partner
Responsible for improving partner business in terms of trading volume, net fee revenue and active number of customers under partner in the market
Responsible for proper partner business planning in quarterly basis and execute agreed strategy to grow market
Work closely with trade marketing, IB product manager and local conversion/retention team to drive partner business growth


Job Requirements

Minimum education of Advance Diploma/Bachelor’s Degree
Minimum 2 years of experience working in forex/crypto industry with good product knowledge
Experienced in sourcing and managing relationship with IB and partners
Well-versed with Vietnamese market and market planning

Job desc:
“Unifying Purpose, Shaping Careers”. We believe in a world where organizational strategies are brought to life; when everyone finds value in their work by aligning organizational purpose with people, where we inspire a meaningful and impactful future.

Hatch Asia has been selected to lead a confidential search for a Vice President for a global organization that is looking to identify a leader to champion the organization's corporate strategy, planning and transformation function. This organization has built a reputation around it's customer centricity and operational excellence, globally.

This role will focus on working in close partnership with the executive leadership team to bring the organization's strategic priorities to life. The focus of the role will revolve around navigating and driving the group's business initiatives by providing strategic counsel to the ELT and board to ensure prioritization of resources to strategic initiatives are achieved.

The Challenges
Work with the executive leadership team around ideating and executing on well structured long-term and medium term strategic initiatives and operational plans for the organization's business units and subsidiaries that are aligned to the organization's strategic goals and agenda.
lean in to tackle and resolve key areas of strategic unclarity that pose a significant risk to business success and strategy attainment. These difficult challenges require integrative, connected and deep thinking leveraging in-depth knowledge to the organization and bringing in external approaches to find creative and new ways to resolve.
Spearhead the identification of potential business initiatives, ideas and partnerships that will enable the business to identify new opportunities of pursuit. Partner with the group's business units to identify potential investment opportunities, and work towards providing strategic counsel on potential transactions that could add value to the organization and it's footprint globally.
Quarterback the corporate strategic planning process by providing thought leadership, quantitative and qualitative analysis, recommendations and manage the strategic plan throughout the fiscal year. Once plan's have been established, ensure to keen a diligent focus on the health of the organization's performance to the plan as initiatives are completed, swapped or injected.
Help to facilitate functional strategic plans including identification of suitable metrics to measure alignment, progress and performance against corporate strategy and initiatives.

What It Takes
strategic leader and thinker who can translate strategy into organization-wide operational initiatives.
Detailed and process oriented : with the ability to work both on strategic and tactical initiatives.
Proven ability to quickly build rapport and credibility with multiple stakeholders across the organization at various levels
Experience in a large organization overseeing functions and ability to bring people, process and technology together in order to bring organizational strategy to life.

All information will be kept in the strictest confidentiality.

Priority responses will be given to candidates who are shortlisted.

Employment Agency No: 11C5794
Job desc(HTML):
“Unifying Purpose, Shaping Careers”. We believe in a world where organizational strategies are brought to life; when everyone finds value in their work by aligning organizational purpose with people, where we inspire a meaningful and impactful future.

Hatch Asia has been selected to lead a confidential search for a Vice President for a global organization that is looking to identify a leader to champion the organization's corporate strategy, planning and transformation function. This organization has built a reputation around it's customer centricity and operational excellence, globally.

This role will focus on working in close partnership with the executive leadership team to bring the organization's strategic priorities to life. The focus of the role will revolve around navigating and driving the group's business initiatives by providing strategic counsel to the ELT and board to ensure prioritization of resources to strategic initiatives are achieved.

The Challenges
  • Work with the executive leadership team around ideating and executing on well structured long-term and medium term strategic initiatives and operational plans for the organization's business units and subsidiaries that are aligned to the organization's strategic goals and agenda.
  • lean in to tackle and resolve key areas of strategic unclarity that pose a significant risk to business success and strategy attainment. These difficult challenges require integrative, connected and deep thinking leveraging in-depth knowledge to the organization and bringing in external approaches to find creative and new ways to resolve.
  • Spearhead the identification of potential business initiatives, ideas and partnerships that will enable the business to identify new opportunities of pursuit. Partner with the group's business units to identify potential investment opportunities, and work towards providing strategic counsel on potential transactions that could add value to the organization and it's footprint globally.
  • Quarterback the corporate strategic planning process by providing thought leadership, quantitative and qualitative analysis, recommendations and manage the strategic plan throughout the fiscal year. Once plan's have been established, ensure to keen a diligent focus on the health of the organization's performance to the plan as initiatives are completed, swapped or injected.
  • Help to facilitate functional strategic plans including identification of suitable metrics to measure alignment, progress and performance against corporate strategy and initiatives.

What It Takes
  • strategic leader and thinker who can translate strategy into organization-wide operational initiatives.
  • Detailed and process oriented : with the ability to work both on strategic and tactical initiatives.
  • Proven ability to quickly build rapport and credibility with multiple stakeholders across the organization at various levels
  • Experience in a large organization overseeing functions and ability to bring people, process and technology together in order to bring organizational strategy to life.

All information will be kept in the strictest confidentiality.

Priority responses will be given to candidates who are shortlisted.

Employment Agency No: 11C5794

Skills: Communication, Business Administration, Human Resources (HR), Interpersonal Skills, Job Postings, Job Scanning, Key Performance Indicators, Recruiting, Sales, Screening
Job desc:
Office Location: Kelana Jaya
Expected Joining Date: Immediately

Working Hours:
Monday to Friday: 8.00 am to 5.00 pm
Saturday: 9.00 am to 2.00 pm [half day]
Job Type: Contract
Contract length: 12 months
Salary: RM2,300.00 - RM3,000.00 per month + commission [1-month probation]


Duties & Responsibilities:
• Responsible for end-to-end recruitment activities, including the Job posting, screening and
selection, conducting behavioral interview & interview arrangements, conducting reference
checks, and making a job offer.
• Responsible to provide after recruit service to both client and candidates.
• Able to travel; fixed allowance provided.
• Support HR Administrative matters.
• Responsible to handle emails and calls.
• Any ad-hoc jobs as required.

Qualifications
• Candidate must possess at least Advanced Diploma/Degree/Masters in Business Administration/
Marketing/Business Studies.
• Proven work experience as a recruiter (minimum 2 years)
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skill.
• Target and sales driven, self-motivated, sales/commission-oriented person.
• Able to achieve KPI in monthly and quarterly basis.
• Ability to work independently and in a team.
• 3 Contract position(s) based available.

Job desc:
Job description

1) To maintain healthy relationship with schools/colleges/university & companies.
2) Able to plan and execute marketing strategies online
3) Planning and monitoring the ongoing company presence on social media
4) Assisting in the formulation of strategies to build a lasting digital connection with consumers
5) Monitor and be aware of the latest performance marketing tends, technique, tools and traffic resources
6) Launching optimized online advertisements to increase company and brand awareness

Candidate must possess at least Diploma/Bachelor Degree in Engineering / Business Administration or equivalent
Have experienced in sales support /telemarketing is an advantage
At least 1 year experience needed

Willing to learn and aggressive
Good communication and networking skills
Flexible attitude, ability to perform under pressure
Strong enthusiasm, passion and creativity for both content marketing and client services
Highly organized, ability to manage multiple projects at once
Able to do editing for a Brochure & template (Canva/Adobe Photoshop)
Expert in handling media social & webpage are preferred

Job title: Quality Control Technician for Precast Concrete
Skills: Problem Solving, Business Requirements, Calibration, Laboratory Skills, Microbiology, Precast, Quality Assurance, Quality Control, Raw Materials, Tenacious Work Ethic
Job desc:
Job Description

Is it time to take your career to the next level? Do you want to feel valued and be a contributing member of a cohesive team? Our client, a long standing and well-established precast concrete manufacturer is looking for a Precast Quality Control Technician to join their growing team. They are looking for people to be part of a team where they can grow and succeed.

The Quality Control Technician will gather samples and perform various laboratory testing. Successful applicants will be energetic, dedicated and dependable team players that enjoy problem solving.

RESPONSIBILITIES Of The Precast Quality Control Technician

Collect, measure and weigh samples of concrete, aggregate, and raw materials
Assist in maintaining and reporting of information and test results to interested parties.
Assists in reviewing the production process for conformance to quality standards.
Assist in reporting/tracking any significant deviations from quality standards and recommends corrective action as necessary to management.
Encourages each employee to perform quality control as part of their operation.
Participates in new product development to ensure proper quality assurance and control plans can be implemented prior to beginning manufacturing.
At times, expected to perform duties and tasks outside of job description to meet business needs.

REQUIREMENTS Of The Precast Quality Control Technician

Embrace strong work ethics personally and throughout company.
Deal effectively with frequent delays, unexpected events and changes in/or approaches/methods to best fit the situation.
Uses time efficiently
Looks for ways to improve and promote safety and quality.
Minimum 2 years of work-related experience and/or training in concrete.
ACI Level 1 Certification preferred
Familiarity using tools and equipment associated with precast concrete production.

Sound like you?

APPLY TODAY to be a Precast Quality Control Technician! Don't miss out on this opportunity! Call Angella Jensen at 605.799.8783 for more information or email your resume to Angella.Jensen@gogpac.com.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations. Skills: English, Adobe Photoshop, Attention to Detail, CDL, Customer Service, Electrical Wiring, Expense Reports, Expenses, Teamwork, Truck
Job desc:
Job Description

A Highly Respected, Family-Owned Sign business that has been operating for 40 years, is seeking an experienced Sign Installer to join the team for a Full-time position.

Responsibilities

An experienced Sign Specialist / Sign Installer is a motivated individual with experience in the construction and sign industry who will be responsible for the proper installation of various types of signage projects. You will provide timely, cost-effective, and safe completion of installation and service jobs. The safe operation of aerial equipment, sign footing excavation, PPE, wiring of signs, welding, torching, power tools etc. is necessary for this position per company safety policy. This position also requires flexible hours that may be extended beyond 40 hours per week to complete projects. The perfect candidate will have previous sign installation, construction, and fabrication experience as well as be certified/licensed in welding, crane, and have electrical experience.

Competitive Pay – Medical covered 80% - 401K with 3% Match *

Qualifications

Sign Install and Service experience required, 5+ years.
Experience with safe operation of a boom/bucket/lift truck.
Positive attitude with excellent customer service skills.
High attention to detail, quality, and excellent mechanical aptitude.
Crane Operator License a plus
Welding Certification or capabilities
Must have a valid CDL or Chauffeurs license.
Must be able to lift 100 pounds.
Must be comfortable working from ladders, bucket trucks, scaffolding etc.
Occasional travel within state required. Expenses are paid.
OSHA 30 for Construction (Preferred)
Compensation based on experience, skills, and certifications.

Job Highlights & Perks

Weekly Compensation
Paid Vacation
Paid Holidays
Health/Dental/Vision Insurance
401k with 3% Company Match

If you are interested in this opportunity or would like to know about other positions we have available throughout the US, please contact me,Tim West , confidentially at tim.west@gogpac.com with your resume ASAP.

Connect with me on LinkedIn for fast access:www.linkedin.com/in/tim-west-714800188

Skills: English, Malay, Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA), Finance, Financial Accounting, Financial Reporting, Financial Statements, Goods and Services Tax (GST), International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), Mandarin
Job desc:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
We are a professional firm registered with the Malaysian Institute of Accountants.

Our firm is managed by professionals who have the vision to grow and to train new generation of professionals in the audit and tax industry.

We are also an ACCA Approved Employer where the employees are able to enjoy simplified process in attaining ACCA membership.

We practice a healthy and friendly work culture so as to maintain a comfortable working environment.

In line with the firm expansion, we are looking for right candidates to be part of us.

Requirements
Candidates must possess at least Diploma in Accounting/LCCI or equivalent.
Candidates pursuing part-time professional papers (ACCA/CPA/MICPA) will be an added advantage
Required language(s): English, Mandarin, Bahasa Malaysia
Fresh graduates/Junior executives are encouraged to apply
Candidates who possess own transport will be an added advantage
Willing to travel to client's premise when necessary
Preferably entry level specialized in Audit/Taxation/Accounting or equivalent.
Responsibilities
Update and finalization of clients' management/financial accounts
Maintenance of chart of accounts and opening balances
Preparation of relevant schedules (Plant and Equipment List, Payroll List, Accruals etc)
Handling of clients' SST matters
Work as an effective team member to complete assignments
Work diligently to ensure deadlines are met
Interested candidates please submit your application through Jobstore.com

Skills: Code Review, Coding Standards, Data Architecture, Data Modeling, Database Design, PL/SQL, Programming Languages, Stored Procedures, Unit Testing, Web Application Development
Job desc:
Job Description:
Responsible for delivery of interface solutions to internal and external systems.
Responsible for impact analysis, architecture, proposed solution, design, coding, unit testing, and deployment.
Comply with the software development process and deliver the required documents and specs.
Responsible for code review, non-functional test to ensure good quality of the delivery.
Conduct feasibility studies on various technology and services options and recommend appropriate solutions to meet GE business requirements.
Provide guidance to junior developers and ensure the solution aligned with IT strategy.
Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks.
Maintains awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company.
Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices.

Skill Set:
At least 5 years of working experience in application development area. Knowledge of Insurance domain is an advantage.
Proficient in web application development using Java technology
Proficient in PL/SQL, Oracle Database
Proficient in Database Design and analysis
Knowledge of professional software engineering and best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
High level of integrity, takes accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork.
Takes initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes.

Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Job Posting : Jan 19 2023

About Cognizant

Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.
Job desc(HTML):
Job Description:
  • Responsible for delivery of interface solutions to internal and external systems.
  • Responsible for impact analysis, architecture, proposed solution, design, coding, unit testing, and deployment.
  • Comply with the software development process and deliver the required documents and specs.
  • Responsible for code review, non-functional test to ensure good quality of the delivery.
  • Conduct feasibility studies on various technology and services options and recommend appropriate solutions to meet GE business requirements.
  • Provide guidance to junior developers and ensure the solution aligned with IT strategy.
  • Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks.
  • Maintains awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company.
  • Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices.

Skill Set:
  • At least 5 years of working experience in application development area. Knowledge of Insurance domain is an advantage.
  • Proficient in web application development using Java technology
  • Proficient in PL/SQL, Oracle Database
  • Proficient in Database Design and analysis
  • Knowledge of professional software engineering and best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
  • High level of integrity, takes accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork.
  • Takes initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes.

Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Skills: Blogging, Content Development, Content Planning, Content Strategy, Editorial, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Web Content Creation, Web Content Writing, WordPress, Writing
Job desc:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
Our Client specializes in providing SEO services and solutions as well as virtual teambuilding workshops and events. Their mission is to help brands achieve more online traffic and brand visibility.

Position: Content Writer InternshipLocation: Petaling Jaya

Responsibilities
Research and write 3 blog posts per day (topics are provided)
Develop editorial line-up
What you will be taught:
Keywords research
Keywords targeting
SEO basics
Content research (what to look out for)
Content planning and structure (keywords, audience intention, and title)
Planning of article outline
Permalink structure
WordPress basics [Apply now at https://my.hiredly.com/jobs/jobs-malaysia-polymorph-enterprise-job-content-writer-internship]
Requirements
Relevant or related qualification.
Need to be versatile as you are required to write a range of topics
Good writing skills
Diligent, responsible and independent
Most of the time you will be working from home and you are expected to meet the work targets that are set at the start of the week.
REMUNERATION PACKAGES:Allowance: RM 700 to RM 1,200 (WFH)Working Days: 5 days' work weekWorking Hours: Monday - Friday (8.15am - 5.30pm)

Remark: Option to convert to a Full Time/Permanent role.

Job desc:
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more
Responsibilities :-
Identifying new opportunities to increase sales, handling and communicate with clients, and strategically negotiating the terms of sale with clients to close sales.
Keep abreast of the latest developments in medical legislation to determine the effect it may have on company sales. Ultimately, an outstanding Corporate Sales person l should demonstrate excellent negotiation, customer service, and consultative sales skills to continually meet or exceed sales targets.
