An exciting Assistant Finance Manager (Property) job has just become available at one of the public-listed property development companies based in Petaling Jaya.

About The Assistant Finance Manager (Property) Role

As the Assistant Finance Manager (Property), you will responsible for the full spectrum of reporting.

Key Responsibilities

Lead the delivery of reporting pack for Singapore and Australia
Responsible for accounts payable, accounts receivable, bank reconciliations, balance sheet reconciliations, monthly closing and general Ledger for small and non-operating entities

Develop relationships with key stakeholders in the wider group to foster a culture of operational excellence

To succeed in this Assistant Finance Manager (Property) role, you must be a high energy, responsive, detail-oriented, and experienced leader with strong communication, presentation, negotiation, analytical, operational, and people skills.

Degree in Accounting or professional qualification (e.g. ACCA or CPA) - compulsory requirement ACCA or CPA qualification
Minimum of five years' working experience in similar accounting function
Prior experience in shared services environment is an added advantage

High values of honesty, integrity and strong work ethic
Strong leadership skills – Train, mentor and motivate individuals and teams across the business
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Excellent time management and ability to adhere to strict deadlines

Proactive and resourceful with the ability to work autonomously to identify improvements

Job desc:
An exciting Licensing Specialist (Software/Cloud) job has just become available at one of the top manufacturing companies based in Shah Alam.

About The Licensing Specialist (Software/Cloud) Role

In this role, you are responsible for overseeing the organisation’s licensing models for software and IT platforms, such as enterprise and volume licenses, perpetual licenses, floating licenses, trial licenses, subscriptions, and feature licenses.

Key Responsibilities

Ensure license compliance by setting up a license monitoring SOP for the organisation
Perform internal IT license audits on a regular basis. Provide IT asset reports and statistics
Provide consultation on how to optimise the license situation and save costs
Manage and support various license and partner portals
Develop and improve the IT asset management (software and hardware) within the IT department in collaboration with various global departments and decentralised business units

To succeed in this Licensing Specialist (Software/Cloud) role, you must have good knowledge of the different licensing models and terms of the tier one vendors such as Microsoft, VMware, Adobe and others.

Key Requirements

Experienced in the SAM tool Flexera and ServiceNow. Experienced in managing and supporting internal and external audits, including preparation of ELPs, true-ups and other general data analysis and reports
Experience with optimising software licenses, identifying savings, minimising risks, and complying with regulations
Experienced working with cloud licenses, technologies, and services
Excellent written and spoken English, good communication and presentation skills
Preferably a master's degree holder in computer Science/information management/information technology, etc., software asset manager certification is desirable. Knowledge in process automation is a plus
Open to international travel when required by the business

The scope of the offer, the size of the business, the freedom and autonomy to drive your career forward all add up to a great place to work.

If you have a successful track record in Software/Cloud Licensing, you can take your career forward with this exciting Licensing Specialist (Software/Cloud) job.

Apply today or e-mail me at Sarah.Nunis@robertwalters.com.my to discuss this new opportunity.

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Job desc:
An exciting IT Business Relationship Manager (FS) job has just become available at one of the financial services companies based in Kuala Lumpur.

About The IT Business Relationship Manager (FS) Role

In this business critical role, you will oversee service level and support, understand business system requirements and develop implementation approach to deliver internal infrastructure.

Key Responsibilities

Interact with business unit management teams, officers, and representatives to assist them in IT resources
Manage the specification, construction, and integration of deliverables from internal technical teams and external vendors to local business units
Manage the implementation of the infrastructure scope to ensure that internal Infrastructure meets delivery obligations
Track the project to the agreed schedule and reports on progress and status, and act as the focal point and liaison between the business technology stakeholders and technical tower leads
Conduct presentations that demonstrate the corporate service delivery management capabilities and implementation of best practice
Implement short- and long-term information technology (IT) solutions that meet the needs of the organisation

To succeed in this IT Business Relationship Manager (FS) role, you must be equipped with great business relationship management skill sets in addition to your IT technicalities including infrastructure, project management, vendor management, compliance, etc.

Key Requirements

Degree in IT, Engineering or related area
Excellent interpersonal and communication abilities
More than eight years of solid IT working experience
More than two years' experience in managing a size of 5 - 10 IT managers or technical resources
Financial services background will be an added advantage
Experienced in IT project management
Experienced in management of vendor relationships with a focus on deliverable management
Understands the scope of the business components of projects and liaises with business staff responsible for those components

This organisation has cemented itself as a market leader in their field.

Great career progression opportunities await the right person in this IT Business Relationship Manager (FS) role.

Job desc:
An IT Audit Manager - Application Controls job has become available at an outstanding financial services company.

About The IT Audit Manager - Application Controls Role

You will be responsible for management and supervision of IT audit jobs throughout the planning, field work and reporting phases. Your main responsibility is to plan, develop and deliver independent and objective assurance services to the Group Audit and Risk Committee (GARC) and senior management of the institution’s on governance, internal controls and risk management processes mainly through the disciplined planning, implementing and reporting of internal audits conducted on the various audit entities.

Key Responsibilities

Execute and complete the assigned IT audit – application controls engagements in accordance with the GIA standards
Contribute to building group IT audit – application controls team with relevant skill sets and business knowledge
Facilitate to build audit relationship with key IT management via regular interaction so as to be informed of emerging risk issues and other key changes for assigned locations and BUs
Assist in the development of annual audit plan whenever needed
Prepare audit reports in accordance with QAR requirements
Facilitate and participate into the discussion of issues and remedial action plans with the appropriate levels of management
Follow up with outstanding audit issues and monitor timely completion of agreed remedial actions by the management
Take the initiative in improving self through classroom and on-the-job trainings
Perform other responsibilities and duties periodically assigned in order to meet operational and/or other requirements

This successful IT Audit Manager candidate is a high-potential and motivated individual who goes the extra miles to make a difference in the financial service line, ensuring that risks affecting the business is adequately covered.

Key Requirements

At least a good bachelor’s degree, preferably in IT or MIS or equivalent
Engage in professional development activities, including completion of a professional certification programmes CISA/CIA/ISMS Lead Auditor professional certification is an advantage
At least three years of work experience in managing IT internal audit assignments. Related experience in large audit/consultation firms or financial services is a plus
Sound knowledge of IT-related matters and accounting principles
Good organisational/analytical skills
Self-motivated and independent
Punctual and reliable, with good time-management skills
Excellent communication/writing skills; Bahasa Malaysia and English
Computer literate – Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint

This financial institution has an outstanding reputation in its field and great value is placed on exposure and ground to develop reputation. The scope of the offer, the size of business, the freedom and autonomy to drive your career forward all comes up to a great place to work.

If you have what it takes, is passionate about the financial industry and want to elevate yourself, this is an excellent opportunity to work with an industry leader that is constantly breaking new ground. Great career opportunities await the right person in this exciting IT Audit Manager - Application Controls job.

Apply today or email me at melvin.cheah@robertwalters.com.my to discuss this new opportunity today.

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Job desc:
A Planning Assistant Manager job has become available at an established FMCG company.

About The Planning Assistant Manager Role

In this role, you will be responsible for material and production planning activities to meet demand requirements for the company’s dairy products. This role reports directly to the RMP Manager.

Key Responsibilities

Work with sales, marketing, warehouse and third-party contract manufacturer on forecasting and products availability
Plan and purchase raw milk based on material usage
Monitor shipments and ensure the necessary original shipping documents are in place before shipment
Prepare production plans based on the weekly forecast
Track materials supply to guarantee they are available on time for production use
Monitor and maintain packaging and finished goods inventory within the targeted stock holding
Work closely with QA to release finished goods on time

To succeed in this role, you will need to possess strong leadership skills and experience in WMS and inventory management/control.

Key Requirements

Degree in supply chain management, logistics, or any related field
Minimum of four years of supply planning in the FMCG industry, experience in production planning is advantageous
Proficient in Excel and ERP system
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to work independently whilst still being a team player
Application is open to Malaysians and/or candidates with existing right to employment in Malaysia

This established FMCG company needs no introduction. They are an established leader and boasts a wide range of products and brands that are household names in the region.

If you are a supply planning talent looking to advance your career, then this Planning Assistant Manager role is the perfect opportunity for you.

Apply now or email me at Naufal.Shukri@robertwalters.com.my / call me at 03-2303 7064 to discuss this new opportunity.

Skills: Category Management, Indirect Purchasing, Materials Procurement, Procurement, Social Influence, Strategic Procurement, Supplier Evaluation, Supplier Management, Supplier Performance, Tenders
Job desc:
A Regional Procurement Manager job has become available at a renowned food manufacturer.

About The Regional Procurement Manager Role

In this position, you will be responsible for managing the procurement activities of the indirect categories which includes co-manufacturing, marketing, distribution, services, and projects. The scope of this role includes cost savings, supplier development, compliance to contract and procurement process improvement. You will be reporting directly to the Head of Procurement.

Key Responsibilities

Play the function of category leader, monitor contract with suppliers and monitor supplier performance (KPIs and service level) for contract compliance
Develop and implement a purchasing action plan for category for a sustainable competitive advantage from the perspective of cost, safety, security of supply and innovation
Manage the day-to-day operations of the procurement process, oversee suppliers’ delivery of materials and services in accordance with standards of price, time, quantity and quality agreed upon
Develop a capable and engaged procurement team to interface with internal stakeholders, business and supplier partners with capabilities to identify metrics, tools, and processes to optimise sourcing, supplier activities, and efficiency
Manage governance and control programmes to ensure business continuity, protection of company assets and compliance with corporate and regulatory policies
Negotiate with suppliers for indirect purchases while ensuring that they meet the company’s standards
Manage tenders and supplier contracts, documenting them into the system and carrying out the renewal process

Licence Number : JTKSM 423C

Skills: Problem Solving, Analytical Skills, Attention to Detail, Automation, Automation Engineering, Control Valves, Engineering Changes, Engineering Management, Process Efficiency, Specifications
Job desc:
An established multinational automation solutions service provider is looking for an Engineering Manager to lead, plan and map out the factory automation blueprint in its journey towards Industry 4.0. In this job, you will report to the Head of Engineering.

About The Engineering Manager Role

In this position, you will be accountable for proposing engineering solutions in order to optimise the organisation’s troubleshooting processes.

Key Responsibilities

Leading the revamping of the engineering processes encompassing repair procedures, fixture design, cell layout and equipment acquisitions
Ensuring that project/department milestones/goals are met and adhering to approved budgets
Reviewing, evaluating, and implementing engineering changes and specification requirements
Providing manufacturing decision-making information by calculating production, labour, material costs and reviewing production schedules
Preparing product and process reports by collecting, analysing, and summarising information and trends
Ensuring the department has the organisation structure and management capability to help and support the company to achieve its business objectives
Initiating plant capability expansion and manage capital spending plans
Working closely with manufacturing engineering team for new product transfer and development
Assisting to resolve manufacturing problems encountered from shop floor and drive to improve it to achieve production and product quality yield
Providing engineering, supervision for new product introduction and production support with initiating, planning, executing, monitoring, and control and closing
Working closely in a team to interpret corporate documentation and other reference materials to determine manufacturing requirements and processing procedures on new or revised part numbers

To be successful in this role, you should have at least eight years of experience in coming up with engineering solutions, preferably within the automation industry.

Key Requirements

Tertiary qualifications in mechanical engineering or equivalent
At least eight years of experience within the automation engineering field
Strong technical knowledge of control valves, regulators, transmitters, analysers, and automation systems is ideal
Strong knowledge of budgeting and financial analysis for engineering and capital expenditure projects
Knowledge in Lean Six Sigma
Good problem-solving and crisis-management skills
Clear thinking with strong analytical abilities with attention to detail and problem-solving skills
A good grasp of process efficiency methodology and a good eye for cost management
Exposure to automation or valve industry is an advantage
Strong interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Passion for efficiency and effectiveness

This company is renowned worldwide as one of the largest providers of leading-edge solutions within the world of automation and process management tools for the world’s largest industrial clients.

If you are an Engineering Manager who strives in the ideation of creative engineering solutions, this opportunity will enable you to further develop your knowledge and exposure in a world class manufacturing environment.

Apply today or send your CV to shanggar.marimutu@robertwalters.com.my to discuss this new opportunity.

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Job desc:
An Order Management Lead job has become available at a leading multinational company.

About The Order Management Lead Role

In this position, you will be accountable for overseeing and directing the order management operations within the Australasia region. You will be responsible for leading a team and recruiting subordinates across the region. This role reports directly to the O2C Regional Hub Manager.

Key Responsibilities

Lead a team of order management staff to achieve high standards of quality, efficiency, and effectiveness in their work
Manage customer sales orders and ensure proper follow-up on their status
Continuously monitor the timely and complete delivery of goods
Classify and respond to customer inquiries
Allocate products according to customer segmentation in the event of shortages
Report on the end-to-end claims process and life cycle management
Ensure that the APAC region meets all operational and financial performance targets and obligations for order management and claims
Allocate products according to customer segmentation in the event of shortages

To succeed in this role, you will need extensive experience in order management and well-versed in processing orders and claims through SAP.

Key Requirements

Degree in supply chain, logistics, business or any related discipline
Minimum of 5 - 10 years’ experience in order management
Strong knowledge in order-to-cash processes, particularly with order processing, fulfilment and claims
Experience with using SAP, S4 Hana knowledge is an advantage
A detailed, customer-oriented, and hands-on attitude
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Able to work independently
Application is open to Malaysians and/or candidates with existing right to employment in Malaysia

This multinational company is a recognised leader in its market with several brands under their portfolio that are household names across the globe. They are entering an exciting period in their organisation as they transition into a new system and ramping up its operations within the region.

If you are driven, ambitious and keen to take on an opportunity to develop your career in a regional role, then this Order Management Lead role is perfect for you.

Apply now or email me at Naufal.Shukri@robertwalters.com.my/call me at 03-2303 7064 to discuss this new opportunity.

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: BAU, Capital Management, ICAAP, LGD, Resolution Planning, Scenario, Sensitivity Analysis, Stress Test, Stress Testing, Test Data
Job desc:
Responsibilities

Job description

Lead a team of 2-3 to drive the Banking Group's stress test programme, organize & analyze the stress test data, present conclusions and recommendations. Specifically, key responsibilities include:
Plan and timely coordination of the semi-annual stress test (inc. reverse stress test), which entails working with multiple stakeholders across risk, finance and business;
Drive the analysis of stress test results and the implications for strategy, planning and risk/capital management;
Conduct review of plausibility and analysis of the generated stress test outputs from SAS;
Ensure production of high-quality materials for senior committees and BNM that supports clear messages around our stress test results;
Deliver all supporting materials for the BNM submission, including summary of results and implications for the Group;
Periodic maintenance and improvements of our stress test programme which covers (i) methodology (ii) system-related i.e. SAS (iii) changes in regulatory expectation (iv) etc.
Engaged in driving the development of the Group's Recovery & Resolution planning and later ongoing BAU execution
Support Bank's Basel and ICAAP processes by simulating stress outcome to check whether it has adequate capital to withstand shocks under stress.
Coordinate conduct of the bank's stress tests, soliciting potential stress scenarios, facilitate collective meetings for the working group, jointly develop macroeconomic settings
Provide support for Business to develop and/or refine PD, LGD and EAD stress methodologies/ approaches.
Materially contribute to define the technical & business requirements for stress testing, this include Business Scenario Definition, impacts from Bank's predictive
Provide the domain expertise to develop and maintain Bank Stress methodologies and Framework/Policies.
Running the stress scenario and measuring impacts including sensitivity analysis.
Production of regular and ad-hoc stress test report in a timely fashion in compliance with Bank Stress Testing methodologies.
Provide support for stress testing team's role as coordinator and driver of the stress testing for group's banking entities.

Job Requirements

At least 7 years direct experience in stress testing development / production (BNM, ICAAP or upon Senior Management request) capacity. Familiarity with SAS EG is a plus.
Strong knowledge in Stress testing and broad understanding of Basel, provisions and banking products / lines of business.
Be able to think creatively, solutions orientated, communicate effectively and able to manage diverse stakeholders.
Candidates from banking or consultancy background preferred.

How To Apply

To apply, please click "APPLY NOW" or email Rebekah at Rebekah.Kok@ambition.com.my quoting reference number #262745 - VP Risk Analytics Stress Testing. Data provided is for recruitment purposes only.

Due to the volume of applications received, we regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job desc:
The newly set up plant of an Electrical and Electronics Manufacturing MNC that will start operating in May 2023 in Senai, Johor is looking for a Trade & Customs Specialist (Warehouse)

Job Responsibilities

Responsible for the import & export compliance operations.
Contact for local customs agencies and service providers (including carriers, forwarders and/or customs brokers).
Supports the Center of Excellence concept. Works with both internal and external partners to measure and define trade compliance process and drive improvements.
Supports strategic trade and customs goals. Identifies cost and/or time saving opportunities.


Job Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain; Operations Management; Business or related field.
3 - 5 years of applicable experience, including Trade & Customs compliance and Supply Chain.
MS Office Proficiency and Advanced Excel (Macros, Complex Formulas, Pivot Charts, Access Database Management, etc.)
Good communication skills, able to work independently or in a group, strong critical thinking and organization skills, able to multitask.
Advanced Data query / Business Objects capability.
Intermediate Supply Chain knowledge - Purchasing, Planning, Inventory, Logistics, and/or Warehousing.
Excellent analytical and project leadership skills.
Ability to work across multiple, cross functional departments and teams in multiple time zones.


Benefits

Group insurance
Group PA
Transport allowance
Shift allowance
13 month salary (AWS)
Attendance allowance

Skills: Communication, BMC Helix ITSM, IT Service Management, Infrastructure Technologies, Organization Skills, Technical Communication, Technical Documentation, Telephony, Troubleshooting, Voice over IP (VoIP)
Job desc:
Job Responsibilities
Carry out the functions of the Tier 1 Service Desk with adherence to ITIL 2011 based processes and within the timeframes associated as per SLA agreement.
System Monitoring - Monitoring of global technology environment; taking action when alerts are received.
Preventative maintenance – Perform regularly scheduled tasks including Health Checks, Service Validation, and Reporting
Front-end Incident Management; with a primary focus towards restoring services with SLAs. Manage ticket routing to the appropriate 3rd party support teams . Gather and analyse log information associated with the incident for escalation to other Tiers.
Front-end Service Request Management, c oordinate service request with on-site resources, r emotely execute system changes to fulfil service requests, and m anage service request ticket lifecycle.
To coordinate change tickets and manage change control documentation with customer Change Control Board and assigned change managers.
To manage lifecycle of change ticket and ticket lifecycle support (Incidents, Changes, Service Requests) includes:
a. Opening, tracking, and closing incident tickets.
b. Providing timely customer facing ticket updates, depending on Severity/Priority of ticket, to meet SLAs. Call key stakeholders if necessary.
c. Create tickets for all issues, incidents and requests received via IPC Portal, phone call, email and chat.
d . Classify incident and request severity and priority and manage tickets in accordance with Operating Level Agreements (OLAs).

Maintain Run Book documentation – update workflows and procedures on a regular basis to keep documentation current.


Job Requirements

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent with 1-3 years of front line technical support or related service experience.
Must possess experience with IT Infrastructure technologies and VoIP Telephony technologies. Must have experience working with ITSM system, such as Remedy.
High energy and motivated individual with prior work experience in ITIL based culture.
Experience supporting global customers, working with a wide array of individuals from ends users to customer’s business executives. Must demonstrate interpersonal skills necessary to work within a team environment and communicate effectively across a variety of geographically dispersed resources.
Ability to be self-sufficient and work independently.
Excellent organizational skills, written-verbal technical communication.
Flexibility and willing to work non-standard hours on occasion to meet customer demands.
Demonstrate commitment to quality and customer services.
Methodical troubleshooting skills.
Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel, Word and Visio to support updating technical documentation and Run Books.


DESIRABLE

Experience with NICE Voice Recording products, Cisco CUCM, Motorola WAVE/Twisted Pair, Oracle Acme Packets, Enghouse Proteus are a plus.

holistic well-being Working Culture

Job desc(HTML):
Job Responsibilities
  • Carry out the functions of the Tier 1 Service Desk with adherence to ITIL 2011 based processes and within the timeframes associated as per SLA agreement.
  • System Monitoring - Monitoring of global technology environment; taking action when alerts are received.
  • Preventative maintenance – Perform regularly scheduled tasks including Health Checks, Service Validation, and Reporting
  • Front-end Incident Management; with a primary focus towards restoring services with SLAs. Manage ticket routing to the appropriate 3rd party support teams . Gather and analyse log information associated with the incident for escalation to other Tiers.
  • Front-end Service Request Management, c oordinate service request with on-site resources, r emotely execute system changes to fulfil service requests, and m anage service request ticket lifecycle.
  • To coordinate change tickets and manage change control documentation with customer Change Control Board and assigned change managers.
  • To manage lifecycle of change ticket and ticket lifecycle support (Incidents, Changes, Service Requests) includes:
    • a. Opening, tracking, and closing incident tickets.
    • b. Providing timely customer facing ticket updates, depending on Severity/Priority of ticket, to meet SLAs. Call key stakeholders if necessary.
    • c. Create tickets for all issues, incidents and requests received via IPC Portal, phone call, email and chat.
    • d . Classify incident and request severity and priority and manage tickets in accordance with Operating Level Agreements (OLAs).

  • Maintain Run Book documentation – update workflows and procedures on a regular basis to keep documentation current.


Job Requirements


  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent with 1-3 years of front line technical support or related service experience.
  • Must possess experience with IT Infrastructure technologies and VoIP Telephony technologies. Must have experience working with ITSM system, such as Remedy.
  • High energy and motivated individual with prior work experience in ITIL based culture.
  • Experience supporting global customers, working with a wide array of individuals from ends users to customer’s business executives. Must demonstrate interpersonal skills necessary to work within a team environment and communicate effectively across a variety of geographically dispersed resources.
  • Ability to be self-sufficient and work independently.
  • Excellent organizational skills, written-verbal technical communication.
  • Flexibility and willing to work non-standard hours on occasion to meet customer demands.
  • Demonstrate commitment to quality and customer services.
  • Methodical troubleshooting skills.
  • Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel, Word and Visio to support updating technical documentation and Run Books.


DESIRABLE


  • Experience with NICE Voice Recording products, Cisco CUCM, Motorola WAVE/Twisted Pair, Oracle Acme Packets, Enghouse Proteus are a plus.
  • Proven experience in process improvements and automation is a plus.
  • Methodical troubleshooting skills. Wireshark experience a plus.
  • SIP certification that covers VOIP path end to end, through PSTN and IP PBXs, via SBCs and proxies is desirable.


Perks & Benefits


  • Hybrid Working Mode
  • Medical, Dental, Optical & Insurance
  • Free flow of F&B at office Pantry
  • holistic well-being Working Culture

Skills: C#, Cascading Style Sheets (CSS), Environmental Quality, Git, Leadership, MATLAB, System Testing, Team Leadership, Teamwork, Wastewater Treatment
Job desc:
Job Responsibilities

To manage the operations of a wastewater treatment plant to ensure compliance with regulatory procedures and reporting practices.
To oversee sampling and testing systems, and the functionality of pumps, conveyors, blowers, and other equipment.
To manage core competency activities: to provide formulated chemical programs and value added technical services in Waste Water Treatment for various industries and applications.
To formulate an implementation plan for full compliance with the regulatory and requirements of he Environmental Quality (Scheduled Wastes Regulations).
To work with chemical/consumable suppliers and the upstream production teams to maximize throughput of the surface treatment
To manage the waste water treatment area in compliance with authority demands. Ensures staff is up-to-date with all federal, state, and local regulations and environmental guidelines.
To train and develop teams of surface treatment, transferring knowledge throughout
To ensure that project/department milestones/goals are met and adhering to approved budgets.


Job Requirements

Possesses Bachelor's Degree / Diploma in Engineering or equivalent.
Certified in CePIETSO-PCP, CePIETSO-BP or both.
Preferably with 5 of years' experience in related field.
Well versed in hands on wastewater treatment management.
Able to lead a team with good leadership quality.
To be based in Johor Bahru, Johor.


Interested candidates are welcomed to apply online or send your latest resume to waikin.lee@jac-recruitment.com

Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Skills: Building Materials, New Vendor Development, Procurement, Purchase Management, Purchase Planning, Purchasing, Purchasing Processes, Supplier Development, Supplier Evaluation, Supplier Negotiation
Job desc:
About The Company

Your future employer is an engineering procurement and consulting (EPC) firm. They have completed many industrial projects across Malaysia. As the demand for projects is growing, they are looking for a Senior Purchasing Engineer.

About The Job
Responsible for overall procurement of relevant raw & building materials, subcontracting works.
Source of reliable suppliers & contractors and to ensure project cost within budget and/or to maximise project savings and/or profits.
Verify and approve purchase requisitions by reviewing cost comparison report, clarifying unclear items, recommend alternatives or substitutes, propose value engineering, etc.
Working hand in hand with other departments within the company to ensure smooth and efficient procurement process and on time project delivery.
Follow up and look into overall procurement and purchasing administrative matters and any other ad-hoc tasks.
Preparation of cost studies, feasibility studies, cost/budget planning & control for projects.
Follow up and look into overall administrative matters of various contracts and subcontract works including recommendation of payments, variation order certificates, etc.
About The Manager/team

The successful candidate will be reporting to the Purchasing Manager.

Skills And Experience Required
Minimum a degree in Mechanical Engineering/ Experience in procurement/purchasing (M&E) is preferable.
Able to work with independently and able to manage multiple stakeholders across the board.
How to apply

Please apply through this advertisement or log into www.randstad.com.my for further details. Due to the high volume of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. You can reach me at linyee.sng@randstad.com.my

Skills: BOQ, Budgeting, Construction, Contract Negotiation, Cost Management, Land Surveying, Quantity Surveying, Surveying, Tender Preparation, Tenders
Job desc:
About The Company

Your future employer is an veteran in Construction with more than 10 completed commercial and industrial projects across Johor. With a growing project portfolio in Malaysia, we are looking to expand the team with a Senior Quantity Surveyor to be based onsite at Johor.

About The Job

You will primarily be responsible for sourcing potential CSA subcontractors, suppliers, liaising with clients, consultants, authorities and handling the end to end process in regards to CSA tender. The process will includes:
Prepare bills of quantities, taking-off, and cost estimates for CSA Services
Prepare for tender submission/quotation.
Prepare variation order costs and finalise project accounts with the Project Department.
Prepare claims and obtain approvals from the clients or consultants.
Prepare the CSA project budget and compare tender and subcontract work.
Prepare CSA subcontractors' and suppliers’ work package tender.
Prepare monthly progress claims and payment recommendations to the management.
Compile all the cost files and summaries to the Post-Contract Negotiation/Awarding Committee for final negotiations once the project is secured.
About The Manager/team

You will be reporting to the Director who comes with many years of experience with the organisation. You will work with a team of experienced quantity surveyors and receive good exposure on industrial construction.

Skills And Experience Required

To be successful in your role, you will come with a tertiary qualification in Quantity Surveying and some years of experience in handling CSA related projects.
Bachelor / Diploma in Quantity Surveying or equivalent.
2 years and above of CSA work experience in a Construction Company.
How to apply

Please click apply to submit your application or log into www.randstad.com.my for more jobs. You can reach me at linyee.sng@randstad.com.my

Skills: Communication, Problem Solving, Coaching, Interpersonal Skills, Procurement, Quantity Surveying, Supplier Evaluation, Supplier Negotiation, Surveying, Tender Management
Job desc:
My client is looking for candidate with strong background in contract administration and management covering of field of Construction, Facilities Management and Services.

Responsible:

Administer of contract and procurement management for the Group Companies including the whole project as well as the contractors and consultants.
Lead tender / bidding exercise preparation by developing a project feasibility study which includes project budget, resources and cash flow.
Analyse all contract documentation and produce a deliverables schedule in collaboration with project team. Monitor performance against this schedule and recommend corrective actions.
Managing pre award activities including shortlisting consultants, contractors, surveyors etc. for participation in the tender called by the Company.
Responsible to manage awarded contract in accordance to conditions of contract including administer of monthly report progress claim, subcontractors’ payment certification, variation order evaluation, joint measurement and project final account.
Identify any amendment, variation, claim or breach that could significant impact on project in terms of cost and time. Manage these in a timely manner through negotiation of variations, claims and counter – claims, leveraging claims and legal expertise as necessary.
Ensure that the procurement activities are compliant including adhering to process under tender management.
To monitor the compliances of the contract specification and to ensure legal obligation are met.
Manage and coaching all subordinates.


Requirement:

Candidate must possess at least at least Bachelor’s Degree in Quantity Surveying or equivalent.
At least 20 years’ experience in a similar role is desirable.
Experience of working in a fast phase office environment
Well versed with the statutory and regulatory requirements including CIPAA, CIDB, PAAB, SPAN, MPOB and any others regulatory bodies and laws
Flexible attitude to cope with a variety of duties which may be required at short notice.
An excellent organiser and communicator; and with outstanding time management and interpersonal skills.
A proactive problem solver and highly practiced in discretion and confidentiality.
Excels working under pressure to meet tight deadlines.


Do apply and send your CV to my email jack.choo@jac-recruitment.com

Job desc:
The client:

The client is the integrated retail and corporate banking unit of the largest bank in the third largest financial services company in Japan, with total assets of approximately $1.8 trillion in 2017. The client is one of the three so-called Japanese "megabanks".

Job Description

Provide operations & admin support, clearing & settlement of FCY TT/Rentas Operation including accurate data entry and/or approving related transactions in systems for all products supported by TT/Rentas team
To participate in UAT/Projects to improve systems pertaining to TT/Rentas products as and when required
Preparation of daily reports including housekeeping of documents in a timely manner for future easy retrieval
Multi-tasking & providing support to other teams within the same business unit, liaising with other departments to resolve investigations in TT/Rentas products
Ensure compliance to Remittance Policies, Manual & Guidelines and Service Level Agreement
Preferably, the candidate to have experience in banking operations, especially foreign currency remittance & familiar with Foreign Exchange Policy Notices / SWIFT & BNM/Paynet guideline


Requirement

Bachelor’s degree in any related fields
Fresh Bachelor Degree with internship experience
Experience with Office Management software like MS Office (MS Excel and MS Word) and Power Point
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong Organization Skills with a Problem -Solving attitude
Excellent personal organisational skills with the ability to prioritise and to work and meet tight deadline
Ability to multitask

Skills: Calibration, Data Sheets, Engineering Design, Field Instruments, Instrumentation, Offshore, Project Implementation, Sizing, Technical Documentation, Technical Specs
Job desc:
Airswift has been tasked by one of our major oil & gas clients to seek for Instrumentation Engineer to work within their organizations located in Malaysia for a contract assignment.

Responsibilities:

Development Technology know how and Commercial support
Feasibility
Bidding phase/Commercial proposal development
Prepare Instrumentation elements (tagged items and bulk material), quantities for cost and erection works estimates
Support Discipline Lead to define man hours and cost estimated
Project Execution
Review Client technical documentation and requirements
Coordinate subcontracted engineering activities and control subcontracted engineering documents
Define engineering design basis and guidelines
Prepare the technical documentation for Instrumentation elements material and services requisitions and prepare,
according to internal procedures, the technical evaluations
Provide technical support to Project Team
Optimise Instrumentation design ensuring minimal cost and complexity in compliance with the contractual and safety requirements
Prepare Instrumentation technical specifications
Prepare Instrumentation data sheets
Prepare Instrumentation installation specifications and drawings
Participate to P and ID mechanization
Validate Vendor control valves and safety valves sizing calculations
Validate Vendor measurements elements sizing calculations
Coordinate engineering activities
Ensure Instrumentation 3D modeling design activities
Participate to F.A.T. activities ad Vendor workshop
Provide technical and engineering support to construction Team
Perform site engineering activities during construction and commissioning phases

Required Skills:

Bachelor degree in Instrument or Control Engineering or related field
Minimum of 10 years of experience in Offshore facility as discipline engineer with proven track record, Detailed Engineering, Site construction and Projects management & execution.
Having experiences with FPSO setting is an added advantage.
Must have a good understanding of process and facilities design and production operations including a broad range of expertise on conceptual, basic design development, detail design development, construction/installation, commission/startup and production operations of Offshore oil and gas projects
Good command of written and spoken English
This position is open for local candidates or someone with work rights in the country
We regret to inform only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

  • Minimum of 10 years of experience in Offshore facility as discipline engineer with proven track record, Detailed Engineering, Site construction and Projects management & execution.
  • Having experiences with FPSO setting is an added advantage.
  • Must have a good understanding of process and facilities design and production operations including a broad range of expertise on conceptual, basic design development, detail design development, construction/installation, commission/startup and production operations of Offshore oil and gas projects
  • Good command of written and spoken English
  • This position is open for local candidates or someone with work rights in the country
  • We regret to inform only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

Skills: Communication, Appointment Scheduling, Cold Calling, Contact Centers, Key Performance Indicators, Lead Generation, Sales Operations, Sales Processes, Teamwork, Telemarketing
Job desc:
JOB DESCRIPTION:
· Make calls to potential customers to schedule appointments for sales team(s) to present opportunities to prospective customers.
· To Inspire the customers to become monthly supporters for campaigns that our company is involved in.
· Share information about our products and services by following marketing scripts.
· Be actively involved in sales and marketing to acquire new supporters by promoting and retaining a long-term relationship with customer.
· To achieve Daily & Monthly KPIs/ Calls and Appointments made.
· Other responsibilities as requested and assigned by Supervisor or the Manager
· To build relationships and communicate with customers over the telephone the nature of the invitation.

Company name: Career International - Global Talent Search Team
Location: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Job desc:
Job Title: B2B SALES & DIGITAL MARKETING (Malaysian)
Location: KL Sentral, Malaysia

POSITION SUMMARY:

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Contacting new and existing customers via telephone and email on a daily basis, identifying sales opportunities and providing these businesses with the best solution for their business goal
- Manage a portfolio of SMB clients with responsibility for growing revenue
- Acquiring new advertisers within the small and medium business (SMB) space
- Provide pre and post-sales support for all products
- Provide product and tool support to improve clients’ experience and drive higher product adoption and spend
- Become an expert on all social media advertising solutions (including Instagram)
- Ability to identify trends and solve problems facing multiple SMB clients
- Providing vital product insights and feedback from our customers to engineering
- Champion and produce success stories for customers who have had success in growing their business by using our products have used our products to grow their business
- Use a variety of tools including MS Excel, Salesforce and others to research, communicate and sell to the customer
- Ability to speak, read and write fluent English/Native

Skills: Problem Solving, Business Process Improvement, Computer Science, Contact Centers, Employee Benefits, IT Services, Information Systems, Service Desk, Teamwork, Ticketing Systems
Job desc:
1. Actively troubleshoot to identify, assess, record, resolve and/or escalate incidents and service requests ensuring they are handled within an agreed time limit, within agreed processes and in a professional and customer sensitive manner.
2. Offering advice to end-users and customers on all in scope IT services, how to troubleshoot and ensuring standards are met. This will include working as part of a team, in order to share knowledge and work together to increase performance standards.
3. Logged all calls reported into the incident ticketing system.
4. To work closely with the Account technical and administration teams on user issues and problem resolution.
5. Help to implement and improve processes and procedures within the team allowing strong service-focused deliverable.
6. Maintain and accurately update customer's enquirers, problem and resolution into incident ticketing system.
7. Generates management reports.
8.Willing to perform shift rotation 24/7. (Shift Allowance will be given)
9. Perform other duties as assigned
Requirements:
Diploma in IT/ Information System / Computer Science
At Least 2 - 3 years or above of SERVICE DESK / DESKTOP SUPPORT experience in Call Centre is a MUST.
Fluent Cantonese & Mandarin as needed to support Hong Kong users.
Willing to work based on 24/ 7 shift rotation ( 4 - 5 working days), WEEKEND MIGHT NEED TO WORK.
Job Type: Full-time

Salary: RM2,500.00 - RM3,500.00 per month

Benefits:
Opportunities for promotion
Professional development
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Night shift
Rotational shift
Weekend jobs
Supplemental pay types:
Performance bonus
Ability to commute/relocate:
Iskandar Puteri: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)
